description: Easily the best sandwich I've had in a long time. I got the Hermine: Pastrami, brisket, corned beef, Munster, pickles, etc. Can't beat that combo. The bread was perfect as well , fresh and not too thick. Doesn't hurt that they've got Cleveland stadium mustard for sale as well :)
author: Nicolas H.

description:
I think it's safe for me to say that the $$ sandwich for Deli Board is the single best sandwich I've ever had. It's absolutely to die for. With that said, the sandwich comes at a big price - $15. I wish the sandwiches here were a little cheaper, but I'm still willing to go back because of how great they are.

Their business hours are also a little bit annoying - 11-3pm Mon-Sat, meaning that lunch time is really the only time of day to go. Expect a big line every time you show up.

If they were able to reduce their prices and extend their hours, I'd give them 5 stars. This place is a must visit in San Francisco though, and I highly recommend for anyone looking for a great sandwich.
author: Blake S.

description:
What a great deli sandwich.  Ordered the Boca as it was the first one listed on the Sando board.  No regrets.  Warm and toasty soft bread with lots of meat - corn beef, brisket, and pastrami with melted cheese. Gratis - two chunks of dilled pickles in a sandwich baggie.

You order at the back counter; provide your name; grab a seat; and your wrapped sandwiches are brought to your table.  I had planned to eat 1/2 only; then bring the other 1/2 home; but it was so good that I coudln't resist and ate the whole thing.

A very informal place with seating for about 20+ people.  

Every day there are daily specials posted on a clipboard hanging on the wall by the cashier.  Will check that out next time.

There are other menu items too but it's called a deli for a reason.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Best sandwich I've ever had. Likely one of the top ten meals of my life. It was perfect. 

I got the Shawty which was a combo of meats, cheese, slaw and sauce on perfect bread. Every bite was amazing, the ratios of each ingredient was spot on. 

My dining mate got the Gyro which had lettuce, sauce and gyro meat. He described it as unbelievable.
author: Kjerstin S.

description: Worth the wait in line. Fabulous very thinly sliced turkey, fresh bread, creative sauces. Friendly service.
author: Vicki L.

description:
Great Yelp referral.   We  thoroughly enjoyed our "Samantha" and "Ron" :)  

Tip:  They serve you in order. Pay attention to who was in front of you :) That way you won't accidentally claim someone else's lunch.
author: Tracy W.

description:
My attempts at poetry:

This one is called "Seariously, Deli board?"
Oh lord.
Deli board.
I wasn't floored.
I nearly snored.

Here's a haiku review, it's called "Okay sandwiches"
Deli board is okay
It's an overpriced Quiznos
Don't believe the hype

I think San francisco has some sandwich joints that have really good sandwiches (the "good joints") and some sandwich joints that are all about hype (the "hype joints").  Deli board is a hype joint, no doubt.  Your friends and coworkers will talk about how great the place is. Don't be fooled.  Your friends are lying to you to trick you into looking like a fool.  Deli board is an elaborate scheme to make people like you and I eat Quiznos type sandwiches at $12 prices.   

Now, I may be being a bit hyperbolic, but relative to a better lunch like lunchpad, this place disappoints and since it's in soma when you walk outside you inevitable smell a smell so unappetizing that you worry you may have eaten Thai food the night before and have now lost all control over your bowels.  I don't take friends who I like to deli board.  I will go if my coworkers suggest it.

All-in-all it's an okay place for an occasional sandwich.  The smell outside seriously put me off to the sandwich.
author: Alex H.

description: We are visiting from San Diego. We stopped here for lunch. Sandwiches were amazing! The lady who ordered our food came off as being really rude. Minus her being rude the place was great.
author: Kenyatta C.

description:
So they're turning away people who want to buy more than x sandwiches per person?  With an empty store?  Sound business logic guys, I don't think.

Hipster douchebags.
author: David T.

description:
So happy to be ELITE '12...YELP ROCKS!!!!!!!!!!!!! :)

Anyway, popped into their new location around lunchtime today and picked up three Boca sandwiches to go.  Two regular ones for my dad and girlfriend and one special on Dutch Crunch for me.  Somehow it seems criminal to call any Deli Board sandwich regular...LOL  

Parking was surprisingly easy on Folsom for noon on a Friday.  This new location is so nice!  I placed my order and as I was waiting, I was greeted by Adam (always a great guy!!!) and another cool guy who works there.  The new place is beautiful and with more seating area than I ever expected, I really liked what they did with it.  Even then, with the nice weather, I ended up going outside to wait.  Hey, old habits die hard!!!  I guess somehow I got used to hanging outside while my sandwich is being made.

And what a sandwich it was!!!  Someone was nice enough to bring a bag with my order outside to me and I discovered that it is an easy hop onto the freeway from there.  I admit I drove faster than I should have on my way home since I was hungry and wanted to eat it while it was still warm.  I even kept the sunroof closed which is highly unusual for me, but I didn't want my sandwiches to get cold.  Happy to say that I accomplished my purpose...if you saw a black flash go by headed southbound SF on 101/280 around lunchtime, it was probably me. :)

My sandwich was pure heaven as always and my dad and girlfriend who had never before experienced Deli Board really enjoyed the experience as well.  They too, are now hooked on these killer sandwiches.  The pickles were really great too...bigger and better than ever.

I love Deli Board...like I always say, Yelp has enriched my life with so many incredible foodie finds such as this.  I love Deli Board, I love Yelp, I love you all...Happy New Year!!!
author: Roy N.

description: Love sandwiches and loved my first Jackson sandwich. Yummy and satisfying. It's how a sandwich should be! The side pickle and playing vinyl also is a fantastic touch. Yes, I hear it's on the pricey side but so worth it.
author: Ernestine A.

description:
These sandwiches are seriously mammoth.  I'd advise you to split yours with a loved one.  If you don't, you won't be able to resist the giant flavor that accompanies the size.  It's a recipe for the perfect overeating storm.

They've got a beautiful salad menu, so you can stay healthy if you decide.  Even the healthiest among us should still try a sandwich, at least once.  On my day of indulgence, I opted for Reuben's Cousin. The corned beef, sauerkraut, Swiss cheese, 
and Board sauce on a sweet french roll made for on of the best Reubens I'd ever had.

The employees were pleasant and welcoming, which earned Deli Board that fifth star.
author: Will L.

description:
Oh Deli Board, how I long for thee.  These sandwiches are GOOD and well worth the wait, so if you see a line don't be deterred. Just be patient. Wait.

The salads, although alright do not compare to the warmed goodness of a decent loaf of bread covering your meaty insides with deliciousness.  This hip trendy spot will never go out of style.  

And they deliver too!  On bikes! So order ahead.
author: Kevin J.

description:
I wish I lived in San Francisco because the food here is just too great.

My boyfriend and I were in the area looking for lunch, and Deli Board just happened to be on his list of places to go. So we waited in line (which looked long, but wasn't bad), and ended up ordering a sandwich.

I ordered the Hubert, which was pretty damn good. That bread...mmm. So delicious. Unfortunately, I could only finish half of it because I'm a light eater. I had to throw away the other half because there was no space in my belly and it was sitting out in the hot car all day. That made me terribly sad. Not only do I hate wasting food, but I hate wasting GOOD food :(

I forgot what my boyfriend ordered, but unlike me, he KILLED his sandwich really fast.

If I lived in this area, or even worked around this area, I would come here to eat quite often. One sandwich can probably be good for two days of lunch.
author: Sandra C.

description: I ordered Zeke & I liked how the bread was warm and thin & there wasn't too much or too little in the sandwich.
author: Melanie N.

description: The Mick cause I like Big Mac's.
author: Leland H.

description:
Brilliant sandwiches.
Would love to try entire range! 

Very nice staff. Friendly and casual dining place. 

Recommended.
author: Ben M.

description: One of our favorite restaurants in the city. We make the trip, which is very out of our way, at least once a week. Why? Best sandwiches in the city. Hands down. Also, great appetizers (if they happen to have one - jewshi, newshi, platter, whatever - GET IT), soups, and salads. And hot sauces. Super tasty housemade hot sauces in rotating flavors. But really cannot overstate how PHENOMENAL the sandwiches are. Don't forget to check the specials board or you might miss out on the BK breakfast sandwich, the meaty gyro, the messy Italian beef, the cheesesteak I myself keep missing, or something else exciting.
author: Veronica L.

description: A tasty ripoff. Rye Project gives you more quality bang for the buck.
author: J L.

description:
3.5 stars rounded to 4. Come before 12 to avoid the line. 

Meat heavy sandwiches :D My friend and I split the Ron with lettuce instead of coleslaw. We weren't that hungry, so we decided to split- but was more than enough! :D The Ron has roast beef, cheddar sauce, jalapeños, avocado, cole slaw (we substituted lettuce), and board sauce on garlic French bread. Delicious!!

Was a tad expensive. Deli Board has a more extensive menu than the Sentinel, but I think Sentinel is a bit more original and more bang for your buck. If you are in the neighborhood, definitely worth checking out.

Will be back.
author: Food E.

description: Awesome sandwiches, super friendly staff, great music on the turntable. Casual environment on a Sunday at lunch.  What more could you want?
author: Bobby O.

description: Came back to try a sandwich, which was rather good. They're pretty filling despite not being super long because they're chock of meat and cheese and whatnot. I really liked the Dutch crunch roll, perfect complement to my pastrami sandwich. Definitely get that as your bread! I made my own sandwich, and got pastrami with lettuce, onions, coleslaw. I'm not a pastrami connoisseur but I enjoyed the pastrami and all the contents came together well. All in all an enjoyable sandwich, but I still can't wrap my mind around paying $16 for it. If you're health conscious this is also not the place for you, not many veggie options and most sandwiches are chock full of meat and sauce and cheese. Glad I've tried it once, but probably wouldn't bother to come back again.
author: Jenny W.

description: Ok so it was worth the 5 block trek from my office to procure a high quality bundle of meat clasp between soft and toasty bread. I ordered the salami sandwich in fear that their super creations would be overloaded, but found my sandwich a bit plain. There was too much meat for my preference, overpowering any cheese or sauce flavor. Nevertheless, it was still an awesome sandwich probably saved by the soft crusty bread and thinly sliced salami. Next time when I decide to treat myself to a $14 sandwich, I'll probably entrust the experts with the sandwich creating.
author: Royce L.

description: We happened to be enjoying a rainy day in the city. I was craving a yummy sandwich and my friend was wanting a filling salad. We braved the elements and were very satisfied with the yumminess we encountered! I had a custom roast beef sandwich on a warm and crisp Dutch crunch roll filled with roast beef that was also warm and delicious! Such a great treat on a rainy day.
author: Radsurfbabe L.

description: As solid a sandwich that you will find in SF.  They mistakenly made me the wrong sandwich, offered to make a new one but really I am not picky. You really can't go wrong here, every sandwich I have had has been phenomenal. Funny thing is that when I went in two weeks after the sandwich snafu, I mentioned "make sure it is the right one". Kidding around. She remembered what I ordered and what was given to me and assured me it would be the right one. Seriously?  You remembered from two weeks ago?   We also get deli board catered from time to time at our office and the bread comes fresh and warm, a really nice touch. If you work in the area, you should contact them for catering, they are outstanding. They set everything up and plenty there is plenty of food.
author: Chris G.

description: Big, wholesome sandwiches. They don't skimp on the meat. Personally, I would prefer more dressing as the sandwich can get a little bit dry.
author: George K.

description:
Dream Team is back in action and today we went to get sandwiches. 

Deli board's Skully was SO good. The dutch crunch was warm, the turkey and the salami were delicious, and their board sauce had great heat. I didn't like the addition of cheddar to the sandwich, and there wasn't really a need for board sauce and mayo, but I would still absolutely get that sandwich again.  1/2 is enough for one meal, I swear. (Seriously. Stop at half or risk sandwich coma.)

Their salads are also surprisingly delicious and fresh for a sandwich place. Adding 1/2 a salad to half a sandwich is an excellent idea. 

Oh, and last but not least- HOMEMADE PICKLES. SO GOOD. Wow.  Get here a touch before noon or be prepared to wait.
author: Emily D.

description:
Torn. 

On one hand, the sandwiches are really tasty here and they don't skimp on meat BUT on the other hand, it is $15+ for a sando. And it isn't like the sandwich is the size of a small baby. But the quality is up there. And yes, some will argue that you pay for quality and only in America do we complain about a sandwich being the size of your arm as "too small". 

Ok, so with all that said I will say this...YES I would recommend you at least try it once. They are solid and I'm glad I did. But now I will just check it off my list, and move on to explore other creations.
author: Seisha L.

description:
Truly one of the very best sandwich experiences of my life. Adam, the owner, sticks to the basics delivering updated versions of tried and true favorites. The very best ingredients served piping hot to your table with a friendly smile is the secret to this must try eatery. 
Great as a hangover cure or just a treat to make your day. Vinyl spins in the background while you sit elbow to elbow with SOMAs digerati, bike messengers and 'suits'. The word is out - this Cleveland boy's made good.... real good.
author: Chris R.

description:
Need a few more ounces of meat on the bread......

A little more hype for me for a sandy shop. Great idea, but they skimp on the meat for what you pay for. 

Food - its good, but they should stack that sandwich like a real deli. Not pretend we are on a diet.

I would give 4 stars for the food if they gave you a better value. 

Service - Good 
Cleanliness - Average
Crowd and Hype - Over the top 
Price - Not really worth what's in the bag or the wait.
author: Baron C.

description:
I do love me some meat (hehe). If you want a massive meatwich, look no further. As you can see from my posted photo, they do not play with their carvings. Sandwiches are like 10% bread, 10% extras, 80% animals. And it's glorious. 

I rolled up at about 11:50am-ish, just in time to beat the lunch time crowds. We ordered, and got a scored a table pretty quickly. But in the next couple minutes line was out the door. Meals came to our table and they we delicious-o. Warm, toasted bread but soft, and meat-galore. I was extremely pleased. 

While I would've gotten a room with the sandwiches and the taste factor alone was enough for me to grant a 5-star rating, I have to dock a star for the following. Sandwiches took a while to come out, I would NOT be happy if I had to deal with that line, and the water is behind the counter and they're given out in small cups making refills close to impossible.
author: Jon C.

description:
Drastically over rated and over priced, even by 2015 SF standards.

It was a nice addition to the neighborhood a few years ago...I would have given it a solid 4-star rating then...but the prices have just about doubled in the last three-four years. The hipster attitude and ambiance is merely an added annoyance. Waiting to place an order while the cashier is selecting and playing a vinyl record, for all the "cute" factor, rates as an "smh" when one is just trying to get lunch within a short timeframe.
author: Boogee Z.

description:
Back again for the first time in 2 years. Have they changed?

Yes.  They are even better.  Think I just had the best sandwich of my life.

Stop messing around and get in here.
author: Rob W.

description:
My husband and I had lunch here last Saturday and decided to share a sandwich.
We had the corned beef and pastrami combo.
The meat was absolutely the leanest I have ever had.  Delicious and no indication of any fat what so ever.
It was as good as it gets-what more can I say...wish they would open another location in the east bay!
author: Diane W.

description:
Ambiance:  This place is ... easy?  That may not be the best word.  With the oversized menu on the wall, the specials of the day (literally, on a clip board), a rather typical service bar up front, and cute yet humble tables, this place is the epitome of Steve-Jobs-esque-simplicity.  That being said, the charm of this simplicity will win you over, such that (unlike some places that try too hard and fail) you'll feel perfectly at ease here.  Don't be surprised if you get lost in conversation while waiting for your sandwich.

Service:  Easy pweasy.  You order.  You sit.  They bring you your order.  Donezo.  

Food:  Very good... almost too good... or perhaps too rich.  Wait, can you ever have food that is too rich?  I don't think so.  Go here if you're looking for a decent to large to oversized portion of meat in your sandwich (I assume the veggies are overstuffed too) and be prepared to be very happy once you leave.  Still, I found that maybe, just maybe, there was too much meat in my sandwich, such that it detracted from the rest of the elements of my meal.  Note that the bread is usually baked in house, a la deliboardsf.com, and that you can certainly tell that this is the case by TASTING IT.  The Dutch Crunch, for one, was amazing!

My only qualms were that the line was out the door, which made for a somewhat stuffy atmosphere, and that the tables were really, really close together.  I get it, that's how a business is run, so that's fine.  I wonder if it wouldn't make sense for the management to petition for a parklet out front.  I'm sure that there are several who would disagree with me on that point, being that parking is limited as it is, but I think it could do more good than harm; businesses succeed or fail, first and foremost, via word of mouth and presentation.  A line out the door is a GOOD thing, yes, but seeing people actually sitting out in front of Deli Board would a) reduce congestion inside and b) bring in more foot traffic.  It's a win/win!

TIP:  Order ahead?

TIP:  The bread is made in house... YUM

TIP:  The water comes in small cups and getting a refill can be a pain.  Consider bringing your own water and/or ordering a drink.  Or, Deli Board, can you consider moving it out from behind the counter?

4 out of 5!
author: Bryan H.

description: I heard a lot about this place. Decided to try the Chicken Salad. It was the most disappointing salad I have ever had. Dry chicken, bland dressing and presentation like a airplane meal.
author: Matt A.

description:
Possibly the home of the biggest, most stuffed sandwiches in SF, Deli Board has housemade sauces, extra thin extra tasty meat, and Board pickles. The decorations include "Cleveland" spelled out in large red letters, so the Chairman of the Board's sandwiches must be inspired by Cleveland style sandwiches.

* Sha Sha ($9) http://s3-media4.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/C1e_KkoYMOPRAjvtEd3mxQ/l.jpg: board sauce, an inch of extra thin sliced turkey breast, crispy bacon strips, Muenster cheese, sweet grilled caramelized onions, jalapenos on a fresh, warm, soft Dutch crunch roll. It was supposed to come with house slaw but I'm not sure where the slaw was. The bread-to-filling ratio was heavily in favor of meat and filling (roll was on the thin side but held the contents well). Great bread, great fillings and thick pickle slices on the side = delicious food coma.

You can design your own sandwich ($8 - $9) or choose a specialty sandwich (brisket, corned beef, chicken salad, tuna salad, pastrami, etc.). They also have salads with housemade dressings and soups.

The décor is minimal (brown and red color theme) but cute - especially the giant clipboards. Chairs are plastered with stickers from other local businesses.
author: Lolia S.

description:
I decided to trek with some coworkers for lunch for these sandwiches that were described as 'oh so epic'. 

The bread -- soft.
The selection -- so diverse yet everything sounds good. Our group traded halves, and nobody had any complaints.
The price - Expensive sandwich, but you will not regret ordering it.

I had the Hermine -- the diverse 3-meat, board sauce, mustard combination. It was delicious. Melt in my mouth.

Highly recommend this spot for an awesome gourmet sandwich!
author: Trevor M.

description:
If you love sandwiches, you'll LOVE deli board. I got their Boca and wasn't disappointed. Warm and toasted, lots of sauce, melted cheese...portions aren't ginormous like little luccas but it's still a pretty heavy sandwich. I ate half for lunch and the other half for dinner; still good later :) 

I still think about you, Deli. I will be back.
author: Alesia T.

description:
A girl once bought Deli Board, and then surprised me by delivering it to my then office way down in Foster City, and asked me out. I was a bit of a commitment-phobe and had been sitting on the fence about being in a relationship.

A pastrami sandwich from here fixed that right away.
author: Rui R.

description:
In one word, YUM!! Quality ingredients really make the sandwiches here sing. It's pretty pricy for a sandwich, but trust me, it's well worth it. The meats are thinly slices and so flavorful, they practically melt in your mouth. The bread here taste fresh baked, warm and with just the right amount of bite/crunch. 

I've tried three sandwiches:

The Zeke - turkey, avocado, cream cheese, baconpickled red onion, house slaw, board sauce on French roll

The Cohen - corned beef, brisket, white american, cherry peppers, house slaw, board sauce. brown mustard on French

The Bendersky (a special of the day sammy) - brisket, salami, muenster, cherry peppers, pickled onion, russian dressing on French

Of the three, I like the meat sandwiches more than the turkey, but that's just because I prefer red meat over poultry. If you like a bit of heat in your food, definitely try a sandwich with the cherry peppers -- they certainly pack a punch. Do get here early to avoid the lines.
author: Alice W.

description: Sandwiches are good. Customer service is extremely poor, the staff is inflexible, will not accommodate large orders and management supports this. There are better sandwich shops in this city.
author: Anna N.

description:
My impressions for the Gold-n-Berg-n-stein sandwich

Ingredients: Corned beef, pastrami, kosher salami, muenster, house slaw, 1000 island, french roll

Price: $13

Comments
It's a delicious sandwich that is neatly prepared. Unfortunately the muenster was overpowered by the meats which isn't a bad thing, but I wish I could taste the cheese. Also, the house slaw is spread a little thin IMO. As for the bread roll, it's perfect. Soft, crisp, and delicious. The only two downers are: 

1) The $13 price tag - For what you get, it's a few dollars too high
2) The size of the sandwich is surprisingly small for the amount you're paying.
author: Alfonzo J.

description:
I've tried the $$$ and the Carzle. These hot sandwiches didn't disappoint at all. Good ratio meat:veggies/bread. 

I want to buy the shirt so I could rep DELI BOARD all day!
author: Terrance M.

description:
The company men and I heart deli board. This is one place where I have absolutely no trouble ordering my sandwich, because I'm going right down the list and won't stop til I'm done!

Buttered and toasted is the bread, and moist, flavored, plentiful is the meat. I consider this one of the best wet/off-dry sandwiches I've had, especially with the dill that comes with it.
author: Christophe C.

description:
This is the best place you're not eating at. It's tucked away in a little stretch of Soma you only know if you live here or work here (or you spend too much time in the leather bars), but if you love tasty sandwiches (and you do, since you're on Yelp), you really need to try Deli Board. It's open Monday-Saturday for lunch from 11am-4pm, so don't expect to pop by on Saturday night, but the small-bite-but-doesn't-feel-like-it brisket, pastrami or beef will make you melt. You also get two giant pickle slices to seal the deal. 

I wish they had more options for chips besides their current stock (way too calorie heavy), but all in all, this makes a great lunch place. (However, it's ridic packed from 12-2pm on weekdays, so try to come during the off hours.
author: Kevin B.

description:
Want a sammy stuffed with meat and isn't drowning in sauce?  Then Deli Board is the place for you.  I first came here on  Monday close to closing time, but they still let us order and eat our sammy at their table.  We split a Boca and since we ate there, they gave us some extra pickles to try.  

The meat has such good flavor, there's no need for any special sauces. They literally put on a huge pile of meat.  The bread is toasted just right so its still soft yet crispy and it absorbs all the meaty juices.  Their pickles are the real deal.  They're crispy and not overly salty.  

The best part is that they have delivery via bike messenger.  I was at AT&T Park for a game on a Saturday, and they rode out and met us at the Safeway.  Great service!
author: Patra I.

description:
Delicious sandwiches!  Everything is super fresh and juicy.  The French bread is crunchy and thin.  The sour kraut is so fresh!

However, the place is so full of tech bros that you can't have a conversation.  The line is really long and looks like the twitter cafeteria folks.  Better for delivery or takeout.
author: M S.

description: What possessed me to try a sandwich made of tuna salad and falafel?!?!!   This was the most disgusting combination ever conceived in the history of sandwiches.  They also add sprouts as the icing on the cake for this mushy mess of a sandwich.  No crunch, no texture.   Just wet gross combination of flavor.  Makes me gag just recalling it to write the review.
author: Pauline C.

description: Hot roast beef and munster cheese todsy, exceptionally good!!!  Try any of Adam's soups and / or salads if you are not up for a sandwich.
author: Marvin G.

description:
Is there a better place in San Francisco to get a hot sandwich? I can't imagine there is. If you have not been to Deli Board it is a must that you try it. They have a set menu on the wall and a few specials that change daily. You will definitely find something to your liking. I devoured my Boca sandwich and had a taste of both sandwiches the ladies had. Loved every bite!

This is my new go-to place for a great sandwich for lunch.

Closes at 4pm
author: Frank J.

description: I came here for lunch with a friend last week and while the line was long, we decided to stick around and were so glad we did. I had the Fay sandwich, which was insanely delicious - and I'm not a person that's fond of sandwiches to begin with. This was different - the ingredients were fresh, and the meat? Juicy and tender. In fact, I refuse to believe what they market as "turkey" is actually the stuff I normally douse with gravy to make it edible. Sandwiches are a bit pricey at around $14 but they're huge and sharable, so it's really not much more than a Subway sandwich. Though infinitely better. And they have glass bottle coke. #nuffsaid
author: Ariana A.

description: Not good or bad. Sandwiches are okay. Bread was fresh, ingridents were nice, but the spices and combination wasn't spectular.  They do a good job making sure the sandwich isn't soggy. Staff is super friendly though.
author: David L.

description: Sandwich was good, not excellent.  I get that the quality of the products are high, but asking to pay $15 per sandwich and not exceeding my expectations is a lot to ask.  With as many different sandwich choices in the city, I probably won't return, but I totally get where you are coming from.
author: Shaun C.

description: Best Sandwich deli ever! Hands down the best. We are from the central valley and we always have to stop here every time we are in the area. Its soo good. Everything is a must try, the Zeke, Boca, Fatty Matty, and pickled peppers and fresh pickles. Definitely our fav deli!
author: Adrian Z.

description: First time ever sandwich was bungled. Goldnberg without the slaw. Showed the counter help and adam (owner for non regulars) immediately stepped in and apologized. Made me a new sandwich and let me keep the bungled sandwich. Even without the slaw the sandwich is a 10... Just saying. But i was so impressed with his response! Customer is king here, nothing short of perfection allowed!
author: Kelly K.

description:
Bo-ca....Bo-ca...Bo-ca.  Think Bluto in Animal House trying to fire up the Deltas for a toga party they shouldn't have (because they're on double secret probation) but will do anyways because they cannot resist (to-ga...to-ga...to-ga).  That is what I think about Deli Board's Boca sandwich...oh delicious blend of melty meat (brisket, pastrami, and corned beef) and cheese with Cleveland stadium mustard and their board sauce.  You complete me.

Best sandwich place in the city!  Super cool staff spinning vinyl and carrying out little tastes of heaven one sandwich at a time.  Adam Mesnick you rock!

I personally like to order one up and then head down to City Beer Store and enjoy it with a tasty beer (see photo).

Don't be a Neidermeyer, eat at Deli Board!
author: Mike Z.

description:
Delicious!  FAT sandwiches with great flavor and texture.  Get there a little before lunch time as this place is popular and the line gets long.
It's def worth the wait.
author: Yesi K.

description: Been going here for years and it's always delicious. Knocking off a star for value. What used to be a $9 sandwich when I first started eating here is now $15.
author: Kae A.

description:
Blew my mind. We order Deli Board to be catered to the office on a pretty regular basis, but its usually just a selection of meats and breads to make your own sandos. We walked over last week since they were on the 7x7 and it was nothing like I expected it to be. 

The boca is quite possibly one of the most delicious and dangerous sandwiches I've ever had. Pastrami, Brisket and Corned Beef. Its the perfect gluttonous sandwich. I can't wait to try the rest.
author: Lauren D.

description:
Meat heaven. Get. In. My. Mouth. NOW!

Walking down 6th, AKA hobo alley, AKA rape village, AKA port-o-potty city, toward Folsom I thought, "This better be fuckin worth it". And boy was it ever. 

Since it was my first time there my lunch buddy said I had to get the boca. I thought all that meat would just blend together into one salty meaty mouthful. No. I was wrong. You taste the tender sweet brisket, salty/peppery pastrami and corned beef in separate waves of flavor that stand out on their own and then later merge to have a delicious meat baby topped with melted cheese all wrapped in warm soft sweet french bread. I thought, french bread? I WANT DUTCH CRUNCH! No. Stick with the french bread my wise lunch buddy said. He was right. Oh god I love you Deli Board. 

Side note: I don't like pickles but theirs were soooooo good. Not too tangy or sour. They were also SUPER crispy and perfect with the samme!
author: Beverly T.

description:
Dear Deli Board, it has been 3 days and 3,000 miles since we parted.  Last time I saw you, it was my second time in five days that I visited you.  I wish I could say that I tried two different things when I stopped by, but I didn't.  I went with the RLM which was roast beef, provolone, and board sauce on garlic french bread both times.  I skipped the slaw which your people so graciously left out at my request.

Your bread was baked, yet soft, and so so fresh like west coast rhymes and the sweet air off of the pacific. The meat was packed on, mouth watering, delicious, and heaven with every bite.  Each bite was big, but not as big as the flavor you bestowed upon me.  

It was by far and away the best sandwich I have ever had, and I had it twice while I was in SF for only 5 days.

Deli Board, I'm writing to say, one day I'll see you again, and it'll probably be the first thing I do once I get back into town.
author: Cliff W.

description:
This really is as good as it gets. Albeit this is a substantial walk from my office (15-20 minutes), its worth every second. If I'm ever craving a sandwich, or a salad, Deli Board never fails to deliver (fun fact : It also gets auto-corrected to Delhi Board on my phone, which always makes me laugh and think of home).

Make sure you try their specials (new every day), but if they're out, don't fret, their fixed sandos are AMAZING too! And the portions are ginormous (and since I love pickles, the free pickle on the side is AWESOME!)

Whenever I want to feel a little healthier (usually when I've eaten junk for breakfast), I get their salad. Now, don't be fooled, because their salad is enough for 2 people and their pet dog, so in no way am I trimming off any calories, but looking at green leafy things makes me feel healthier (that's how it works right?)

And to top it all off, if the amazing sandwiches and salads (and root beers and sodas) weren't enough, their staff is top notch. Cute girls who try to memorize your name, crack jokes and make conversation with you while you order. Come for the sandwiches, stay for the sandwiches and the staff.

5/5.
author: Aabhas S.

description:
I've been here twice. I'm not sure if this is bad ordering or just bad luck, but both resulted in sandwiches I couldn't finish.

The first time, a friend brought me. I got the Emmeline (I think that's what it is called). It's a falafel/hummus/sprouts type-sandwich. I honestly can't remember if I asked them to heat it or if it comes this way, but on the first bite, I ended up with a giant mouthfull of hot sprouts. Eating heated sprouts is a surprisingly gross exerience. It might have been mitigated if the sandwich had any flavor, but it did not, so all I recall was getting through half of the heated slimy sprouts before calling it a day and getting second lunch elsewhere.

I went there a second time because (1) I couldn't recall the name of the place and accidentally landed there post yelp-search thinking it was somewhere different and (2) 
I figured (as noted above) I might've messed up my own sandwich by asking them to heat it. This time, I ordered a skinny reuben (reuben with turkey) with cheddar (admittedly, might've messed it up again with a modification because I think it comes with swiss). I was just trying to make it more flavorful. Sandwich was edible, just really bland (isn't cheddar supposed to be sharper than swiss?). Meat was a little dry.

Is my palate just not as refined as those of the legions of other people who love this place? No idea. I literally don't get the high ratings and long lines. I will say, though, for the record, that I've never had a bad service experience. The counter girls are super nice and no one has ever chastized me for anything (as some others have been schooled, based on other reviews). The wait for me has been around 20 minutes each time.
author: Zika R.

description:
I adore these guys. The only reason I don't give them a full five stars is that the guys in back don't always pay attention to the special notes on the order, which is a problem as their only gluten-free dressing is the balsamic, and I ask for my salad tossed rather than the dressing on the side. (I joke with the ladies in front that I now have to smell my salad to make sure I'm getting the correct dressing.) The Samurai is definitely my favorite!

Adam (the owner) has a great sense about combining flavors, and seems to try to keep some variety to the menu. He also has brought in some delicious soups for cooler temperatures.

The cost might seem pricy, but you're essentially getting two full meals with each sandwich/salad... They are loaded! For a bit of a kick, try the custom hot sauces. You won't be disappointed.
author: Jeri J.

description:
Dear Ike,

You may have just been dethroned.

Sincerely,
-Sushi..err.. Sandwich Nazi.


Seriously, this place is good. DAMN good. They apparently get all of their meat imported from the midwest. The pastrami, brisket, etc are all nice and juicy. The cheeses they use add that extra saltiness that I crave, and their sauces complete the package. It was so good that I went there two weekends in a row. It's really hard to describe a great sandwich, because it's just a combination of bread, some meat, cheese, and sauce.. so I guess you'll have to try it to believe me.

Now, if they only opened up a storefront so that we can sit down and eat....
author: Kazu O.

description:
Every sandwich I've had here is so satisfying and hits the spot. A personal favorite is the Carzle, I just can't seem to get enough of the cherry peppers.

If you aren't in the mood for a sandwich, don't fret they have salads!  Are you a chicken salad, tuna salad or egg salad kinda person? Well if you can't decide they got this bomb called bubbees3. Yes allllll 3 in one. Jackpot!!!
author: Nho C.

description:
Sure, the sandwiches might be a bit on the expensive side, but that'll help me not eat here every day and endanger the tensile strength of  my belt.

Stopped in today for the first time and grabbed the  "Carzle", the pastrami and brisket combination was perfect, one of the best sandwiches I've ate, or I should say devoured, in quite sometime.

The line was long but moved fast, and the cherry vinyl-spinning staff were ever friendly, and made the wait for the order seem like no time at all. 

i picked up a "Zeke" for a co-worker, who saved her's until she had an opportunity to eat later in. 

About an hour later a received a simple text: O.M.G. that sandwich!"

needless to say, I'll be back.
author: Andy H.

description:
Sandwiches are actually one fo my favourite things to eat. I could probably eat one every day forever. You've got it all - meat, cheese, veggies and carbs - what more do you need? Problem is, when you love sandwiches so much, you get really disappointed when they suck. When a coworker suggested we try this spot for lunch, I was really excited. San Francisco does almost every food well, so why not sandwiches? We had a sandwich connoisseur with us from Warsaw who was even more excited than myself.

Deli Board did not let us down. Busy around 1 p.m. but the line moved quickly. Apparently the "board" that lists the daily specials changes regularly, and it's also posted on line (check out their website - it's amazing! And they do catering!). 

I ordered an AMAZING turkey sandwich with avacado, board sauce and other deli-cious things! What else could make this ginormous sandwich even more perfect? How about some yummy deli pickles that changed my life? Yes please!

We snagged some seats (there's a decent amount) and chowed down. It only took about 10 minutes for a group of five of us to get our food which was nice.

I feel like the smart, not glutton-like thing to do here would be to eat half your sandwich and take the rest home for another meal. They're that big. But of course, I was starving and felt like it was a bit of a challenge...soooo I ate it. All. At once.

If you're in San Fran and love sandwiches, you have to stop here. They also serve soups which I bet are awesome. Oh man, I wish this place was closer. However, my waist is probably glad it isn't...
author: Andrea B.

description:
UPDATE: April 1, 2011
I am officially bumping Deli Board to SOLID  5 STARS:

1. While waiting for my sammy at DB, I met Yelp friend Joanna M. who was also waiting for her sandwich. She is lovely on Yelp and equally lovely in person.
2. The owner, Justin, came out on this sweltering hot day and offered us ice cold water. Nice guy!
3. My co-worker who had the Bocca for the first time was so inspired by her sammy that she is thinking of opening a Yelp account just to talk about the glories of the Bocca.
4. My fiance is officially addicted to Bocca.
5. I had the Vera HOT out of the bag for the first time instead of eating it cold 4 hours later for dinner (still very yummy), but one bite of this warm melt in your mouth cheesy grilled eggplant sammy, and it's OMG!!!!! Foodgasm!

There--and this ain't no April Fool's! 

*****************************************************
REVIEW:

I passed by Howard Street one weekday at 11 am and I saw  a long line of people waiting in front of an unmarked  (now they put a logo on the window) disheveled-looking building.  I thought another social service agency opened up again at SoMa. They did not look like chronic homeless folks, though. Some of them were actually dressed nice. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/BcW0vRdM8N-rteR2FfV1jg?select=glYEBF_LJNv4-az-_9B4Mg

I became so curious I just had to find out after my meeting. 

These folks are hungry alright but they were not lining up for "free eats" . 1080 Howard is Deli Board. And DB does not have a storefront. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/BcW0vRdM8N-rteR2FfV1jg?select=sAFquhcpWjvpPDoZWTso5A http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/BcW0vRdM8N-rteR2FfV1jg?select=eURkTd3pl2ErPzvCvHPgUQ

HOW TO ORDER:
1. You order your sandwich by standing at the door.
2.  A friendly staff will come out, take and prepare your order. 
3. While you wait at the sidewalk. (Which explains the nicely dressed office worker peeps outside.)
4. Do not try to enter.  Big NO-NO!
5. Or call in your order for delivery or pick-up

But why stand in line when these  sammies can come to you?  Deli Board has  delivered my sammies to my workplace few times already.  I became a regular after I brought the BOCA to my fiance one Friday after work for dinner.  The man was hooked and he added a new word to his vocabulary: BOCA, please!


BOCA: Huge packed and dense sandwich filled with  pastrami corned beef and brisket muenster cheese Board sauce brown mustard pickles sweet french. The hungry man at home loves this! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/BcW0vRdM8N-rteR2FfV1jg?select=-8HWIOIgu4LgoYUphzMEAw

VERA: This has become a favorite and I actually started craving this after trying it for the first time. Grilled eggplant and squash cream cheese white american cheese pickled red onion pickles jalapeños Board sauce on dutch crunch. 
*A sumptous combination. Each ingredient marries each other well. Flavor orgy in my mouth! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/BcW0vRdM8N-rteR2FfV1jg?select=TxxpRk49Aoq6sb8fZiG6ew

I have ordered different sandwiches from Deli Board. They were all good but BOCA and VERA remain to be our favorite. Deli Board also sells salads, chips and Cokes in bottles/cans.

FREE DELIVERY  M- Sat 10:30 to 2:30 ($15 minimum):
A breeze! Sometimes I have to dial few times until I get a live person but in about 20 minutes, I am holding a heavy bag of sandwiches delivered right at my office door by a friendly staff on bike. 

BOTTOMLINE: 
1. Yummy quality sandwiches not for the faint-hearted or dainty appetite. 
2. All the sandwiches were hefty and heavy STUFFED with lots of meat and whole pickle in a ziplock bag.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/BcW0vRdM8N-rteR2FfV1jg?select=HFVwJKJjR3sZ0y0I62_Rvg
3.  The pickles were chunky, crunchy and reminded me of the deli pickles in New York. The bread is always fresh. The signature sauce compliments but does not overpower the sandwich.

Would I join those folks on the sidewalk if  ever Deli Board decides to not deliver anymore, you betcha! I am the one in the big sunglasses.

PRICE: $7-$9 per ginormous delicious sandwich.
author: Leah E.

description: DELICIOUS but at $15 a sandwich, it isn't somewhere we come very often. I got the Fay and really liked it and my fiancee got the Boca, which I believe they are known for. Seating is limited, so come before or after the lunch rush.
author: Sofia M.

description:
This place lived up to the hype and then some!  Wow - AMAZING sandwiches!!  

The place is definitely a carnivores dream with amazing corned beef, pastrami, brisket, etc. - but my wife, a vegetarian, had an equally powerful sandwichgasm as I did (she had the falafel sandwich).  

In my opinion this place blows Ike's out of the water - it's not even a contest.
author: Dan L.

description: Second best Pastrami next to Mays, in the City! Just really expensive for a sandwich. If you consider the time and love put into the meats sold here however it makes it all worth it! Try any of the combos they're great, but I like the pastrami best!
author: Gregory F.

description:
It brings me great pain to post this review, but I hope it falls on the eyes of the right person. Long story short, I have been a Deli Board customer since their first day in business. And I fear that Deli Board is changing for the worst. 

Back in the day, Deli Board was (literally) a window on Howard and 7th. You'd go up, order a sandwich from a paper menu, stand outside on the street, and then it would appear - almost magically. My co-workers and I literally went there every day, and for good reason. Awesome sandwiches (big enough for people with a hearty appetite), delicious side of pickles with every order, Danae (server) and Adam (owner I think) were the nicest people ever. Literally the best meat you could find on a deli sandwich. We had days where we'd skip breakfast just to tackle the Boca (brisket, pastrami, and corned beef). I loved the D-Nice (Turkey, Bacon, Hot Peppers), Skinny Rueben (Turkey Rueben), and Zeke (Turkey, Cream Cheese, and Sprouts). Ten million stars. This customer satisfaction led to Deli Board opening their very own location just a few blocks away on Folsom (where it is now). And it was awesome. Now we had an actual venue. A place you could sit down. I'd even bring clients there, as it was a true San Francisco spot that I loved. 

However, the last three times I have been to Deli Board, I have not had a good experience. For one, the service is worse than it used to be. The people who take your order are still fairly friendly, but the people who give you your sandwich don't really even look at you or smile. Second, prices are through the roof. Double what they were when Deli Board got started out. Third, you get less sandwich than you used to, so despite paying way more, you're more hungry. Fourth, you get less pickle than you used to. Fifth, they aren't running some of the sandwiches that they used to make, even for loyal customers. Sixth, the atmosphere was about getting as much of my money as possible. I'm surprised that they didn't charge for napkins. 

Look - I get it. Businesses have to grow and have to make more money. They should charge more and increase product margins once they get more customers. 

However, Deli Board is on a bad trajectory. Their business no longer is about making the best sandwich, keeping customers happy, and ensuring customers come back. Their business is trending toward making you feel like you overpaid for something that wasn't worth it. 

I hope this trajectory changes, as this used to be a place I truly loved. There are a ton of other sandwich shops within walking distance of Deli Board that have just as good a product. Go there instead.
author: Kane R.

description:
3.5 Stars.

Not sure what all the hype is about, sandwiches are solid but not phenomenal. Maybe I haven't tried the right ones. Zeke is a good, but it's just another turkey sandwich and I can get that for much cheaper elsewhere.

I do love their pickles though! And even though it takes a while to make your sandwich, the service is good. For that I leaned towards 4-stars instead of 3.
author: Christina N.

description:
Wow, really? Even day old subs taste amazing! Just finished devouring half a day-old Fatty Matty (albacore tuna salad, falafel, muenster, hummus, pickled onion, sprouts, Board sauce, sweet french roll)  that was left up for grabs from a work training luncheon. Didn't think it would still taste amazing, but it did. (I put it in the toaster oven first, then microwaved it for 20 seconds...oh and I added some Siracha sauce for a kick)

The perks of work training lunches. I originally had my first sub from Deli Board last week and went for the Zeke (turkey breast, avocado, bacon, cream cheese, pickled onion, sprouts, mayo, sweet french roll)  since I am not a big fan of the red meat options. Pretty darn tasty if you ask me. Have already recommended it to peeps and hope I can hit it up again in the near future. 

Even though I didn't pay for the sandwiches, I think they are worth the $10 a pop.
author: Lisandra M.

description: Food is good but the value, not so much.The sandwiches are delicious, the ingredients are top-notch and I like their t-shirts. But $20 for a sandwich and a coke at a place on Folsom and 7th? That's ridiculous.
author: Doctor S.

description: $14 for a deli sandwich sounds outrageous...until you eat one. Then you fall in love and will come back regardless of the price your lunch costs you. Pickles are great! Rubeneske and Diego were fantastic and my hubs comes here often with his colleagues. He's never been disappointed. Order at the counter and expect a very worthwhile 15 minute wait. Delish!
author: Megan K.

description:
've been here so many times and I never had a chance to write a review. If I could, I would give 10 stars!! 

This is a great Sandwich spot that holds a place in my heart! haha

The lines are usually long, put its not a long wait.
author: Charles A.

description:
I don't care where you have had 'the best sandwich' before, but you've never had a real sandwich til you had a Deli Board sando.

The place is new, and hipsterish. Photos on the wall are fun and i like the old school record player.

First time here and what we ordered:
Reuben's cousin and the RLM but with pastrami.
The meat..THE MEAT..the mouth watering, juicy mounds of meat is probably what sets this place apart. You can tell how much they care about their end product by just the meat alone.
I loved that the RLM is on garlic bread. No one uses garlic bread as the main vehicle and yet it's one of the best kinds of bread out there!

Pricey? Sure. Big for me, but my hungry bf needed to sneak a few bites off of my sando. Pickles on the side are tasty too. What to try next? well, everything. I enjoy the honesty with one of the salads, "Kinda Fatty".
author: Abigail W.

description:
Yeah, it's pretty darn good.  Pricey for a sandwich but the combo of meat and sauce in the $$ sandwich is killer.  Seriously, killer.  Thought I would only eat half but I shared with my friend and we had to get another one.

Came in around 1:20 on a Friday and the wait wasn't that bad. The sandwich took about 15 minutes.

My tip: as much as you analyze the menu and think you can create a better sandwich, just stick with the $$$ sandwich.  It's named that for a reason.  Also, the Zeke was pretty good too but not as good as the $$$.  Skip your health kick for a meal and just go all the way with the $$$.  The only substitution I would make is to get the dutch bread instead of the regular roll.  Anytime you see dutch bread as an option, you should always get that.  So good.

Also, place is pretty small so if you can't snatch a table during peak hours, it's probably best to just get it to-go.
author: Tammie C.

description:
There are only two places where one could describe a vegetarian sandwich as decadent: Ike's, and now, Deli Board.  I had the Gina, which consists of grilled veggies, sprouts,  hummus, feta spread, and melted munster cheese, yesssss.  One of my carnivorous coworkers actually commented on how good my sandwich smelled.  Ike's will always be my favorite, but I have to give a nod to this place for their superior dutch crunch bread.  It was perfectly baked - crunchy on the outside and soft and chewy inside.

The digs are a bit sketchy, just a kitchen, and you have to wait outside for your order, but if you get there early, you will avoid the long wait.  It's just around the corner from my office, and the word is already starting to get out; my coworker has already eaten here twice in the last week!
author: Laura C.

description: Delicious! Parking was challenging so I ended up paying the meter ($ on top of the $$$ sandwich). Sandwiches are priced  around $13 which comes to $14+ after tax, but they are packed with juicy meatiness and the bread was pure toasty, just the right chewy-ness goodness.  I had the Goldberg (w/ American pastrami) which was the right amount of meaty juicy goodness for me, not too fatty.  And the sandwiches come with tasty pickles. Service was friendly - they happily answered questions about the menu.  Will definitely be back!
author: Kathryn C.

description:
Good sandwiches. Not plentiful options. 

Not worth what you'll pay for it. The workers get really chummy with regular customers and are slow and dismissive toward new customers, as I found. 

I guess the fact that they're Cleveland-oriented is cool. Not something you see around often. 

Anyhow, overall not worth the money for what you get in service and food quality.
author: Chad R.

description:
Got a park right out front. Walked in around 240p no crowd at all. Checked all the different items on the menu and ended up getting the Bradley w/o peppers. It took a while and it was kinda weird to be in a sandwich shop and not smell anything or get to see your sandwich being made. But oh well, I'll still give it a try. I am paying $11 for it.. 

Get my bag and head to work. Get comfy at work and open up my package. It looks pretty good. It was pretty much just bread, meat and cheese. Was a little strange they don't put any veggies on it. The Board sauce was good. The meat was EXTREMELY salty. I couldn't even finish half of the half. I ended up giving to a co worker who eats anything. I'd rather have a sandwich from Togo's for have the price. Sorry
author: Ayana K.

description:
If, when you order a "turkey sandwich," you really mean "I would like an entire turkey's worth of meat in my sandwich," you'll like Deli Board.

Both the meat and the produce in the sandwiches are delicious, and obviously the portions are generous.

Definitely order ahead!  I showed up with a group of co-workers, and we waited for nearly 30 minutes outside the sandwich shop.  It appears most people call in or use the (free) delivery service.
author: Bill H.

description:
BOMB. 

Looking at the menu, all I could think was "I want that in my mouth". 

Ordered the "mish", and enjoyed every second of putting it in my mouth.

Also, they were making buffalo wings as a special and it smelled heavenly in there. And yes, as I smelled the wings all I could think was "I WANT THAT IN MY MOUTH!"
author: Justin H.

description: Just ate here again. Damn this is expensive but the VERY FIRST bite totally justified it. God damn is this good
author: Marcus R.

description:
Holy sandwich goodness!  Deli Board is legit - sooo many options and everything is pure YUM.  My favorite part is  the ample selection of hot sauces to add on your own - score!

The only beef I have with deli board is walking through super scary SF to get there.  It's only a few blocks from my office but the walk to and from definitely keeps me on my toes.  Luckily, the sammies are good enough to brave the streets for a taste.  MMMMMMM
author: Lindsey G.

description:
The beauty of Yelp is that we can discover places like the Deli Board that are such hidden and inconspicuous gems, that we may never find them otherwise.

I had the most amaayyzing sandwich (the Boca). The kind you bite into, and your eyes roll into the back of your head. The kind you have to stop yourself from scarfing down because each bite tastes so good that you just want more. Hell yes.

The Deli Board takes your order right there on the sidewalk. There is no physical location to walk into - they're easy to miss since there is really no street signage. I grabbed one of the paper menus on the rack outside. Once I was ready, they took my order and my payment (they also accept cards). Minutes later, they came back with a warm paper bag. My sandwich felt like it weighed five pounds.

Even on this rainy day, there was a small crowd gathered outside. The staff set out some umbrellas for us to use while we waited for our food - that was a nice touch :)

Back to the Boca - this thing was huge (that's what she said!). The bread was lightly toasted. The warm, thinly sliced pastrami, corned beef and brisket melted with the meunster cheese. The sliced pickles added a nice tang. So. Freakin. Good. They also give you a sliced pickle in a zip lock bag with every sandwich.

And, the Deli Board offers free delivery within biking distance (in the downtown area), weekdays from 11am - 3pm with a minimum $20 order. Sah-weet!
author: Mariela D.

description:
You've got to be kidding me. $12 for a sandwich. Yes, it's good. I got the BG or something. Great. Tasty. Melty and pretty  straightforward. Will I be coming back?  Probably not. 

You know what the most brilliant part of this place is?  All the little odes to Cleveland.  You know why that's the best part? In Ohio, this sandwich would cost $7, at most.
author: Corey O.

description:
Was in the city and decided to give this place a try after seeing the amount of reviews this place had on Yelp. 

The sandwich was good but the price to size to taste ratio is not looking too well in my books.
author: Welmond C.

description: Went here yesterday with my coworkers after an extremely early work meeting. I haven't been in some months, maybe even a year. I was disappointed to see that the prices went up $2-3 since I last ate here. When I opened my sandwich when we got back to the office, I was equally disappointed to see the sandwich was significantly smaller than the last time. Yes, my food was still tasty, but I really don't think I can rationalize eating her again, especially when there are so many tasty sandwich joints around! Morty's in the TL and delivery from the AMAZING Mission Picnic will help me survive.
author: Ariel B.

description: This is the best sandwich place I've ever tried! The bread is freshly baked and has a perfect texture. The sandwich itself is toasty with high quality meats and the right amount of sauce. It's pretty pricey for a sandwich, but totally worth it. My personal favorite is the Zeke with the ghost pepper hot sauce. Don't forget the pickles; those are awesome too!
author: Pamela S.

description: I wanted this to be good. I really did but there was nothing Cleveland about the Corned Beef or the ham. The only thing I got was salt. If you like salt then go for it, the bread is nice and soft and the meat is piled higher than high.
author: Avon R.

description: Best sandwich in SF hands down two trips and each time I'm very impressed. Artisan ingriendients and all types of sandwiches hot and cold! Bring everyone for lunch it closes at 4...
author: Jonathan A.

description: My co-workers raved that this deli is the "best" near the Civic Center/Tenderloin area.  For $11 a sandwich, I was not blown away by it but rather another mediocre sub.  I ordered a pastrami sandwich, and for $11 you would expect a HUGE portion but it's a regular 6" sub.  All in all, I would take my $11 and eat somewhere else because it's not all that here.
author: Katie N.

description:
The closest thing to the flavors of an East Coast deli I've encountered in the Bay Area (although done with a bit of a California twist).  I lived in Philly for 6 years and fell in love with the giant meat towers served at Koch's Deli (unfortunately, no longer with us).  Deli Board does a much smaller portion of meat (and on rolls mostly rather than sliced breads), but it does get the flavors of the meat right, which is the most important thing.  Additionally, it adds some great local twists to classic sandwich combos (for example, mixing brisket, pastrami, melty cheese, and jalapeños together).  

The menu does rotate periodically, adding fresh new combinations to the board.
author: Patrick Z.

description: Wow! Great place and find. A good friend of mind told us it's a gem in our neighborhood.  I love that it's a lunch spot only. It's so tasty! I had the Skinny Cousin which was was not skinny it was so delicious. The sauce is addicting and the Dutch crunch breast is crunchy and perfect. Highly recommend treating yourself to a weekend sandwich! I think this place impresses others when you share the find.
author: Priya S.

description:
Ordered a Gold-berg-n-stein with extra meat.

My sando arrived.... Opened it up and it seemed "small", as in lacked meat, especially when I ordered extra meat.

A bite or two in, I brought it up to the counter and asked the person I placed the order with if my sandwich looked like it had extra meat, she said yes. This was my first time here and i had no other comparison , so I went back to sit and finish the sandwich. For $11+$3 extra meat, I was still hungry. 

After I left, I figured I'll give this place another try but build my own.

Before I wrote this review, I checked the other yelp photos and similar sandos had more meat than what I got (remember I ordered "extra meat"). 

Factoring in the photos I am rating two stars.
author: qirk z.

description: I bought the Zeke sandwich and it cost an exorbitant $15 not including tax. The sandwich had avocado, bacon, and cream cheese as toppings. Honestly I think it is quite overrated. The taste was okay and it was quite filling though. If the price were like $10 it would be better, but not $15. I'd rather go to Good Eats Cafe in FiDi (Financial District) which is a similar deli shop and their turkey/bacon/avocado sandwich only cost $8.75 with a little bit of caesar salad.
author: John B.

description:
I typically bring my lunch, but forgot one day and all of my co-workers recommended this spot and warned me about the high prices. They don't have a vegan-friendly menu, but thankfully I am no longer vegan and I could choose between just a couple of sandwiches. The Fatty Matty looked the funkiest: tuna salad, muenster, board sauce, hummus, and falafel. I had to get it. That and a small bag of Dirty's cost me $14, yikes! 

The tuna salad was way over-salted. I was so dehydrated by the end of my meal I spent a half hour drinking water and iced tea before I could continue working. But that's a technical flaw and can be adjusted pretty easily. The sandwich itself was really good. Who would have thought that tuna and falafel and hummus and muenster cheese would have any business being together in between a couple pieces of bread? It's impressive. 

I'll check out this sandwich again and if the salt cap was loose that day and it's not really supposed to be so bad, I'm totally down for this spot.
author: Camille R.

description:
Best sandwich place ever.  Every sandwich I've had is tasty and satisfying.  A few good ones are the Boca and the Fatty Matty (falafel and tuna?!).

They have daily specials that change (habanero wings, different soups, sandwich specials) so you always can get something new and interesting.

The meat quality is top notch and the amount of meat you get is very generous. They also have really spicy sauces to give your sandwiches that extra kick.

Also, the staff is always friendly (shout out to my girl Mo) and the boss man as well.  They are always playing some good vinyl records. 

Only complaint I have is that they aren't open at 2am when the bars close!
author: Baek C.

description: I give them 3.5 stars. Ok what's the hype of this place? I got the Carzle pastrami cherry red peppers and beef. I thought cherry peppers would be sweet..my mouth is currently burning!!!! I had to pick the peppers out half way through. The Sammy was nice and hot but too much sauce, it was making my bread soggy. Flavors were there it was a good sandwich but what didn't sit well with me minus half a star for the price. It is so not worth $14. At least Ike's sandwich gives you a bag of chips and a lollipop. If you want chips here another $2.50. Way overpriced for what it is.
author: Karen T.

description:
Incredible service and food!
I work for a production company and we needed to feed 20 people lunch at 10:30AM and have the food delivered by 10AM. I emailed the deli board catering service my situation and within 20 minutes I had Justin from Deli Board on the phone taking my order and reassuring me everything would be taken care of. 
The food was delivered on time and I received praise from the crew (meat and veggie eaters) on how good the food was. Justin really made me look like a rock star.
author: Julie D.

description: This place is cash money ($$$). By that I mean. Get the ca$h money. My goodness, if it isn't the best sandwich on the planet then I'm a liar and I should be sentenced to an eternity in hell.
author: Andrew H.

description: Okay this place is good, there sandwiches are the best and they give you a awesome juicy pickle with it, however the price is insane, although I am sure they wouldn't be in business anymore unless people actually liked this place. My bf took me here for our lunch break, we yelped a random spot close to my work since I only had an house. For two sandwiches we payed like $30+ which I find crazy since all you get is a sandwich or a salad, you know normal food you would have for lunch. The food in delicious here and i'm pretty sure its organic since the price is so high otherwise it wouldn't cost that much but its a great place to go if you want to eat for lunch. I would just save my money first and then go treat myself at this place.
author: Svetlana T.

description:
BAM,

Deli Board knows how to make a dank sandwich.

My friend and I stood in awe of the extensive menu; SO. MANY. SANDWICHES. SPECIALS. COMBOS. EPIC.

I opted for the Zeke, which is slam-jam filled with beef brisket, onions, some amazing sauce and dutch crunch bread. Needless to say the sandwich was quite hefty and delicious. Filling enough for lunch, which is saying a lot for me (I eat a LOT).

It came with a pickle in a plastic bag, which I flung as far away from me as far as possible.

My friend Lisa got the Turkey sandwich, which was great as well. But nothing beats hot, juicy, dripping brisket.

The only problem is that as a popular joint, this place packs up very easily and there is very minimal seating space. So be prepared to snag a table when you get the opportunity.


#ProTip: DeliBoard offers amazing breakfast sandwiches. It's not on the menu but on the hanging clipboards on the wall. They only serve them on weekends though!
author: Roy C.

description: These guys makes the best sandwiches in San Francisco. As good as it gets!
author: Brian S.

description:
I had the Boca like 7x7 recommended and the people on yelp. It was like all meat and just pickles. Thought it was alright. Nothing stood out for some reason. Taste good, but I thought Ikes was better. I could not really distinguish the flavors of corn beef, brisket and pastrami too much. Also after looking at the people's pictures and my Broca, my Broca was no way as big and did not have as much meat as them. Kinda sad, not sure if I was fooled. They give you two tasty pickles.

Overall I thought the sandwich was alright. From my experience Overrated. The people were really friendly and nice though.
author: David L.

description:
Yes, it's as good as advertised. Yes, it's proof that Cleveland rocks. Yes, it's worth the $11. (If you ate here 365 days a year, no it wouldn't be. But as an occasional treat? It's worth $11, and then some).

I actually like this sandwich better than Ike's. I think the ingredients are a notch higher in quality, especially the MEAT. I don't usually like pastrami, and even that meat is a welcome addition to the Boca or Carzle. They're not serving up subpar meat here and hoping you'll ignore it because of the toppings and hipster vibe, the meat on their sandwiches takes center stage and is quite good. 

But the toppings and bread are also good, and the whole thing adds up to a seriously amazing sandwich that even "keeps" well. I ate mine a half-hour later in Pacifica, and quite enjoyed the fact that I was eating a better sandwich than the hordes of people waiting in line at Gorilla BBQ just across the street.

Here's to a future in which Deli Board is widely successful and opens branches all over the Bay.
author: S R.

description:
Deli Board has amazing, enormous sandwiches.  It's a bit far from downtown, but well worth the trek.

The varous sandwich combos all sound great, but it's difficult to choose just one.  Lucky for me, I came with my sis.  We shared the Reuben and the Sha Sha (turkey, bacon, grilled onion).  I loved them both.  In fact, the Deli Board might just make the best Reuben EVER.  The meat is sliced paper thin, and you get just the right amount of kraut, cheese, and dressing.  Plus, it's all served on a roll.  I happen to hate rye bread, so this was a big plus.

The cafe is very noisy, so this isn't the place for conversation.  Service is quick and friendly.  They don't offer many drink options, but they do offer some delicious chunky pickles that will go great with your sandwich.

Deli Board gets crazy busy, so arrive early to avoid a long line.  Arrive even earlier if you want to score one of the elusive tables.  There is a pretty park across the street where you can also take your food, but the neighborhood is a little sketchy.
author: Raina S.

description:
Theodore.. if it weren't for your review, I wouldn't have ordered the Boca sandwich.. I came here from San Jose w/ a one track mind: I MUST get Boca or else my heart would stop instantly.  

This place wasn't hard to find.  Although this place isn't a sitdown place, the address and name of the place is visible even to ones that are blind like myself!  The daily specials and menus are posted on the window... 

The nice girl took my order and was wowed that I came from San Jose just for these babies... luckily there was nobody in line- just ME!  I ordered, waited about 5 minutes but it seemed forever.. 

Then.. there it is.. another nice lady came to bring my order out.  I ran to my car and opened my prize... I was amazed w/ just the appearance of it when I unwrapped it.. I think I may have died the second I took a bite out of my Boca, added jalapenos.. the pickles, the Muenster cheese, the piles of meat (nicely piled though) blended so well together.

I might come back tomorrow.. I need it like we need oxygen.
author: Tram N.

description: Don't just believe the hype. Eat the hype.
author: Misha T.

description:
I absolutely love that Deli Board delivers, and that they deliver such good food.

I also like that the delivery price already includes tax and the delivery charge so you know what you're going to pay immediately.

I ordered 3 items from them recently for a group lunch at work during a beautiful day when we wanted to eat outside in the park. I was going to be in a meeting until one so I asked if they could deliver at that time. They said they could and they arrived promptly at the requested time. Awesometown.

I ate the cobb salad with balsamic dressing and it was great. I'd easily order it again in terms of how much I liked it, but Deli Board has a menu that I'm interested in exploring so either way I think it will be a win win situation next time I order.
author: Tiffany N.

description: AMAZING! I got the Zeke sandwich with no sprouts. So flavorful. And I added that special brown mustard (I dipped it) I also added board sauce. Omg. We will be back!
author: Anjelica E.

description:
Today I had what I'm pretty sure was the best sandwich I've ever had:  "The Ron" - roast beef, cheddar sauce, jalapeños, avocado, cole slaw, board sauce, garlic French bread. 

Damn. That was ridiculously good. Damn.
author: Jodie B.

description:
My brother took me here promising me a delicious sandwich, but I was skeptical...

Needless to say, he was right. Deli Board is AWESOME. I got the porky -- ham, bacon, house sauce, etc. and it was literally the best sandwich I've eaten. The meat is all tender and delicious, the bread is awesome... everything worked together perfectly.

The service was great. I bought a sandwich to bring home and the staff was very helpful in choosing the best ones. Even though we ordered our food to-go, one of the girls working there kept offering to refill our water glasses while we waited.

Anyways, moral of the story: best sandwich place. I will be returning regularly and can't wait to try more of theri sandwiches. GO HERE.
author: Erica W.

description: Come often. Some of the best sandwiches in the greater bay Area. I'd come every day if I could.
author: Justin S.

description:
Simple Salads, Sandwiches, and Soups... (say that five times fast)!

That's exactly that's what I thought of when I perused the Deli Board menu... and sometimes that is exactly what I want - simple salads, sandwiches, and soups!

My lunch group, party of three, called ahead and had Deli Board deliver to our office just before noon today.  We then took our food to the park across the street for a little picnic... it was lovely!

I had the Very Veggie Sando on Wheat... it was huge but I managed to finish it along with my side of pickles.  My lunch companions had salads: the Board Cobb and the Phat Greek.  We all left our picnic feeling fat and happy.  

The only thing missing from the menu? Avocado!  I won't let that stop me from returning though... as a matter of fact, I may order from Deli Board again later this week!
author: Gabi M.

description: This place makes my stomach & heart happy. I live on the Peninsula but work in the city & I crave their sandwiches when I'm back home. I love their creative menu, funky sandwich names, & their sandwiches. The $$$ is exactly that..money, money, money in my tummy, tummy, tummy. It's filled with meat, cheesy goodness, and flavor. I could eat it 5 times a day. And don't forget the Skully! Turkey, kosher salami, cheese, and all the fixings..And now I'm hungry.
author: Erin K.

description:
My spirit animal is a sandwich. Yes, you heard me correctly. A sandwich. And if you force me to get specific with it, my spirit animal is the Boca from Deli Board. 

Who the fuck else puts corned beef, pastrami, and brisket on the same sandwich? And then tops it off with muenster, Board sauce, brown mustard, and pickles? The mad geniuses at Deli Board know that any additions besides meat/cheese/condiments are completely extraneous. Screw your lettuce! To hell with your tomato! I'm ingesting a meatstrosity and no one can stop me!

By the way, did you know that if you eat your spirit animal you gain the strength of ten thousand men? Which is lucky, because now I get to eat a lot more sandwiches to keep that strength up!
author: Corinna K.

description:
I had a lunch date with Deli Board and The Drewster rocked my world. So meaty and so fresh. Mmm... just how I like my sandos!

Before you make your way to their kitchen, you should know a few things:
1. Check their website for their daily specials under "The Board" or their regular offerings under the "Delivery" tab under "Menus"
2. CALL to place your order for pick up or delivery via bike messenger. They do not have a storefront so you don't want to get assed out and wait outside if you didn't call ahead.
3. If you are more than 15 minutes late, they will have to remake your sando because they don't want them sitting and losing their freshness.
4. They are only open for 3 HOURS ONLY from 11am-2pm Tue-Fri
5. Prep your stomach because these suckers are filling. Share if you can.
6. Avoid walking alone if you are a girl because there are shady characters lurking around that trickle down from 6th & Mission.

Today, Drewster was one of the three special sandos, which was stacked with turkey breast, kosher salami, bacon, provolone, lettuce, tomato, pickle, mayo - all on a super soft french roll. I also got a Kosher Club for Ruggy, and that was filled with turkey breast, kosher salami, muenster cheese, tomato, red onions, pickles, Board sauce. We swapped a half so we could try both. The meats were so fresh and tasty. You also get a cup of thick slices of giant Board pickles.

Needless to say, I am now stuffed and I will have to name my food baby after the father, Drewster. Thanks Adam, you make a mean sammich!
author: Connie C.

description:
More like 3.5 stars. I had the MikeyO, a pastrami sandwich. It was good, but not as amazing as all these other reviews seem to think about the sandwiches here. I'm from Cleveland. I go to Corky & Lenny's every time I go back to visit. So, I get where the owner is coming from. Sure hope he imports their corned beef served on latkes instead of bread. 

The pickles were excellent. 

I'll definitely go back and try other sandwiches. 

The staff was so fun and friendly. Smiling and helpful and yet efficient. They moved the line quickly. 

Limited seating is a drawback, I ate standing at the window counter. Some stools there sure would be nice.
author: Scott R. D.

description:
Deli Board?  Nay, say DEADLY BOARD, the undisputed All-seeing All-knowing Masters of the Kingdom of Sandwich!

What sandwich can make you rework and re-route your day's schedule?

What sandwich can make you eat too much and still LOVE YOURSELF?!

What sandwich sees the the center of the universe and brings you back the purest Light and Truth?!

You know the answer, and it is on Folsom St., raised to aspirational status for hosting the True Sandwich.

The secret is in Deli Board's OBSESSION.  Every aspect of the humble sandwich, obsessively perfected.  The perfect dutch crunch, perfectly lightly toasted.  The perfect slicing of each perfect ingredient to maximize texture and taste amplification.  The perfect proportion of board sauce, nay, BOARD SORCERY, to the superlative ingredientology within, and the perfect pickleology without.  Even the perfect spiritual vinyl fever spun into the atmosphere for the mirth and merriment of the followers.

Each trip a reward in itself.  Today's sandwich, the FINER, finer than all others except its own menu siblings, all finer.  How hard it is now to look upon other sandwiches.

Do not consider yourself weak to succumb to Deli Board cravings.  Consider yourself enlightened, and damn lucky!!!
author: Bob K.

description:
The dutch crunch here is better than Ike's. .....That's right...I said it.

I love Ike's but Deli Board seriously rocked my socks. I'm so thankful to have this amazing establishment amidst a bunch of nothing-ness on Folsom. 

As a vegetarian, I always get the Jen, and I always love it. The sandwiches are big, and I can generally save half of it for the next day. It keeps remarkably well, too--doesn't get very soggy.
