The mustard here is also amazing. Be sure to squirt some into a little container and eat it with your sandwich.
author: Neeharika B.

description: I had the Diego sandwich!  It was the bomb!!!!  Well worth the wait and money.  Service was amazing...shout out to Moe for the recommendation!
author: Brent M.

description:
I haven't actually visited Deli Board, but it was brought in during a recent company lunch...and I"m a huge fan!  My tomato mozzarella sandwich was heavenly.  I indulged in a rather large breakfast just a few hrs earlier so had just planned on eating half of my sandwich, but it was way too good not to eat the entire thing. 

Our sandwiches were also served with a variety of pickles, which made me a very happy pregnant woman!
author: Andrea R.

description:
The sandwiches are good, but I kind of feel the place is overrated. 

Here's the thing, you will be paying $10/sandwich if you eat here. It will be a good sandwich, but if you're paying $10, it better be good. Tony Baloney's is a good alternative, if you're concerned with time/cash.

Best dish: Boca
Food: 4/5 stars
Ambiance: Crowded, not a lot of seating
Price: 10/person 
Service: Average
author: Kevi L.

description:
The owner was out chit-chatting with a customer/friend and saw that the table my boyfriend and I were at, was a bit off balance.  He insisted on setting it straight for us, went inside and got a roll of napkins and made sure to set it up right.  Super nice! Super friendly!  And we even shared a bit about how he started up his sandwich shop.  

I've only been once, but the quality of their meat is amazing.  It's a lot though!  A heaping serving of meat, like a meatball of sliced turkey in between two slices of bread.  I will be returning to explore more off of their menu.
author: Chantal B.

description:
SCRUMPTIOUS little treat tucked away in SOMA.

We came on a Saturday during lunch time - not crazy packed, but we did get the last open table.  They have a pretty big variety of sandwiches, and slightly on the pricier end, but once you get the sandwich you'll understand why.

I ordered the Zeke because I'm a turkey-bacon-SPROUTS kind of gal, bf ordered bubba, friend ordered the Mezman.

Right after friend takes a first bite of his Mezman, "this might be the best sandwich I've ever had."

While I like to stray way from labeling things as the "best ever", I have to say this sandwich was AMAZE.  They pack a lot of meat in there, and each sandwich had a very unique, fresh taste.  Must try!!

I am definitely going back during my lunch hour on the weekdays to try the other sandwiches.
author: Adele Z.

description:
Winner, winner, pastrami dinner!

If you're ever fortunate enough to catch them on a day where they're selling the "JB" sandwich, get it. This is the king of sandwiches and has instantly propelled Deli Board to supreme status. They say that bacon is good with anything - married with pastrami is no exception. It needs to be on their permanent menu.
author: O'Shea J.

description:
I had the "lemar" - corned beef with sport pepper slaw and brown mustard on dutch crunch.  I sat at my desk and stared at my sandwich in admiration, eager to find out if it tastes as good as it looks.  There was so much thinly sliced meat crammed into a lightly toasted dutch crunch bread, I thought for sure that the meaty taste will be too overpowering.  

Any lingering doubts disappeared after the first bite.  The bread was fresh and was perfectly toasted.  The meat was tender, moist, with a subtle yet distinctive flavor and outstanding texture.  If the sandwich was that good without the board sauce, I can only imagine what it would have been like with it.  I've had truly memorable sandwich experiences before - Ike's Place and Roli Roti to name a few.  Mr. Adam's corned beef sandwich not only belongs in the same league, it deserves serious consideration for the top spot.  I also raved about the Sentinel before, this one, in my opinion, is even better.  Even the pickle was excellent.


People thought this was:  Awesome (954) Best Review Ever (827) Awful (1)
author: Angel S.

description:
The holy grail of SF Sandwiches. Deli Board and its affable owner Mr Adam Mesnick deliver piping-hot, steaming sandwiches that are so delicious that I have found myself going there at an embarrassing frequency. The friendly staff always makes everyone feel at home, and the food comes out pretty quickly. My favorite place to get lunch in San Francisco, and that is quite a statement considering the options found in the culinary haven that is SF.

My favorite sandwich at DB is a rotating special..gotta love the "Bradley" : corned beef, pastrami, brisket, cheddar cheese, jalapenos, board sauce, garlic french bread -11 bucks. After typing that, I am now compelled to go order one...like now.
author: Peter F.

description:
The BF tasked me with finding him a good sandwich as we were driving into SF via bay bridge...thank you fellow yelpers for all the pictures and reviews...this was easy to locate (close enough to the freeway)!

We didnt have to look at the menu too long, the PORKY was it for us.  It consisted of black forrest ham, bacon, american cheese, & house-made pickles on a garlic french roll!! AMAZING does not begin to describe the magic that was going on in my mouth! Another awesome part of this meal is that the complimentary water is ICE cold! Trust me you'll need to drink water with this sandwich since it's a bit on the salty side (delicious though).

Also, the service was really friendly.  The girl taking my order didnt give me any attitude when i asked for the special sauce on the side (i like my sandwiches dry for the most part). However, i think i might keep the special sauce on my sandwich next time....it was delicious! 

The housemade bottled sauces are soooooooooooo good! We were impressed with the green jalapeno one and the yellowish /clear habanero one! Be sure to try them on your sandwich...they add a whole new level of flavor!
author: Gina G.

description: Best pastrami sandwich I ever had. The sandwich is very tasty and excellent. I was amazed how good is the sandwich and I love it. Every one should try this place. Five star sandwich.
author: Siroos H.

description: The food speaks for itself.  Just go.  Everything is great and even better the menu changes every so often so you can always try something new.  Adam is also great.  You can tell the amount of dedication he put into perfecting each sandwich and cares about his customers.
author: Andrew S.

description:
What do 2 people do on a beautiful Thursday afternoon?  Grab some sandwiches & head over to Yerba Buena Gardens to enjoy them!

The boyfriend had heard of (& I think been to) this place while I knew nothing about it.  Neither of us really liked the specials so he ordered a Mikey & for me an RLM (does it stand for something?).

We both thought the MIkey was too salty & he said the pastrami was not the best he's ever had.  I thought the RLM was not garlic'y enough but liked that the bread was nice & crunchy.  We liked the roast beef which was nicely medium rare.  He thought the mozzarella was overpowering though.

We both enjoyed our orders & the baggie of pickles.  However, we walked away from the meal agreeing that - given its hours & prices - this place is definitely a bit over hyped.
author: Karen S.

description:
Came here on a recommendation from a friend who worked nearby and have been back at least fives times and converted two new customers from the neighborhood. I even go on Saturdays. 

The line is more intimidating than anything. It moves quickly. The salads are gigantic and very filling but to be honest, go for the great sandwiches. They're not as 'wet' and messy as Ike's and have the right balance of creativity and flavor so that you actually taste the craftsmanship that was built into each bite.
author: Kerensa H.

description:
Many of the sandos here are now starting at $13 so the price is moving in the wrong direction from where previous reviewers had it, and they didn't have many positive comments about the price. If the meal had been $10 this would be five stars hands down.

I had the $$$ (pronounced: "the money") because it seemed apropos for the weight reduction to my wallet. It was a fantastic sandwich was an excellent balance of flavors and I would definitely order it again. Just not sure if it is twice as good as a normal deli sandwich you could get for half the price. The pickles are a nice touch, but when you are taking out a second mortgage to buy the sandwich, you would expect you could get a whole one.

Also, the Boca is no longer on the menu, but you can still order it. Plan to stop by the ATM after you eat here.
author: David K.

description:
woh!

You can't go wrong here. The sandwiches are phenomenal, the staff is pleasant, and the peak wait time is never unbearable, even when there's a crowd on the sidewalk (of nightclub proportions) waiting for their orders.
author: Timon C.

description: Best sandwiches in the city.....sorry Ike's....and really amazing service especially considering how busy they are...The pastrami A. stud is to die for, all the ingredients are fresh and tasty, also the Zeke is a favourite! Get there early so you don't get stuck in line!!
author: Sarah H.

description:
Yes it took them 10 minutes to make my $12 sandwich, but as a sandwich monster, I think this place ROCKS! They have such inventive combinations that my head swims every time I stop in. 

Last time I stopped in I got the Emeline (falafel, hummus, grilled onion, lettuce, muenster cheese, cherry peppers, sprouts, pickles, Board sauce on a french roll) which is SO unlike me because I am a total carnivore.. and it was so unique and delicious! I will say that I will probably continue to leave falafel to the experts, I totally enjoyed it but will probably go for the Zeke next time. 

Totally wish this place was closer to home but am secretly glad its not because Deli Board is a carb situation that would not be able to resist.
author: Molly S.

description:
Boyfriend and I were in the area and opted to try something new. I have bookmarked a couple of spots, but Deli Board was the closest to where we were at the time. 

There's def a hipster feel to this place. Seating is limited as the place gets crowded fast, especially during lunch time. I got the Mada sandwich: turkey, bacon, American cheeses, sprouts, jalapenos, house sauce, and lettuce on Dutch crunch bread. Boyfriend got Carzle: brisket, roast beef, provolone, peppers, and other stuff (I don't remember) on a French roll.

Luckily it wasn't too cold so we decided to eat at the outside table. When we first grabbed our sandwiches, we noticed that it was quite toasty -- big thumbs up. I loooove hot sandwiches! Upon splitting the halves, we both salivated at the sight of the melted cheeses. We cheers-ed our sandwich halves and dug in -- oh my, that first bite was delicious! Nothing beats a hot sandwich on a brisk day in the city. They give tons of deli-carved meat, but not too much where you can't get all the fixings in the sandwich in one bite. And these sandwiches were pretty big! We both decided not to be fat asses and saved the other half for later, which was still good. Boyfriend and I were completely satisfied with this new find.

One of the better sandwich places in the city, even better than Ike's IMO! I would come back to try other things on the menu.
author: Aeramis F.

description:
THANK YOU Yelp, for featuring this AWESOME sando shop - otherwise I may never have known! 

Listen up everybody, the rumors are true.  The service, from the girl who took my order over the phone, to the delivery guy who dropped three sandwiches off 20 minutes later, was FLAWLESS.  They are so pleasant and efficient, like seriously what else could you ask for?

And the sandwiches!  O, M, G, the sandwiches!  I had the Boca and the Gold-n-Berg-n-Stein, and I'd have to say I liked the Gold-n-Berg-n-Stein better.  But don't get me wrong, the Boca was still GREAT.  The meats here are a tad on the salty side, but not greasy AT ALL which is a blessing for hot pastrami or corned beef sandos. 

And the pickles, are PERFECT!  They're not too sour or too sweet, but theyre super crunchy and refreshing.

And finally, the dutch crunch.  I usually stay away from dutch crunch, because I hate the top of my mouth getting shredded up from the crust on the topside.  BUT HERE, I don't know how - the dutch crunch is light and flaky but still crunchy.  NO DAMAGE TO THE ROOF OF MY MOUTH!  

This is hands down a 5 star experience.  I will be back deliboard, trust that I will be back.
author: Cora L.

description: What an awesome sandwich place. The combinations of meats, cheeses and other condiments are not only creative but simply delicious. Employees where super friendly and found out owner is from my hometown Cleveland. They knocked it out of the park in my book. A definite must have when you are downtown.
author: Wade M.

description: Good stuff. I think this is a little overrated (yelp wise), as there are great sammies all over SF, but... i'm glad to have them local to me.
author: Adam X.

description:
I've been here a handful of times, in my opinion it's overrated and overpriced. All their sandwiches are hot, which I'm not the biggest fan of and all of them are fairly fatty. Don't get me wrong, they have great pickles and they are indeed tasty but not 'best sandwich in SF' tasty.  It's being relegated to a once every 6 months kind of place for me.

So if you're not into hot, melted cheese type sandwiches, it's not your spot.
author: Nicholas M.

description:
The other day i was looking through the 7x7 BIG EAT list at work, and I realized this place is not very far from where i work, so i decided to try it out with my co-woker. 

We were there during the lunch time on a Thursdays, people were lining up, but the line moved pretty fast. The place is small but sweet, a few tables inside and a few outside. Also the environment is relaxing and the place is clean. There are mouth watering enlarged photos of sandwich hanging on the wall which made me really really hungry. 

I ordered the sandwich recommended on the list " Munsoned," we waited around 8-10min for our togo to get ready. During the wait, I boxed up some sauces on the counter: mustard, jalapeno and another kind of hot sauce. 

Okay here comes the sandwich........ AMAZING!!! Seriously.... the meat inside.... damn the winner! There were lots of meat in the sandwich and it was perfected marinated and cooked. The french roll.... TO DIE FOR, crispy outside and soft inside. The cheese, the meat and the bread were just perfect for one another. There was also pickle in the togo bag. Even that taste perfect! 

So what else can i say? I will be back to try all the other goodies!
author: JiaHuan H.

description:
Its been a long time since I've been impressed with a restaurant. Not that their aren't great restaurants in the Bay Area. But to me, impressive is when a place goes out of their way to serve you. 

Well, give Deli Board 5+ stars! Not only is their food delicious, with well made ingredients and served in a timely manner, but if/when something isn't right, its not only corrected, but corrected above and beyond. I ordered the Ruprecht, an awesome sandwich, which was prepared 'almost' as promised. The slaw and pickled onion were missing. So I asked for them on the side, the owner/manager apologized, said he wanted to make it right and took care of it right away. He also gave me my original sandwich to "nibble on', while I waited. He didn't have to, but he did. And generally don't bother with online reviews, but I am. Deli Board will have a disproportionate amount of my 'food chat' from now on. 

BTW, the pastrami is over the top full of flavor and mouthwateringly tender. The rolls are fresh as can be. The slaw, onions and pickles also memorable. Go for the food, because you won't be disappointed. And the folks at the counter and the food runners - all helpful, pleasant and seem to like where they work. That's as good as it gets, folks!
author: Michele S.

description: great lunch spot. love the samurai salad (light dressing, good balance of ingredients). Deli board is known for its fresh and non-artificial tasting meats. The RLM3 roast beef sandwich was very tasty, without the overwhelming mayonnaise that accompanies a lot of sandwiches in delis in SF.
author: Rebecca C.

description: A nice clean sandwich shop, friendly service, and good food.  I had the "$$$" sandwich, a French roll with brisket, corned beef, kosher salami, muenster cheese, cheddar, cherry poppers, coke slaw and board sauce.  It was nicely complimented by the side of pickles and funky fusion chips.  I'll come back, but with an average $15 price point per sandwich, it will be a while till my next visit.
author: David S.

description:
I felt like a T-REX eating Godzilla during lunch today. The taste was almost legendary and there were SO much meat in that sandwich! 'Meat Meat Meat!' I stuffed myself with my delicious corned beef sandwich and immediately went into food coma. Spent the rest of the day at work staring at the printer and feeling good about myself.

MEAT Wins all.
author: Song Z.

description: $$$ with pepperocini blend and extra board sauce was literally money. One of the very best sandwiches I've had in my glorious 33 year old life. If you're within walking distance of here stop what you're doing and head this way. To die for.
author: Amy S.

description:
Definitely lives up to the hype and absolutely worth the $11.  Had the Ruprecht - corned beef, romanian pastrami, swiss cheese, pickled onion, cole slaw, 1000 island, brown mustard, dutch crunch roll.  

The meat was soft and juicy and the fixins added enough flavor to compliment but not drown out the meat.  Being a Jewess with East Coast roots I have pretty high standards for my cured meats.  I have tried Moishe's Pipic, East Coast West and most recently Wise Sons and I have to say Deli Board blows the competition away.  Will definitely go back to try others.  Yum diddly um! 

On a side note if you don't want good carved meats with fewer frills go to Tommy's Joynt, they're corned beef is now my second favorite.  

Cleveland you really know how to rock!
author: Julie P.

description:
Now I don't exactly remember what was in my sandwich today as it was one of the specials but it was very good and spicy. I'm not usually a Dutch Crunch bread fan as it's too tough for me but I had a feeling this one was going to be just right and it was. I had mistakenly tried to walk in to order but didn't realize it was all done outside. 

I'm a big sandwich person and Deli Board was a great one so I'll definitely be back.
author: Blake B.

description:
If I could put a speechless monkey here, I would cause it was that good.  I got the Lawrence (which comes as a surprise to me because I do not eat bacon).  But as I stood there and read the ingredients, I couldn't order it without the bacon.  Everything tastes better with bacon, right?  I've got issues.  

I am glad I got there when I did because by the time I grabbed a table, got my sandwich and looked up, the line was out the door.  Always a good sign!  

The sandwich was HUGE!  So huge, it took me two days to eat it.  Seriously! And it tasted just as good the next day.  Was I one happy camper two days in a row.  

Love love love it!  Stop reading and GO NOW!  :)
author: Michelle B.

description:
Super solid sandwiches. Even among SF's plentiful deli options, Deli Board is definitely a stand out. 

We got the following:
- Jen - YUM! Good veggie option. I used a bunch of the hot sauce which was delish.
- Bubba - Thoroughly enjoyed by my colleagues. They devoured it in seconds!

Anticipate waiting for a little while for your sandwich since they are super fresh and warm. Also, there is usually a line at lunch time so measure out your time appropriately.
author: Raina B.

description:
Holy sh*t. What the eff is in these sandwiches?!? I don't understand how Deli Board is so delicious. Some of my friends have been ranting and raving about this place recently and I decided that this past Saturday I had to make trying it a priority. There's nothing like a solid sandwich when you're hungover and let me just tell you, Deli Board hit the spot.

My two friends and I arrived there at around 12:45pm on Saturday afternoon and the place was busy, but luckily, we missed the massive rush of people! 15 minutes later, there was a line out the door...also, keep in mind that the sandwiches take about 10 minutes to make, so you'll have to wait for those too.

I don't eat red meat, so it was pretty easy for me to make my selection: I ordered the Zeke without bacon but also got a side of 'board sauce'. This sandwich was all kinds of wow. It's served on a french roll, super nomtastic - it's soft and not too thick and is filled with avocado, cream cheese, turkey, etc. They stuff the sandwich in with lots of turkey so you'll get full pretty quickly. I saved half my sandwich for later in the day. Another one of my friends got the Rueben's cousin, and another one of my friends got the falafel one (forgot what it's called), but all are very very yummy.

I just think this place has really fresh tasting sandwiches, and the staff is SO COOL. They're fun and quirky and so cheery. They'll tell you what they think is best, and they're so upbeat! I love it. They also play real records as the music here (super cool - the lady made me hold on so she could change the record in the back), and the decor is all wooden yet modern looking.

Although the sandwiches are a bit pricey ($9-11), I think they're well worth it. They have tons of sauces you can throw on at the front counter too. The boardsauce is yummy times, be sure to get it on the side. 

Only bummer is that it's only open during lunch hours, so go here on a Saturday if you need to-- I think they're closed on Sundays. Officially my new favorite sandwich place in SF, can't wait to go back and try more of em! P.S. my only tip here is to order different sandwiches with your friends so you can try more of them!
author: Priya G.

description:
I still like deli board but the sandwiches have gotten smaller. I guess the price I pay for having a location that you can sit and eat at.  

Boca on garlic still on point!
author: Julie F.

description:
A+ 

friendly service...
good combos of ingredients ...
good portions ( the zeke and the Gold-n-Berg-n-stein could use more veggies tho for something crunchy imo..)...

makes me a happy camper :) 


just keep in mind if you're coming in here for something quick and on the go, the sandwiches seem to take a bit of time to come out of the kitchen so if you're in a hurry  you're probably gonna be late. 

The meats in the Gold-n-Berg seriously melt in your mouth. seriously.
author: Ashley Y.

description:
Ah, a "Cleveland themed" sandwich shop. As a fellow ohioan, remember this review may be biased.

This place has many delicious options. I go with the Zoe, which is their vegetarian option. It's falafel + hummus + muenster + toppings on dutch crunch. Kind of a mess, the flavors are amazing, but I find myself always having to add one of their hot sauces to this sandwich. Why? because falafel deserves spicy love.

Did I mention they have Stadium Mustard?! They make their own habanero sauce? It's crazy delicious.

I find it expensive for sandwiches, these prices would not fly in Cleveland.. but hey, the line is out the freakin' door every single day for lunch. I don't think they've priced themselves out of the market here.
author: Jeff M.

description: I had to check this place out because of all the rave reviews but honestly I wasn't blown away. I ordered the Zeke sandwich with no mayo and board sauce. The Sando was just alright... and for a $11 sandwich it better be better then just ok. I have to mention though that the bacon and the board sauce were definitely better then average, but again 11 bucks for bacon and board sauce just isn't worth it. The pickles were not crunchy enough for my taste as well. Sorry to say but the sandwich spot is still my number one place.
author: Allie P.

description: Best Deli in SOMA! Thats for sure. Can be pricy like $20 for lunch but I mean c'mon its the Deli board, when you're going there its like you're going ALL IN!! You will be full and hella happy after you eat a sando w/ some chips!
author: Dario F.

description: Great catering!  Now I just have to get my behind down there to get my own sammich without having to share a tray that's cooled down to the point where you can't enjoy the full effect of this much talked about Deli Board!  Problem is of my order, the trio of the Basic Board #2 & the trio of the Bubees Board what do I make my final decision on?!?!? I'm torn between their corned beef & chicken salad sandwiches.  I have to say, the dressing that they delivered to us with our Shanghai Chicken Salad is beyond EXCELLENT!  I definitely hoarded the bottle to myself & used it after the meeting in fact *SHHHHH*  I worked with Adam from beginning to end on my order.  He was kind enough to respond with a quickness and reassured me everything was going to be handled without a hiccup.  He totally guaranteed & proved that.  Delivery, quality of eats & service. = Perfection.  Thanks again Adam!
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Not much to add that hasn't already been said. BIG, DELICIOUS SANDWICHES.
I can, without a doubt, vouch for the Reuben's Cousin / Cousin of Reuben...whatever they call it. An absolutely incredible mountain of corned beef, slathered with Board sauce (what's the secret?), topped with sauerkraut, and melted cheese. As much as I had planned to save 1/2 for dinner, I managed to find room for it all in one sitting. I didn't want to compromise the integrity of such a masterpiece by reheating.
Do this for lunch on a day that you have nothing planned for dinner.
author: Carnley P.

description:
Probably the best pastrami sandwich I've ever had. It is hot and packed so neatly! I hate it when a sandwich gets too messy (i.e. Ike's). I usually get the a pastrami sandwich with dutch crunch bread and avocado. They used to have grilled onions but they changed it to pickled onions (boo). 

Parking is really easy. I've never had a problem!
author: Sharon H.

description: Not great by any means especially when you factor the price in.  Great staff though and good vibe but I won't be back.
author: Bryan G.

description:
You need to know where the Deli Board is or you'll just be left wondering why all these people are standing outside an old building.  The sandwiches are made inside, in secret, and all customers are left outside on the sidewalk where they can communicate their order through the "bouncer" or runner.

The only do a couple types of sandwiches a day, so check their website ahead of time if you want to make sure they have something you like.  I checked every day until I saw the pastrami pop up, then I called ahead and picked up my order before 11 AM.  I highly recommend this strategy if you are short on time or don't like waiting in lines.

The d.Gordo (corned beef, turkey breast, house slaw, board sauce, dutch crunch for $9) was a huge amount of meat wedged between some yummy bread.  It was very good but I was only able to finish half.  Fine by me.  Deli board for two days!
author: Jean K.

description: We had both sandwiches and salads they were both better than our expectations.  Honestly, I never thought a sandwich could taste so good.  We are looking forward to many more trips to taste other items on the menu!
author: Catherine S.

description:
I've been here about a dozen times since I work a block away.. and our office orders from here at least 1x per week.  My favorite sandwich is the Lovejoy and fave salad is the Chagrin w/ smoked trout.  Everything is always so fresh and yummy!

But it's there service that I love, especially the catering the side.  The deliveries always come at the specified window, and usually on the early side of it.  5 stars for Justin for coming through on us last minute!  They are absolutely swamped at lunch time and they squeezed in a really important order for us.  

Thank you Deli Board!
author: Tira F.

description: Got the Sergio. Best deli sandwich I've ever had, and the meat was served hot, not warm. It was great.
author: Grace I.

description: This place deserves all the 5 star ratings it gets.  Hands down the best sandwich I have ever ate.  It can be a little pricy ($15 for the Pastrami/Corned Beef) but definitely worth it.  The sandwich was filling and extremely tasteful.  Will definitely return.
author: Andrew V.

description: Got the Boca, which has corned beef, pastrami, and brisket.  A very solid sandwich, stuffed full of meat, where you can taste each type's individual flavor.  Not the best pastrami I've ever had, but definitely still very good.
author: Simon L.

description: I was on the Great Salami Search one day while at work in the TL...didn't find a salami sandwich, but I found this place. It had great reviews so I decided the line must be worth it. I ordered a Gold-n-Berg-n-stein....got it back to the office and excitedly started chowing down. Can't even begin to explain how freaking delicious it was. It was huge and messy...but the mix of meats basically melts in your mouth. It was ridiculously good. and even tho I was full I finished the whole entire thing. Can't wait to go again!
author: Maritza D.

description:
Man, how come all these dope ass spots open up in my old hood after I leave?  If you like ginormous sammies on tasty bread then Deli Board has got the goods.  I've only been once so far, but got the Goldie: turkey breast, bacon, cheddar, mayo, board sauce, on a french roll.

The amount of meat on this thing was awesome.  And the bacon was perfectly crispy and crunchy while the sauce-mayo was really rich and flavorful.  Definitely can't wait to try it again.  The folks there were super friendly (and cute!) too. win!
author: Gene X.

description:
the first couple times i came here, i thought the sandwiches were so good.  after a few more times, the sandwiches started to all taste the same.  especially if you order from the first column where the meat is pastrami, corned beef etc.  

mine was supposed to have egg salad but it was barely detectable with my eyes, let alone my taste buds.  the left the cole slaw out of the other sandwich and when i tasted it, it tasted the same as mine.
author: claudia y.

description: This place is very good for the food and for the people that work here are very friendly. I live across the street from deli board don't get me wrong the first time I tried I was surprised with the prices, $9 a sandwich whow, hey this is the city so prices are a bit higher. The sandwich was very good, tasty, meaty not dry at all. Just noticed that the price went up again $9, $11 and now $15 for a sandwich. I like this place but for a local resident with a family, I sure have to think twice about eating here, beside the majority of the people eating their look like younger techie hipsters with no kids that have no problem in paying that much for a sandwich. So I'm pretty sure they will be good with out my support of ever buying a sandwich their again so I will enjoy this cause it's the last I'll have. $$$$$
author: Archie O.

description:
Great experience ordering from Adam. Loved that I could send an email and then just call in a credit card. The sandwiches came on time, which is always a plus when you have to feed a hungry crew. Bike messenger was really nice and helped unload the sandwiches in our kitchen, which he didn't need to do. 

As for the sandwiches, they were all warm and smelled great when I took them out of the bags. Just holding them, I could tell that these were some serious eats. I ordered the Boca because everyone raved about it. It was so good that I ate the whole thing in one sitting, normally I save half for later, but I just couldn't do it. 12 hours later and I'm still kinda full from the Boca sandwich.
author: Theresa D.

description: My favorite place cant stop away from, each lunch there thank  you Adam your service are really Best !!!!!
author: Angelica k.

description:
Who the fuck mixes chicken salad and salami with cherry peppers?  The dude that runs this place, and he don't give a fuck.

Tried the LRB, Goldnbergnstein and the Cohen.   If anything could make me want to live in SF it's the food and Deli Board is killing.
author: Kyle K.

description:
Good ole John Montagu, 4th Earl of Sandwich, might get credit for inventing the "sandwich," but places like Deli Board get the credit for making something simple like a sandwich, that is already amazing, more amazing times 1 trillion.  

Boca     $11
corned beef, pastrami, brisket, muenster cheese, Board 
sauce, brown mustard, pickles, french

The Boca is my selection. Not a huge pastrami fan, so I usually opt to get Turkey instead.  And they just simply knock it out of the park.  Amazing corned beef is hard to come by, but even more hard to come by, especially in SF, is amazing brisket.  But what do you know, Deli Board makes brisket better than most BBQ joints in this city!  This is just a melt in your mouth corned beef, brisket, turkey sando.  It is out of this world!

My only disclaimer is that, let's be honest, this is not a healthy choice.  But hey, you can always split the sando with someone, which is what I like to do most of the time.  Or take half home.   Whatever you want to do. 

But just give it a shot.  Head there for lunch, order one of the amazing sandwiches, maybe add some chips to snack on, don't forget the Mexican Coke, enjoy the casual lunch atmosphere and friendly staff.  That is your next complete lunch experience.  Just make it happen.  

Deli Board is highly recommended in my book.  I will most definitely be back.  5 Stars it most certainly is!

P.S. This joins the ranks along with Ike's Place as one of my top sandwich spots in SF!
author: John R.

description:
Here's some advice when you visit Deli Board:  come hungry, and come prepared to dine in.  You won't want to take this deliciously warm, gooey sandwich any further than the front door without devouring it. 

I finally made the trek over here the other day when I was craving a good Reuben.  They have a few different varieties, so I tried one of the specials of the day, the a.stud.  It consisted of pastrami, garlic french bread, jalapenos, cheddar cheese, cole slaw, avocado, & board sauce.  Wow!  Just reading the description made my mouth water.

I ordered & sat down.  In less than 10 minutes my sammie was brought out to me with a little baggie with 2 thick pickle slices.  I love pickles!  And these suckers are house made which makes them even better.

Imagine a philly cheese steak, but made with toasted garlic bread & filled with all the goodies I listed above.  It was heavenly.  Move over, Cheese Steak Shop!  Deli Board is my new fave sandwich shop.
author: Erin S.

description:
Delicious sandwiches worth the trip! I've never been able to try deli board since I don't work in SF and am not around for the lunch rush. Luckily I found myself in SF on a weekday during lunch.

No it's not any other deli sandwich. It is a top 5 sandwich spot and I'd happily come back here anytime!

We had  the Gold-n-Berg-stein: corned beef, salami, pastrami muenster, slaw and thousand island. HOLY threesome of meats! Absolutely delicious.

We also had the Kims:Corned beef, turkeys, swiss, peppers on garlic french bread. 

It's rare that I'm so excited for something typically mundane as sandwiches, but Deli Board knocks it out of the park. They have the perfect balance of crunchy toasted bread with that warm chewy interior. 

Here's a tip: City Beer Store is right down the street, Grab a sandwich and walk in to have a beer.
author: Mike K.

description:
Reuben aka the Cali!! 

Located in SOMA, an area where hipsters and the affluent congregate to boost our city's economy (happy face) while driving out all of our culture (sad face).

That being said, the sandwiches here are a little pricey - around $11 a hoagie.

That however, does not take away from how delicious the sandwiches are! They come out hot and meaty, with thick cuts of pickles! 

The cashier I had was very nice (not to mention cute!) and another employee came by to wipe the table I was at without being asked (I love that!) Outdoor seating is a huge plus! 

I will definitely be back whenever I want to put on some thick framed glasses or bootleg ray bans.
author: Dorian T.

description:
Deli Board is a 20 minute walk from my office, but I try to get there once a week for lunch.

Lunch time is crazy busy, but totally worth it. Get the $$$.
author: Tom P.

description: Sandwiches --- so effing good! Very casual spot with just a handful of tables, but dang the sandwiches are delicious. I ordered the A. Stud and my sister and her husband split the $$$. They're well priced for the size (they are huge and can easily be shared) and the owner and/or sandwich chef is super rad. He gave my sister and I a sample of their falafels. Definitely recommended but watch out for long lines, it gets long a peak hours.
author: mary c.

description: A slave to their sandwiches, I broke my routine and went with a salad for the first time. It might have been the best idea I've had since making the change from regular flavored Funyuns to wasabi flavored Funyuns! I don't think I can ever go back.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
The most under rated and under-talked about sandwich place in SF. So much better than Ike's and Wise Sons. The guy running this joint also has great place, "The Rye Project".

It's just so damn good. Sandwiches are served warm on a soft french roll. Pastrami  is amazing and so is the Turkey with muenster. They have a seasoned special sauce, I think it's a mayo base, that is phenomenal.
author: Jonathan K.

description:
Ike's Place has just been dethroned.

The Boca sandwich is the prime example of what sandwiches should be: a generous portion of delicious corned beef pastrami and brisket, held together by warm, aromatic French bread and an addicting Board Sauce (much like the Dirty Sauce at Ike's). Each bite packs a wallop of flavor that renders you speechless for a minute or two. Add in some spicy peppers or the habanero hot sauce, and you'll have yourself one of the best sandwiches that SF has to offer.

The BG is also incredible -- filled with their tender brisket, cheddar cheese, spicy peppers, and the Board Sauce. Due to the peppers, this one definitely brings some heat, and the flavors mesh together perfectly. Get this if you're not as much of a corned beef fan, and you'd like to stick to traditional brisket.

Yes, the sandwiches are a bit pricey at around $11 each, but the quality of the ingredients, the size of the sandwiches, and the explosive power of the flavors make it one hell of a deal. 

Think of Deli Board like a mature adult version of Ike's Place. Ike's is colorful and fun -- delicious flavors, but the ingredients are just good enough to get by. Deli Board adds in freshness and quality to the mix, while still being incredibly delicious. When all is said and done, Deli Board is just plainly far superior.
author: Roy C.

description:
The sandwich I had here was absolutely worth every penny!  Finally got here after first hearing about it opening a while back...and by a fellow Clevelander no less! I always support my hometown so all I had left to do was get here and see how good it was.  My friend and I both had the Gold-N-Berg-N-Stein.  All my favorite meats in one delicious place.  Something about taking that first bite...the consistency of the bread and the meat and the slaw....was just perfect!  I ended up bringing sandwiches home for the whole family and even though they didn't eat theirs until a few hours later, they still loved!  I let the owner know I was coming too as I just had to meet him and thank him for bringing the glory that is a good jewish deli sandwich...to San Francisco!

Get here!
author: Rachel C.

description: Adam and the team at Deli Board are fantastic!  For years they've been creating the best sandwiches in San Francisco, while also providing an incredibly friendly atmosphere for enjoying lunch.  The diversity of the ever-changing menu is spectacular, especially when it comes to the daily specials.  The BK and the LRB are absolutely the highlights!
author: Logan R.

description:
Great customer service (especially the file with the dark Marc Jacobs glasses). She knows us by name and is very patient in ensuring that all of our 20 Sammy order are all correct.

Great bread, crunchy, not too thick, generous on meat, yummy sauce AND some of their Sammie's are spicy (yummmm!!!).
author: Arlene R.

description: What's better than overstuffed sandwiches on a Saturday afternoon?  Our SF hosts have lunch here regularly on Saturdays just to enjoy the special BK sandwich = sausage, bacon eggs and cheese.  Turned out to be my favorite meal in SF.  Husband had the Zeke and also raved.  Fun and friendly staff and a line out the door for the whole time we were there.
author: Geralyn H.

description: Yum! A great sandwich shop that feels super local. If you're looking for a veggie option, I highly recommend the J Ocean - falafel and avocado goodness. Again, yum.
author: Ginny T.

description: So yes, it's an eleven dollar sandwich but it is so damn delicious that I'm glad it's $11 because then I'd get it everyday and that would be unhealthy. A delicious indulgence, I know I'll dream about the golden bergnstien.
author: Samantha D.

description:
I really like this place.  Their sandwiches are always changing and they have lots of options to mix and match.

The service is always the same, good, and the girls at the counter are so CUTE!  

See ya soon!
author: Jenny M.

description:
This review is based solely on the service, as I never ate here.
I went in 20 mins before closing and was surprised to notice there wasn't a line! Yes! (I DID notice, however, that a swarm of flies were buzzing around in the dining room). After saying "hello" to the counter girl, I proceeded to request that the cook trim some of the fat from the pastrami, as I prefer a bit more lean cut of meat. The cashier had only one thing to say to me: "NO". Being a restaurant owner myself, I decided to give her a second chance. I confirmed that the pastrami was presented as a sliced product, and suggested that it really was a simple process to just knife off some of the trim, (especially since the price was $16 !!!), but was met with the same "NO". By the way, a proper deli (Katz's, for example), never has a problem making such an accommodation for me! What a shame, because I was pretty hungry. Oh well.
author: Jimmy R.

description:
I love Deli Board and the Zeke sandwich, however, the experience has never been consistent. On a few occasions they've run out of ingredients which is quite the bummer at a deli and really limits your options.

I do really like the staff here; the service has always been great.
author: Renee S.

description: Original, unique, and delicious sandwiches, plus surprisingly fast service even when there's a long line. Also, the staff was amazingly friendly and patient when it was busy and I was a non-native asking for recommendations. Only downside is it's slightly expensive and it does get very busy around lunch time.
author: Tyler P.

description:
First time I came to this place was about a year ago.  Since then, I've found myself making excuses for why I need to be in SOMA around lunch time just so I can grab one of these.  Their sandwiches are always hot out of the oven with a ton of meat...just like a proper sandwich should be.

The Boca is my current favorite...adding some extra mustard seals the deal.

WARNING: Eating a whole sandwich by yourself, may result in a food coma.  Side effects may include procrastination and planning of next trip to Deli Board.
author: Dmitriy K.

description: Solid deli but a little pricey... If the prices were more reasonable I'd give it four stars.
author: Cameron V.

description:
I secretly think my whole office is having an affair with the owner, Adam. OK fine, I'm just kidding but they definitely have an unyielding addiction to Deli Board.

Like clockwork everyday, they march down mechanically as if possessed with money in tow.  Moments later, they climb their way back up three flights of wooden stairs only to plop down comfortably in their office chairs and unwrap the magical deliciousness that is Deli Board.

One bite, two bites, three bites.  The deliciousness is now devoured and they carefully wrap the second half and store for future nourishment.  As the final act, they disassemble the plastic baggy to unveil the crown jewel - the shiny, juicy and ultra vinegary pickle. 

Chomp, Chomp, Chomp.  Lunch is over.

And then history repeats itself again.
author: Lisa W.

description:
My buddy brought me here at 12:10 on a Friday right before the line started .

I ordered the first one on the menu I think it was the boca with brisket, pastrami munster cheese  and corned beef   without any pickles or sauce. And it was excellent

The sandwich had the right amount of crispiness that doesn't cut the top of your mouth. The meat was juicy ! It seemed like the People Putting together this sandwich work really hard because it looks so neat and doesnt really fall apart when you bite it.

The cashiers are cool and friendly !

I will be back and make a custom sandwich :)
author: DOM d.

description: sorry but $15 for a sandwich is pretty crazy. yes the $ sandwich was good, and if you are going to charge $15, at least make it a bigger sandwich or put in chips and a drink or something. the line is still pretty long so obviously plenty of people are willing to pay it but i dont think its worth the price.
author: Alex H.

description: One of the best restaurants in San Francisco. Amazing sandwiches, fantastic meat, special "Newish" appetizers on occasion. Friendly staff, speedy service, and a spacious ambiance. House-made hot sauce, "Stadium" mustard. You must try it!
author: Walter K.

description: This place is amazing.  I would give it 6 stars.  The pastrami and brisket feeds my dreams.  Great staff too.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Found Deli Board on Yelp actually, as me and a friend were exploring the city and just happened to be on the same street as this very promising sandwich shop. The atmosphere of this place is really fun and laid back, with most of their menu items named after people (I had the "Stephanie"). The staff that work there are really cool, fun to talk to, and seem to enjoy being there. Moe is my favorite!

Like I said, I had the "Stephanie", which was tuna salad, american cheese, bacon, sprouts, and their special sauce, all on a French Roll. This was such an amazing sandwich! It was also the HOTTEST grilled sandwich I've ever had! It went from the grill to my table in less than 10 seconds, easily. Deli Board also gives you a ziplock bag with a giant pickle in it, which is really cool because it feels like a true homemade lunch you are taking with you somewhere!

The only thing I didn't like about Deli Board, and this isn't entirely their fault, is that it was really hit inside. The day I was in San Francisco eating there was one of the hottest days the city had experienced that summer, so it was hot everywhere. But Deli Board doesn't have air conditioning, nor did they have any fans going to cool down their customers. They did offer free cold water, but that didn't cool me off much. It was almost unbearable in there, unfortunately.

Besides the uncomfortably hot air inside, Deli Board was a great experience. Great food, quick service, and friendly staff. Just bring your own personal fan!
author: Dillon H.

description: What can I say about DeliBoard that hasn't already been said about finding a $20 on the ground. That's definitely the feeling you will have, the first time you experience them. Thought most of the sandwiches appear to be slight variations of the same sandwich, they only "appear" that way. (I wonder who will get the movie reference in that statement). My only hiccup in this place is that the staff is ultra hipster which lends a temporary air to the establishment.
author: Taj T.

description: The $$$ Sandwich is great ingredients kept simple with the perfect balance of flavors. The sweetness of the coleslaw balanced the heat of the jalapeños perfectly. I can feel a craving coming on soon. To bad I'll have to wait for my next trip to San Francisco before indulging again. Oh and did I mention they rock vinyl on the stereo!!
author: Erin Y.

description:
FOOD - 5 stars
+ tons of flavor 
+ bread was perfectly toasted
+ condiments were just the right amount
+ plenty of meat
+ plain yummy

AMBIANCE - 4.5 stars
+ decor - cute
+ clean
- limited tables - middle tables are extremely close together which makes it impossible to get to if there are people on either side

SERVICE - 5 stars
+ friendly!

can't wait to come back and try different sandwiches!! i'm trying to be good and eat healthier, but i don't know how people come here and order salads! i guess with the willpower i do not have (which is why i'm a little chunky monkey right now), sigh...
author: Tina F.

description:
For a business that offers corporate catering, they turned away 15 sandwiches due to some weird rule that you can't have more than 5  sandwiches per person.  Nevermind the fact that we brought 3 people to adhere to this rule.  

We would have been happy to wait, as we understand that this spikes their workload.  

The best explanation I can come up with is that it's some weird hipster thing where they seek to avoid profitability and efficiency?  

Never going back again.  Good work guys.
author: Matt F.

description:
This place is great. 

I live and work in the SOMA and these guys always deliver a good sandwich when the craving arises.

The sandwiches are stacked high and show up hot and fresh. The bread is soo yummy, anything from the dutch crunch to the sweet french roll. 

I had a couple different options from here and have yet to be disappointed. Price ranges from $8 and up I believe, not to bad for what you get.

All in all I recommend. :)
author: Anthony S.

description:
I have never been a big sandwich person but visited this place with my husband and I am so glad I did.  Wow.  WOW.

I am kinda addicted now.

The dutch crunch bread.  Amazing.

The amount of meat they put on the sandwiches? Obscene.  I have to squish the sandwich down just to be able to take a bite.  

The secret "Deli Board" sauce? Addicting.

The homemade pickles? More please!

They are usually pretty busy so try to avoid the 12-1 lunch hour rush but if there is a line it is worth it.  You may want to walk though.  I can't imagine the sandwiches are in anyway shape or form healthy (well, maybe because I get bacon, cheese and board sauce on mine...) 

They are kinda pricey and I wish they had some sort of "frequent dinner program" but the quality (and amount of meet on the sandwich!) justify the price.  The staff is also very very very very nice.  

Go there.  Now.
author: Kimberly W.

description: So I'm stopping in San Francisco for one day, and I waste one of my valuable meals at a DELI? Oh yes, because this is no ordinary matzah ball type of place, and the care and consideration placed in every single ingredient is more than enough to warrant many repeat visits. I had the Boca because it was the first thing on the menu and then I sat and proceeded to eat my way through a footlong French roll with enough corned beed, pastrami, and brisket to kill a lesser man, but God help me, I wasn't going to waste a bite.
author: Brad S.

description:
been eating these sammiches since they had the little window shop on howard and STILL can't find a better deli.

they are freakin expensive, but top notch can charge a premium. this is the luxury car segment of sammiches.
author: Clover Dan ..

description:
Just when I thought I was a Munsoned or Cohen diehard I tried the Bradley.. SO good!

Honestly, if you want a top notch sandwich which includes a whole lot of love in the bread, perfectly seasoned meat, and Einstein-status recipe combinations go to Deli Board. 

Very straight forward shop, but that's what you want at a place that does straight awesome food. Do yourself a favor and order from the sign on the door when you walk in. 

Adam and Mo are awesome, as well. Always remember your name and that you're a regular. 

I can't wait to try 1058 Hoagie.
author: Danielle A.

description: My boyfriend and I got the roast beef and turkey with avocado sandwiches. I can't remember their exact names but they were good! Unfortunately they ran out of all types of pastrami that day. I definitely want to go back and try their pastrami sometime soon. I really want a pastrami sandwich right now =(
author: Annie Z.

description:
By far the most average $11 sandwich I've ever eaten.
By far the smallest $11 sandwich I've ever seen.

They were rocking the Teddy Pendergrass on the stereo, and probably on vinyl too, so that was nice, but the food was just plain PLAIN.
author: Nelson W.

description: Best sandwiches I've had in SF so far (been here for three months). Enjoyed the Vhat, Carzle, and A. Stud. The only downside was the prices. They were also the most expensive sandwiches I've had in SF, but I'd still come again.
author: Arthur C.

description:
Deli Board....YUM!! Wow, San Francisco has so many great restaurants...especially sandwich shops. Add this one to the list!

If you like MEAT, then you should stop by Deli Board for some meaty sandwiches. I asked the cashier what she recommended since my first time here was with an old friend, and she told me the corned beef sandwich (which was the first item on the sandwich list) was the most popular and usually a good choice to start your experience with. I got that sandwich and let me just say that she was absolutely RIGHT.

When ordering the corned beef sandwich, I thought I might not really like the sandwich since I'm usually not a fan of corned beef (usually too salty or something for me). But the way they made it and the light sauces that came with it were just absolutely perfect. Filled me up with no regrets. 

Also came with a pickle in a baggie. Good deal, great sandwich. Came out to about $9.

Major downside is that their store is pretty small so seating can be a challenge sometimes. Get here early or take it to go!

Plastics are accepted here. :)
author: Mitty C.

description:
This is the first real competition to Miller's East Coast West.  A close second, but still not beating the "King" on Polk Street.

Not a bad little hang in SOMA - the cutie pie waitstaff girls were borderline Hefner, so that was clearly part of the strategy: serve giant meat-filled sandwiches to hipsters, and add a little butt wiggle to boot.  The ladies even had the Dirty Dancing soundtrack playing on vinyl in the background - dancing behind the counter while ringing up pounds corned beef.  Nice one.

I enjoyed the vibe, loved the sandwich options - and would recommend it, jiggly bits and all.
author: Paul L.

description:
I have a friend (A REALLY GREAT FRIEND), who works in SF. Said friend, will randomly call/text with something like, "I'm craving ___. You interested?" I'm almost always interested. Then, before mentioned friend picks up mine and their order and viola, an hour or so later, it's delivered to me (just in time for my meal break) in the far East Bay. Now, that's friendship, right?! This is how I was introduced to Deli Board. 

As I have not personally viewed the Deli Board, I cannot speak to the conditions of the restaurant itself, or the friendliness of it's employees. 

However, the sandwiches here are not only good, but also creative and filling! They have both hot and cold sammies. I had the skully (turkey, salami, munster and american cheese, jalapenos, mayo board sauce, and cole slaw). My sandwich was meaty, cheesy goodness all wrapped in a dutch crunch roll... begging for me to devour it.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
I've had 2 sandwiches at this establishment and they were both really good. One better than the other. The munsoned was incredibly delicious. Piping hot meat with melted cheese... it was absolutely drool worthy. Im drooling thinking about it right now! If you're ever here, GET. THE. MUNSONED.

The other sandwich I had was a bit healthier. It consisted of sprouts, turkey, avocado and other veggies. It, too, was really good but this place is better known for their meat sandwiches. Make sure to try their mustards and sauces as well! 

The lines get pretty long but it goes by fast for the most part.
author: Kathleen R.

description:
How to be objective when irate. GO!

The sandwiches here are legit. Delicious. So are the pickles and the salads. Quality ingredients. 4 stars.

Dude that works there. Not cool. I have a ENORMOUS problem when a slight inconvenience, even if it means happy customers to talk about how awesome your sandwich place is and lots of business, sends you into an apoplectic rage.

My work does a walking lunch every Thursday. I tried to call ahead to place a big order for us, but Deli Board does not pick up their phone to facilitate this. We arrived en masse with fifteen people. As I had already taken the order beforehand, I stood in line while everybody waited outside. The girl at the counter, bless her, worked hard to accommodate us, knowing her boss was going to go ape-shit in the kitchen. 

Cue ape-shit: He marches out and tells me it's going to be an HOUR AND A HALF wait even though we had assured the girl it was fine if it came out piecemeal. I tell him that I was trying to make it easier for him by putting our order in and paying with one card, rather than standing all 15 people in line (which we could have done because they were all there) and doing single transactions for each one, in which case he would never know we were all part of the same party.

 He didn't care. In an effort to teach us a lesson, he filled the order of every single person in the lunch line (including people who arrived half an hour after we did) before addressing a single sandwich in our order. He now has 15 unhappy customers who nominated me to write this review. 

I get it's annoying, but muster the grace to handle it. The guys at Oasis Grill didn't even bat an eyelash when the same thing happened and even gave us a free bag of falafel while we waited. THAT'S customer service and I will evangelize good customer service like whoa in the Yelp-o-sphere.
author: Eli B.

description: Delicious. Great service and delicious food. Tried the Vhat and the Cheeseburger soup with a cream soda. I will definitely be back!
author: Ev C.

description: I had the vacht! Very delicious! And the red peppers were so yummy! Perfect spice! I could definitely eat here everyday!
author: Tania C.

description:
Holy mother of PEARL this place is good. Could be top 10 places I love in SF. The portions are huge. The menu is extensive and the combination are wacky. However you can build any sandwich you like and they will make it to perfection. 

This place is a sandwich lover heven. It is a true gem for the small population of us. The line can be long but it move very fast. This leads me to the last amazing part of this place. There staff are a bunch of fantastic folks.
author: Ryan B.

description:
Munsoned was yummy but a bit too cheesy for my taste. Their sandwich bread is soft, just to my liking!

Although a believer in paying big bucks for quality goods, I do believe that Deli Board is a few dollars pricier than they are worth. 
I enjoyed Deli Board very much, but the $$s might keep me from making a second trip.
author: Miss A.

description:
The pictures are deceptive! I was under the impression the sandwich would be as big as my hand but it was even smaller than other places I've frequented. I ordered the boca and though it was yummy, never shall I feel guilty about an $11 sandwich. yes they use 4505 meats but you need to do something to compliment the meat rather than rely on it. I do love their sauce and homemade pickles! 

The service was superb and friendly! Even with that said, I'm not sure if I can muster enough strength to spend $11 on a sandwich again in terms of it feeling like "Eat 1 Pay for 2!"
author: Connie C.

description:
I have always heard raving reviews of this place from my friend but never thought to check it out until now. I'm not a huge sandwich person but Deli Board blew me away. Maybe I was starving on a Saturday morning or maybe I've just become really open to wherever my husband decides to drag me....

either way I ate the whole damn sandwich. I ordered a plain Pastrami on dutch crunch bread. It only had Pastrami, Meunster cheese, pickles and sprouts. The sandwich was about 7-8inches long, HOT, and cut in half.

I'm not usually a pastrami fan either but this pastrami was juicy with the right amount of fat and piled really high. I actually had to take out some meat near the end to finish the sandwich. It tasted so fresh.  The wait for the sando wasn't too long either. We probably only waited less than 10 minutes. 

In my opinion, this deli is better than Ike's and AK subs (for sure). Will definitely be coming back for more pastrami!
author: Terry D.

description:
The food gets a solid 5 stars no questions asked. Some of the best pastrami I have ever had in my life.


However, I've been going here for over a year and have watched as the portions get smaller and the prices go higher. 15 months ago this place was amazing $12-$14 dollars for a sandwich with tons of delicious delicious meat. Nowadays the prices are the same but the meat serving has been cut in half. You can add extra meat for $3, but that just means you bought a $20 sandwich...

I'll stick with teh pluthera of other sandwich places where I dont need to drop a $20 on a 3 ingredient sandwich.

As a note, the sister store which serves cold sandwhiche's hasn't had the same magnitude of problems.
author: David W.

description:
I think the sandwiches here are good, but am a bit perplexed by the insanely positive reviews. My BOCA was a quality sandwich--the meats were excellent and it's clear they put some thought into their combos instead of just making up random shit to put between two slices of bread.

But it's $11, before taxes, and that's one of the cheaper options. I realize other places are similarly expensive or even moreso (Wise Sons, I'm looking at you), but for that kind of money you could at least throw in chips or something. The sandwiches are decent size but certainly not massive. Overall I'm more likely to stick with AK Subs to satisfy my pastrami craving-they might not have the crazy inspired combinations but the meat is just as good and the price is right.
author: Bill H.

description:
YUM. 

OK, I've only eaten here once. So take what I say with a grain of salt. BUT YUM.

Being from Indiana, I love Cincinnati-style chili. Even though it's awful for you, let's not kid ourselves. I haven't had it in forever. I came here with some co-worker's for lunch and their specials including Cincinnati-style chili. So, of course, I ignored my health for the afternoon and got it. It was spot on. Delish.

Hats off to you, Deli Board.
author: Jenny J.

description: I have trouble articulating how much I love this restaurant. Probably my favorite sandwiches on the planet. The owner, Adam Mesnick, is a hospitable and talented chef. There is not a single sandwich that disappoints! Yesterday I enjoyed the chicken tortilla soup, which is a new recipe. It was perfect on its own, but when I added the haba impaler (their hottest hot sauce) it was somehow even more delicious! After that, I enjoyed the Ron sandwich. Fresh roast beef was piled high, accompanied by avocado, jalapeno, cheddar cheese, mayo based board sauce, and their unbelievable cole slaw. The bread they bring in exclusively from a local baker every morning is mouth watering on its own, and it's truly the piece de resistance. If I lived in San Francisco, I would probably be here multiple times each week. Adam hails from my native city of Cleveland, which brings the shop even closer to home! The Cleveland themed decor is super awesome.
author: Alexa A.

description: not your ordinary sandwich...a manwich!..a short line to the counter and order...quite a longer wait for sandwich delivery....golden-n-berg-n-stein $eleven...hot pastrami sandwich....and, a boca...a napoleon tri-layer of brisket, corned beef and pastrami!...sealed between heavenly toasty crispy bread...hint of vegetables and all meat!...a manwich!..intense juicy salty meaty bite...a mouthful of meat...open the ziploc for pickle slices...save the plastic and toss it on the tray...another bite and another....crunch of the bread...mouth watering salty goodness fresh pastrami beef...serious beefy manwich!..meat, meat and more meat in every bite to the end...manwich!...bring on the meat!
author: Hen A.

description:
If you're a hardcore carnivore such as myself, Deli Board should be your new hunting ground. I've never had a bad sandwich here, although some stand taller than the rest (I'm looking at you, Mish).

There are a couple tables outside in case you want to soak up some sun, just make sure you get there before 11:45a if you want a chance to sit down.
author: Tim J.

description: If you're looking for a hearty heavy meat filled sandwich this is your place. Got the hermine and the first bite was amazing, but soon after wished there was more vegetables, maybe extra peppers. Will be back for something else.
author: Coba C.

description:
Wow.  the breakfast sandwich!  

sausage, egg and bacon, in a soft dutch crunch roll?   seriously.  

I haven't tried the others, but wow, i'd definitely recommend this.
author: Jason J.

description:
The best pastrami you can get in San Francisco.

Hype-worthy! We ordered both the Boca and the Gold-n-Berg-n-stein. The Boca was amazing. 3 different types of deli meat (corned beef, pastrami, brisket), that go oh so well together. Completely opposite of Subway and it's devotion to being lean with meat, Deli Board loads each sandwich all the way up. However, after awhile the different meat flavors start to blend together, especially if you order and share two sandwiches. Next time, we'll definitely share, but we'd go with a salad and a sandwich. 

Tip: Best time to go for a shorter wait ... 2pm on a Saturday.
Tip2: Dog friendly!
author: Henry T.

description:
I'm not a fan of sandwiches. Too dry, crunchy.

When my friends and I bit into ours today, there were moans and groans. Good ones.

Get the rlmb. Moist roast beef, crispy bacon, fresh coleslaw. And, in my opinion, the key to the best sandwich I've ever had: the softest, most delectable bread (no owies and messes from sharp bread crumbs).

Oh, and unlimited mustard and serrano hot sauce!
author: Jeena C.

description:
My coworkers and I end up here at least once a week for lunch.  Love this place.  I usually get the Zeke when I want something a little "fresher" tasting.  The Zeke has turkey breast, cream cheese, avocado, among a variety of other ingredients.  If I am lucky enough I'll split halves with a friend for a Boca.  

Do try their sauces.  The Haba haba is pretty good.  The Thai Chili sauce is ridiculously spicy and I LOVE SPICY.
author: Bert N.

description:
This place is amazing! I actually leave work early and hoof it out to one of my least favorite neighborhoods in the city just for one of their delicious sandwiches. The staff is amazing, which doesn't matter at all. I would buy this food even if it was being served by Mikhail Gorbachev's mole after it had gone to the bathroom and hadn't washed its hands.

I usually get the munsoned, which is so good I might start crying if I think about it too much right now. I'm getting verklempt. Talk amongst yourselves. I'll give you a topic: Deli Board- the best sandwiches in the city? Discuss.
author: claire c.

description:
So glad I bookmarked this place - makes it easier to find when we are looking for a lunch spot.  

Good location - at least one can find parking nearby.

Not a fancy place but it feels welcoming - it has to be the red walls, the large deli board menu and the friendly staff.  Outdoor seatings available.  Besides the fixed menu, they have daily specials. Drinks and chips are displayed behind the cashier.  Water is available on request. 

What's really cool about this joint - their music.  Why?   It' the good old vinyl on a turntable - while we were there, they played Duran Duran and Talking Heads.

We studied the menu ahead of time but were still debating.  The daily specials threw us a curved ball - two of the specials included a fried egg!  I love eggs and to me, everything taste better with an egg.  When I got up to the register, I asked if they can add a fried egg to the Boca.  If so, that's what I would like - if not, I'll opt for the special.  After checking with the chef, they said yes for $2 - done!  

What we had:

Boca - pastrami corned beef and brisket muenster cheese Board sauce brown mustard pickles sweet french - $11 and added a fried egg - $2. 

d. nice - turkey breast bacon avocado pepperoncini blend cheddar
cole slaw Board sauce brown mustard sweet french -$10

bottled coke, free water.

All sandwiches are hot.  It's perfectly toasted - crunchy outside and soft inside...the heat makes for a very juicy sandwich with the meat, cheese, special sauce...etc.  The Boca was insane especially with the fried egg.  If you like meat, this is a must have - it's loaded w/ brisket, corned beef and pastrami.  The turkey was just as insane - loads of turkey, bacon, creamy delicious avacado...YUM!

While we were enjoying our boca, the chef came out asking "who asked for the fried egg on the boca?" - first thought that came to mind was "crap, he wants to see who's the trouble maker".  When he asked the 2nd time, I raised my hand.  He smiled and said that's awesome then came over to ask us if it was good.  We nodded and gave the thumbs up and said "everything taste better with an egg" and he agreed.

If you like their meat, you can take them home - they sell them with a 1/4 pound minimum.

Look forward to our next visit.
author: Gloria H.

description:
Was excited to see what all the hype was about, and while the food itself is good, the service and staff leave much to be desired. 

Deli board imposes a 6 sandwich limit and those who violate this rule will be asked to leave or will be limited to ordering only 6, regardless of how many people you have waiting in line with you... typical over rated San Francisco restauranteur mentality.

Tip to the owner: treat your customers with a little more respect as they are the ones paying...
author: Bryant W.

description:
Oh man. Best sandwiches in San Francisco, hands down.

My favorite is the Zeke, sans cream cheese. Their homemade pickles are to die for and the portions are ginormous. Worth every penny.

I recently tried their Le Lou salad and it was pretty good too. Their falafels are not too dry and hummus salad dress has a lovely roast taste.

Lines will be long after 11:30am--consider yourselves warned.
author: Annie L.

description:
Out of breath.

Not from the walk over to their latest location (hence the return visit).

From the sandwich. Such a ridiculous amount of turkey. Each bite didn't leave much room for anything else. Like air.

Building a basic means choosing bread (wheat roll), meat, veggies and toppings (hummus even though it wasn't listed). Everything I love. Like this sandwich.

Comes with two ginormous pickle slices that remind you why pickles are one of the greatest things ever.

Board sauce is also one of the greatest things ever. Got it on the side. Dipped more than planned. Ingredients are a secret. Some things are best left to your imagination.

Loved the new space. Small and focused. Wood accents. Board mounted menus. Apparel inspired by the Oakland A's design.

Only thing keeping it them from five is the price. As others have mentioned $10+ tax isn't cheap. At least you get a sandwich that will take you breath away.
author: Jason B.

description: Wow.....looks like your prices have increased again. $13 plus tax for a sandwich. I liked you much better when you were at your old location. I'll pass.
author: Lester W.

description: The quality of the sandwiches here are top notch. They are shockingly expensive at $12 each, but they are quite large (not quite Ike's large) and you can tell you're getting what you pay for.  The bread and meats are fresh and come out warm. Love the Skully. Definitely a go to spot for an indulgent deli
author: Rock M.

description:
What's going on with all these overhyped sandwich places?!

Go ahead, hate me, but it is okay. I think I've lost patient for places like this. Don't get me wrong, the sandwich is pretty good, the meat are well done, but there are plenty of other delicious places in the city that I don't feel like I need to bend over backwards for this.

First, the people work there need to have some coffee so that they can keep their eyes open; second, the long line is really long because the staffs are not all that fast. Third, it is lunch place, not a brunch place. I can't devote the entire hour of my lunch looking for parking; waiting in line to order; waiting in line for the making of the sandwich.

For god's sake, it is a sandwich, given it is your fancy smancy artisian crafted sandwich, but don't tell me it take 5 min to put the muster on.

After $15, 30 mins of standing around, I am done working so hard for a sandwich that I simply wanted to fill my stomach during lunch. 

Although I won't oppose just picking up some deli meat here by the pound.
author: Alice C.

description:
Mmmm... wait, this tastes just like a BAGELDOG!

Good sandwich though. I had the Golden-Burg-N-Stein (I think that's how you spell it). It's a french roll that's filled with a lot of meat, mainly tasting of corn beef. This sandwich has to be one of the most condensed and compact of sandwiches. I don't know how they squish so much meat into one sandwich! It's perfectly constructed so that eat bite cuts through smoothly. It still drips a little grease. I couldn't really taste much else besides the corn beef and bread even though there were some other ingredients added to the mix. The slaw is almost laughably small in comparison to the amount of meat. I wish there had been just a bit more veg for a different texture. A sandwich comes with two quarters of a giant pickle.

The sandwiches aren't that big. They're "pocket-friendly"; however, since they're packed so tight with meat you shouldn't be hungry afterwards. I ate my entire sandwich and thought that I was going to tip over. Watch out because these sandwiches are served piping hot. They're friggin' hot! (But good) $11 for a sandwich seems steep except once you start eating the sandwich you forget about the price. It has a sort of addictive quality. I do agree with Erica T's comment that the sandwich is pretty salty. You'll be fat and dehydrated afterwards.

The interior is pretty basic. Just one little storefront with enough seating for maybe 30. The walls are covered with menus and sandwich photos. There are two cashiers and nothing much else. This is a sandwich shop after all. Most of the clientele looked to be young white and asian. It always seems to be busy.

____

If you're craving a well constructed hot meat sandwich this is the place to check out.
author: Michael H.

description:
I've dreamt of the perfect Italian Sub sandwich, but today I found it. 

And life will never be the same again. 

Ladies and gentlemen... THE GALLUCI
genoa salami, capicola, mortadella, mozzarella, seasoned onions, hot cherry peppers, lettuce, oil and vinegar, sesame hoagie roll (not baked) 

To the fine folks at the Deli Board: Please make this a regular item on the menu. Please. Pretty please.... Please. Please. Please?
author: Stephanie I.

description:
I am so thankful I came across Deli Board!  

It was my BF's 30th bday this weekend and he wanted to do a party bus to the Niner game. Great.  But we live in SD.  Planning the entire fiesta would be difficult since we couldn't go the traditional tailgating route without spending way too much money.  

In my planning I came across Deli Board and decided to have them cater the fiesta.  IT WAS PERFECT!  Enough sandwiches for everyone were delivered to our hotel (Justin is awesome BTW!) in boxes that were easy to get onto the bus.  Everyone loved the sandwiches.  If you want great sandwiches for a big group of guys, this is the place to go.   

The service was fantastic and the food was great.  I'm looking forward to stopping by their new location the next time I'm in SF.  

THANKS AGAIN!!!!!!
author: J. V.

description: Go see Adam and try anything he has on the menu.  Soups, salads and sandwiches all beyond great.  I highly recommend the "BOCA".  Never thought I'd like corned beef and pastrami and brisket with cheese, but WOW what a combination.  "Marvin" style is meat, cheese and toasted roll, but get everything on it if you prefer.  I do not like to put anything on my sandwiches so that the flavors of the meat(s) and cheese come thru and boy does that happen at The Deli Board.  1058 Folsom between 6th and 7th streets.  Open 11A to 5P Mon - Sat
author: Marvin G.

description:
Love this sandwich shop!  Had the Saracevic sandwich.  Meat sliced oh so thinly, love the pepperoncinis, the perfectly soft bread, just the right amount of cheese....  Pure heaven.  

The restaurant itself is rather small and nondescript from the outside.  It's clean, the people are very nice and the food is great.  What more can you ask for out of a sandwich place.  It's absolutely great!
author: Michael B.

description: So yummy and would be a 5 but it is kind of pricy. I love the selection and love that it is just one of those  joints that don't have a sign and you just walk into because of the crowd.  My husband loves the Stefanie and I usually create something.  I love eating here and would recommend it to anyone in the area.  Huge sandwiches... Very filling.
author: Lyndsey C.

description: Now that Deli Board is within walking distant from my office, I have no choice but to come here on a regular basis!!!! The sandos do come out much much quicker than their old location on Howard street. Plus I can now at least sit down and chow it down before i head back to the office!!
author: Wolfy W.

description: So goooood!  Sandwiches are substantial. During the day I can't eat too much bc I will surely fall asleep.  Back in high school I had band class after lunch and I swear, I fell asleep sometimes. Anyways, in order to avoid food induced narcolepsy, I only ate half of my sandwich. It pained me to give the other half away to a friend but I needed to stay awake.  I had the Ron which was delicious. It had a great balance of flavors - nothing that was too overpowering. It was roast beef, cheddar, slaw, jalapeños, and avocado on a garlic French roll. Sandwiches are served hot!  Also, they give you a giant pickle on the side that tasted like Clausen pickles - my favorite since they are crunchy and have a strong salty, vinegary, dill flavor.  Will be back!
author: Alison H.

description: I love these sandwiches - they're always fresh, delicious and super tasty. Probably my faviorite sandwich place in SF.
author: Russell S.

description:
Deli Board has been in my bookmark for gosh knows how long. It was a hang out day with Jenny K. so she said I  got to choose where to go.
