description: This place is San Francisco sandwich Mecca. So good that I make the pilgrimage from Palo Alto on the weekend. Great ingredients and really well prepared. HIghly recommended.
author: James A.

description:
If you are going to make your customers wait 20 MINUTES for a sandwich, at least give them a place to sit...a bench, a chair.  You can always drag them in at night.
If you are going to open a "deli" and the first 2 items on your menu are pastrami and corned beef, "WHERE'S THE RYE???"

Due to the lack of proper bread, I ordered a turkey/salami sandwich Scully. The turkey was generously portioned but the salami, not so much.  Sauces were good and the sandwich was hot ( a lovely surprise).  It was large enough to share (points for that).

For my $12, I want snappier service, a larger selection of breads and a place to sit if I have to wait. 

I work 1 block away.  I'll give you some time to get your timing together then I'll go back.  Worth a second try.
author: Lynne B.

description:
The sandwiches are AMAZING. and they're HOT. Boy does that always surprise me. And you get a ziploc of pickles on the side. Huzzah! I've tried 4-5 of the sandwiches here, including daily specials, and I'm pleased. Going to several other popular sandwich shops regularly though means my standards are high, but I find Deli Board to be competitive.

Unfortunately, the sandwiches are a bit pricey ($10-$13), and once you add chips and drink, you walk away at $15-$17. For lunch. Ouch. Indoor seating accommodates maybe 30 people, but since there's always a crowd and line, it gets very full very fast. There doesn't seem to be any active airflow either, so on hot days, it's slightly uncomfortable. There's 2 tables outside, but it's right on the sidewalk which experiences moderate foot traffic and, of course, a crowd of to go people, during the lunch hour. 

In summary, you'll be wow'ed with the sandwich, but the cost and space makes this more of a once in a while place than a regular stop.
author: Matt T.

description: Fun place for great sandwiches with a Cleveland Ohio stadium mustard theme. Which is ironic after just having moved from CLE.
author: Mark K.

description: The ratings distribution for this place speaks for itself. More than anything, this review is just another vote of confidence. They are generous here with the meat portions, and the when the hot sandwiches come out it feels like they've been pulled straight from the oven to your table. The service here is great, and Deli Board serves up some of the best sandwiches I've ever had.
author: Morris C.

description:
O.M.G.

Seriously the BEST sandwich I've had in recent history (or perhaps ever.)  I was craving a pastrami sandwich like the ones I used to get at Johnnie's in Culver City/LA (not that they were the best, but a girl's got her cravings.)

The Boca sandwich with pastrami, corned beef and brisket was a life changer.  Add some pepperoncini for a lil kick, and you're golden.  The sandwich came out piping hot, crispy on the outside and with melty cheese everywhere...pure perfection.  Big enough to share, if you also get some chips and a drink.  It was so good though, I ended up eating the whole damn thing.  Diet FAIL, but so worth it. :-)

It can get pretty busy at lunch, but the line moves steadily forward, and the serving girls are very sweet.
author: Nancy O.

description:
Once again, the 7x7 hype machine strikes. This place looks good on paper, creative sammy names and good looking meat combos. They even have a cute name for their sauce, just like the other shitty over hyped sandwich joint, Ike's. I got the Bubba. Roast beef., Cheddar, Pepperoncinni blend, Board Sauce. Couldn't even finish it. I could get the exact same pressed garbage roast beef at Safeway.  In other words, it wasn't roasted and is essentially store bought fake meat. It had the texture of warmed up rubber. Now isn't that bit of a sham?

It doesn't matter how creative your sandwich names are or how zippy and zingy your house sauce and other condiments may be, if your deli meats suck, you suck. I said it before and I'll say it again, if you want a good sandwich, go to Woodside Deli in Redwood City. They make their own RB and Pastrami in house. They don't fake it. If that's too far, go to Genova in Oakland OR Lucca in the Marina.

To all you sandwich joints in SF that have fancy menus, great reviews in hip SF magazines and give interviews stating how you use all the freshest, highest quality ingredients - If you can't back up your own manufactured hype with real, quality ingredients, get the F out of my city. Deli Board, as far as the Bubba goes, you are a faker.
author: Seth G.

description:
Pretty tasty pastrami sandwich. Bummed that I did not look at the special board, some great choices were on it.

On a nice day, get it to go and eat it at the park across the street.
author: Joshua C.

description: My only problem with this place is that I had not heard of it earlier. I love everything about this sandwich shop. First off the sandwiches are Fantastic, great meats and fresh bread what more could you ask for. Oh Stadium Mustard from cleveland? SURE!  Their own HOT sauces .. yes please. and what I really feel ties it all together is a sound system playing VINYL records! I am so happy this place exists and can't wait to go back!
author: douglas B.

description:
My complaint before was that I couldn't get enough of them because of their short hours. Now that they have an actual location they are perfect (other than being a little farther than before)

The Gold n berg n stein and boca are still the best. And those pickles are still awesome.
author: Sam H.

description: The Deli Board made me like pickles. And their sandwiches are incredible!
author: Grant M.

description: The sandos are the best here.  Adam was really polite and always best in service.  Every time I come to sf I make it a point to come here.  Sandwiches are filling.
author: Mike G.

description:
Man, what a sandwich! I want more more more!!!

I had: the boca, munsoned, and the Rach.

The Boca is my fav!! There is actually enough meat in there. And quite tasty. I like pickles so I think this is what did it for me. 

The munsoned is also excellent!!! Lots of flavorful meat. Not dry at all. There are peppers in it that make a nice kick. MmmMmmgood

The Rach was not as good as the other two. But still good. Just not as flavorful and I think a lil dry at the end.

My new favorite sandwich place. YUM!!!
author: Mai H.

description:
Take out.

Think sophisticated Ikes.
Less filling, comparable robust flavors.
Expect 1.5-2 hour wait during busy time (right when they open).

Vegan black bean chili:
1. Packs a nice, subtle heat. 
2. Lacks visible yams
3. Nobody should be eating this many beans in one sitting.

Veggie Sandwich:
1. Great flavor, doused with spicy, pickled peppers
2. Melted Muenster FTW

$7-9/sandwich
$4 soup for DAYS
author: Jane L.

description:
I would have given you all five stars, Deli Board. I really would have. But you forgot about me. Your sandwiches are sublime with meat piled high and so saucy, but the one I ordered ... the Ron ... was not in the bag and so I will have to wait until my next trip to wrap my hands around you and have you all to myself. 

Until then, keep yourself safe from wanton women and eyes bigger than  stomachs. I'll be returning to you soon.
author: Olivia L.

description: This place rocks.  you know it from the line out the door.  It's more expensive than your regular sandwich, but it's well worth it!  Oh, the flavors!  Oh, the choices!!  Go off peak for the best chance to sit and enjoy the fresh, hot sandwich you've ordered and savor the flavors!
author: Caleb H.

description: Yup, what she said!  I just tried this place for the first time today...had the Boca delivered to work.  My mouth was literally salivating just looking at it.  Everyone knows that thin slices bring out the flavor and the Deli Board does it right.  The only drawback is now I'm in a food coma and can't do anymore work!
author: Joe M.

description: Had the zeke which had turkey and bacon in it. It was delicious but pricey at $12 for less than a footlong. The pickles are delicious as well.
author: Thien-Tu T.

description:
YUM.

I am vegan and on Jury duty, so i went and looked for sandwich shops in the area. Really mellow decor, friendly staff.

I got: Dutch Crunch, avocado, cherry peppers, red onions and brown mustard. 

So if you are with all your bros (i was the only girl there :) ) and they are craving pastrami, you can get a good, hot vegan sandwich!
author: allison s.

description:
It was alright... I went to Deli Board for the first time last week during my lunch hour with some co-workers. They recommended it and said it as really good! I had the "mick," which was a roast beef (my favorite) and american cheese sandwich with their special sauce. I was expecting something amazing because of the hype. However, the sandwich was merely okay. It wasn't great or amazing. The roast beef was good but the sauce was pretty bland. At times it felt like I was eating a McDouble from McDonalds...

The line wasn't that long and the wait for the sandwiches weren't that long either. The person taking orders was extremely friendly and energetic. 

I would probably go again and try something different--perhaps more unique.
author: Kevin H.

description:
OOOOOH SHA SHA!  I am not even a diehard sandwich person, like some of you out there, but I nearly died after taking my first bite of the Sha Sha.  It was nothing short of amazing...

The perfect combination of flavors and soft and crunchy goodness: loads of fresh turkey meat, topped with grilled to perfection onions, not too mayo-y slaw, muenster cheese, all highlighted in a subtle, yet delicious Board sauce, and tightly packed in a dutch crunch roll...YUM!  Can't believe I got all of this for under 10 bucks!

Sionara Toaster Oven and Focaccia, helloooooo Deli Board!!
author: Nicole A.

description:
One of the guys in my office insisted this was a sandwich place that would "blow your mind and change your universe" (his words).  Hardly....

I tried to order for the office to be ready for pickup at a certain time.  Whoever picked up the phone was INCREDIBLY rude.  It seemed like he just wanted to pick a fight.  I was trying to clarify whether 6 sandwiches would disqualify me from being able to order between 11-2:30 (a ridiculous policy anyway).  I was FINALLY able to determine that if I came down to the shop I could attempt to place my order but may be turned away.  How is this make any good business sense?

 The young woman behind the counter was incredibly sweet and even offered a glass of water while I waited.  The quoted me 15 minutes until the 6 sandwiches would be ready (reasonable) and I was happy to find they were right on time.  

The sandwich was good, not fantastic and definitely not worth the price or the lacking customer service.  To order for the full office would be impossible and hardly worth the hassle.
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
Hands down! best sandwich EVER
the line is long, so get there before 11:45am during weekday lunch is a good idea.
author: Zee Z.

description:
Jersey's on 6th has a really good roast beef sandwich. I don't think I've had a better one anywhere... Its house made and thier specialty, if you happen to be around 6th and California, give these guys a try. 

 I forgot to put some some fix-ins, I finally noticed the extra's after I ordered the BOCA.  I wish these guys had longer hours, their menu is right on.  It's a pricey sandwhich, but seriously worth it!
author: Demanding T.

description:
This place is almost impossible to eat at if you work in the East Bay like me since it's hours are 11-3 weekdays only.

Fortunately for me, I am able to manipulate good people in my life to bring me sandwiches occasionally ; )

We agreed to order two and swap halves (ohhh sounds dirty).

Anyway, I wanted the Boca and she was ordering the Reuben's cousin. Both sandwiches came with some pickles that tasted homemade (think less salty, more resemblance of cucumber)

The Boca was good. I remember looking at it and thinking "wow this is really meaty." I believe there was corned beef, pastrami, and brisket involved. I like it but it felt like it was lacking a sauce.

I really enjoyed the Reuben's cousin.  With corned beef, sauerkraut and Swiss cheese on a French roll, it just tasted like a really good quality classic sandwich. 

I love that they deliver for free in SF, but they need an east bay location to earn that 5th star from me!
author: Egan B.

description: What can I say that hasn't already been said? It's one of the city's best, and it's a top-down reflection of the kitchen's leadership and the attitude of the front of the house. I've never had a bad sandwich at Deli Board -- a terrific addition to the neighborhood South of Market on Folsom @ Sixth.
author: West R.

description: Probably one of the best $15 I ever spent in my life. Amazing sandwich and even though it's expensive, it's SF so it was expected. I can't wait to come back!
author: Hassan E.

description:
It's raining cats and dogs out there and my pants just dried from adventuring through the storm. Deli board does bike delivery even in the rain. Awesome! 

I ordered 4 sandwiches that came in less than 30 minutes and they're still hot. The delivery guys says today's my lucky day and that I get a free dessert. Even better.

Sandwich: Still tasty and good as before.

Dessert: Homemade. Tastes okay. Nothing too special. Kinda wet... can't really complain though, it was free.

In the end... pants still dry, good sandwich, and free dessert. It doesn't get better than this.
author: Steven B.

description: My son invited me for lunch at Deli Board today. It was so crowded at the time we got there that I immediately thought food must be excellent in this place... I was right!  I ordered a roast beef sandwich, which was prepared to perfection. I would say that it's been the best roast beef sandwich I have eaten in years. I will definitely go back to Deli Board next time I go to SF., and I will recommend this excellent Deli Restaurant to all my relatives and friends. They deserve FIVE STARS!!!
author: Roberto B.

description:
I had two sandwiches in one day: "The Mish" and the Roast Beef. The Mish was a hot take-away sandwich, right from the kitchen. The Roast Beef was a 'catering' sandwich, pre-made and wrapped for catering setting.

I don't care what anyone says; these two sandwiches are built for two very different settings.  And I think it's for a reason.

The hot, take-away sando is 'built for speed': made to be consumed within 15 minutes. After 20-30 minutes, the dressing is soaking into the bread and it can get a bit soggy (I had mine after about 10 mins.) The catering style sandwich is what i call 'built for cruising': it can sit for awhile in a conference room or office fridge.

The Mish was hands down the best sando I have ever had. A little heat from the jalapenos, with perfectly slow-grilled onions, and shaved meat siting on top of crispy bacon and toasted bread.  I hate sandwiches that when you bite into them whole pieces of ingredients get dragged out with the bite. This is NOT one of those.  No single bite had me dragging onions or bacon or pastrami from the sandwich.  And no gristle, either. Really, it was warm, easy to eat (even while standing on the Muni train), and had an incredible combination of flavors.  This had East Coast written all over it.

The Roast Beef (catering wrapped) was a solid sandwich. The bread was a little thicker than The Mish and had less dressing. I think they do this to cut down on the soggy factor. You can always add a little what-have-you when you get it in front of your face.  Like the Mish, this had shaved meat (roast beef on this one) that was seasoned just right, with horseradish and I think some spinach or lettuce between it and the bread (again, I think this is to cut down the soggy factor.  I ate this after it had an 12-hour layover in my fridge, and I have to say that it was every bit as good as The Mish. I'm partial to hot sandos, so I am going back for The Mish. But if I had to cater an event, I won't think twice about getting them from here.

I haven't had the soup or breakfast, so don't ask me about that.  Maybe later.
author: Tristan D.

description:
A great deli is a true gem in any city and this one is an SF must-eat. I had my first Deli Board sandwich in August, and I still remember it clear as day-- Hands down the best sandwich shop in CA. This place is for meat-lovers, but there are sandwich and salad options If you're a vegan/vegetarian. On our first visit, we got the Boca (classic brisket, pastrami, corned beef) and the Zeke (turkey) and both were fantastic. Had the Boca and Carzle this weekend, and it was a good pairing of a classic (the Boca) and spicy (the Carzle). We liked the Carzle so much we went back the next day for it. A lot of it has to do with the carved meat and how it is thinly sliced, almost shredded, which makes for really easy bites out of a hefty sandwich. The bread is good too. The menu has plenty of choices but without overwhelming. You will pay extra for a sandwich here ($15 including a soda and chips) but it is TOTALLY worth it. The pickles are awesome and come with your sandwich. 

Parking is easy and the lunch line can be long, but I don't think I've ever had to wait more than 5 minutes. Go and you won't regret it!
author: Jeana K.

description: This place is lucky that I am giving it 2 stars.  I ate here the next day after eating at this place called The Refuge in San Carlos..  I eat pastrami multiple times a week and this place was one my favorites.  The last time I ate here it seemed as if the portions of meat were getting smaller and smaller.  I ordered the pastrami on a roll and added bacon.  It was a huge disappointment.  The roll seemed to have shrunk.  I couldn't believe it.  This sandwich was about seven inches long.  It was an average pastrami sando.  Nothing special.  The bacon was definitely overcooked and I was still hungry after eating it.  This place will definitely go out of business soon.  I am from S.F. and this place will soon disappear.  Mark my words.  Yep.  On to another tomorrow.  The "pastrami king" certainly is a fraud.
author: D.c.g G.

description:
"Hey doc... I think it's a heart attack this time, for real."

"Nah, kid, it's pastrami again. Chew better." 

Pretty solid sandwich. And when I say 'pretty solid' I'm talking, a wicked gut bomb the likes of which counter-terrorism groups would have a hard time not finding if gigantic sandwiches really posed a threat to the safety of our Most Glorious Union. When I consider that I spend an hour in the park eating, pacing, then inadvertently napping, still greasy fingered, were this splinter cell to expand its operation nation-wide, we might actually take a hit in the productivity department.  

Thus far I've done the Rach (pastrami, slaw, thousand island), the Boca (pastrami, corned beef, and brisket + muenster cheese, Board sauce, brown mustard and pickles aka 'Ya Fuckin' Nuts'), the Reuben and a while ago, some kind of lox one (which was probably a brick of cream cheese, a fleet of capers and a run of salmon). 

All have been thoroughly overwhelming. I'm not sure if it's hands-down the best sandwich out there, but there's just so much of it - all tasty, all juicy, all worth it. And they deliver. Just like me and that food baby sitting breach in my intestines.
author: Roy M.

description:
Let me just preempt everything by saying...THERE IS NO PLACE TO SIT OR TO WALK IN AND ORDER FOOD.  It's literally a hole in the wall with no visible signs other than a paper menu taped to the window. 

You stand on the side-walk and a waitress comes out and takes your order. Good news though, they take credit cards! We were served some bagel chips and dip while waiting for our order and the service was very friendly.

I ordered the Zeke (without cream cheese) on sour dough and it was absolutely delicious! The huge portion of turkey with avocado was great and the texture of the bean sprouts added an extra something. I've had this sandwich now 3 times this week and has become my new obsession/addiction. 

Although the neighborhood is a bit sketchy, definitely give this place a try! It was fabulous!
author: Dianna S.

description:
Office just got a deliboard delivery today.  There isn't a more delicious lunchtime treat than a brisket based deliboard sandwich. 

I think I just munsoned my pants.
author: J R.

description:
Ordered Deli Board in to my office for a working lunch - mmmm. We had a huge variety of sandwiches, and every single one was delicious including the 3 vegetarian sandwiches. Delivery was on time and friendly, service on the phone was good too (especially as I was reading a nice long list of sandwiches, none of which were messed up).

Food: 5 stars
Value: 4.5 stars
Service: 5 stars
author: Shannon B.

description: Best sandwich I have ever had! Period. I just wish they were open for dinner. The chicken salad sandwich is out of this world. Awesome service too.
author: Mehdi A.

description:
Love the speakeasy style of this place. Want a sandwich? Oh, go talk to the girl taking orders in front of a random apartment.

The sandwiches are big, fat, and delicious. Stuffed to the max with all sorts of goodness - try the pastrami.

Watch out for food coma though. It's been kind of a problem for me to eat these during the day, because all I want to do is put my head on my keyboard when I get back to the office.
author: Genevieve W.

description: Up to this point, the best sandwich I've ever had! This place is amazing! At first I was pretty shocked at the price but once I got my RLMB I was sold. Pastrami, bacon, provolone, delicious slaw all on a perfect garlic Dutch crunch roll. So good!!! GO HERE.
author: Emilie L.

description:
Dudes here know what they are doing! 

Who knew that egg salad, pastrami, and Board Sauce would taste so goood. Not that they don't have vegetarian options, cuz they do and their homemade soups and salads are damn bomb-diggity too. 
But if you are a meat-lover, this is your sandwich heaven! 

Plus Justin is a sweetheart, so is Maggie but she went off and found a higher paying job ...the gall of that woman! ;P miss*miss*
author: eVa J.

description:
All I can say is I got the Boca sandwich and it was hands down one of THE best sandwiches I've had in a very long time.  The bread was great, delicious flavor combinations, and high quality meats and ingredients. 

Nothing more to say...other than i will be back quite frequently!
author: Shayla D.

description:
What a find the deli board is, and I mean find. We thought we'd be sitting down inside a deli but no such luck. The outside looks like an abandoned apartment, but the artwork that comes out is amazing. 
We ordered three (3) sandwiches, and each one tasted better then the first. 

Turkey, corned beef, roast beef...OMG I'm in love with a sandwich. Spoke to the owner (really nice guy) and he said his real talent is soup. I can't wait to go back to San Francisco and try the soup.
author: Richard M.

description: OK, back on track.  The sandwiches for the last two times were on mark again.   I tried the beef brisket today and they were very good, with a nice smoked flavor.
author: Jim J.

description: The most delicious sandwiches ever and the people who work there are always, always, always friendly and interesting. The Boca is off the charts good and the tomato soup is outstanding. I love this place. It never disappoints
author: Michelle D.

description:
Crazy good sandwiches. In my hood. On my street. Half a block down. First bite and sold. DB is a food porn affair waiting to happen, and the first date ended with me in handcuffs.
Their brisket and pastrami is the new SOMA crack and the influx from 6th street is near. Fear them. You've been warned.
author: Phil M.

description: urban hipster douches notwithstanding, deli board has some pretty good sandwiches, but you lose a star for your inability to take orders over the phone. i don't stand in line for anything so when i can't order a sandwich and know when it's ready, i'll just go somewhere more convenient. when this place is busy (often), i head over to extreme pizza with slices that are a quarter of a pizza (i.e., unless you're a gluttonous pig, one is enough)!
author: Torrpedo T.

description:
I gotta give credit where credit is due, and they addressed my #1 complaint below - its now a $15 minimum for delivery! Sandwiches are 8-9 usually, so that's just 2 sandwiches now.  AND they are open Saturdays, which makes this is a great lazy Saturday lunch.  

I'd like to think that Deli Board read my review and responded.  Either way, I'm a "regular" now and will continue to be.
author: Dave H.

description:
THE. Best. Sando. In. Town.

(Looking forward to the new location with seating!)
author: Mauby N.

description:
Wow, Deli Board.  Your reuben is just the best. And the customer service too. I don't know why all you chumps are complaining about standing out on the street.  How about you just DON'T? I ordered 15 sandwiches for myself and coworkers today and had them DELIVERED. Adam and Gretchen were super helpful and the food was a huge hit.  We'll be ordering from the Deli Board again for sure. They cater! I cannot wait to try their breakfast burritos!

Sad note: One of my coworkers snuck in to the office this morning, so I ended up not ordering for her.  Because I am so nice, I gave her half my reuben. Honestly my most selfless act in ages.
author: Dana C.

description: Like whoa... I have yet to experienced any bigger badder sandwich places in SF! Absolutely, hands-down the best! Mmm.. Drooling just thinking of a yums sandwich from this joint.
author: Monika T.

description:
I got the RLM (garlic bread, roast beef, house slaw, mozzarella, Board sauce) a couple of days ago, and have been telling people of its glory since then.  After eating that sandwich, I think all sandos should be served on garlic bread.  It was really the perfect consistency, and still had a nice bite to it with all that stuff in there. 

Two drawbacks were the wait, and the lack of somewhere to sit.  We ordered 6 sandwiches, and had to wait around 20 minutes.  It looks like the key is to order ahead, and pick it up, or get it delivered.  Also, I guess I didn't read enough of the reviews, but we had to order and wait on the street, and then drove to a park to eat.  Usually those things combined would be enough for me to want to ding a star, but seriously, my heart just isn't into it.  I love you, RLM!
author: Julie B.

description:
I love Deli Board!!!

 I used to have them cater to my old office. 
They were always nice, friendly, and prompt. 
If you have them cater, they probably have the sandwiches already put together.
But, I would ask them to separate everything so that my coworkers could make their own sandwiches. They were very open to our needs. 

Everything tastes delcious & fresh, from the meat to the veggie options. 
Very satisfying and always hits the spot!
author: Sheila S.

description: This place is the bomb! Definitely the best sando I've had and the sauces are pretty darn good. If you like meat go here. If you're a bit health conscious maybe not the best place.
author: Toan D.

description:
I made waffles, bacon, and sausage for my company.  What does this have to do with the price of tea in China, or more to the point, delicious deli eats in SOMA?  Glad you asked.

Despite the fact that our bellies were full of waffle and pork goodness once we saw and our lips touched those sandwiches, salads and pickles we dove in like a pack of voracious wolves!  It was that good.  It was simple and sublime and delivered to our office.  Talk about food coma!

It was cheap.  It was delicious.  It was beautiful.  Tears welled in my eyes... Okay, let me just say it was good, and they catered our entire office for lunch and if we hadn't just collectively consumed 6 lbs of pork product and a gallon of waffle batter there would be no leftovers.  Thank god I made breakfast!  Can you say beer, sandwiches and foosball for dinner?  I sure can! (I love my job!)

I would have liked some horseradish sauce on the side with the brisket sandwich I had but otherwise this is as good as it gets!

P.S. Yelp, as our neighbor now you know where you should call in your next office catering from!  They're cheap and they deliver!
author: Theron L.

description:
So my co-workers decided to order sandwiches for lunch since one of us was celebrating a birthday. There are eight of us on my team and apparently this guy has a rule of no orders of six or more people. So we break up our order into two and had two people go and pick up the orders. The Sandwich Nazi wises up to our "devious scheme" and points the accusatory finger claiming, "You two are together aren't you?!" Now, the two people who went to pick up the order are two of the sweetest women you could know and they obviously couldn't lie so they said yes. Well, the Sandwich Nazi wasn't having it and kicked them out...seriously, kicked them out. 

Now I can understand having rules for your business, but being an a-hole isn't a good practice. At least now we know what business to avoid....NO SANDWICH FOR YOU!
author: Nia N.

description: Located across from the park.  The prices are okay. I ordered the ADM sandwich $11 And the Chagrin Salad $11.
author: Jennifer H.

description: The sandwiches here are delicious! From the meat to the bread, you won't be disappointed. You even get a fresh pickle with your order! The only sad thing is that they aren't open on Sundays!
author: Ashley S.

description: Super awesome sandwiches! Full of flavor, awesome combinations and great staff. Stopped in here on the way to the city and couldn't have been happier.
author: Michael S.

description: Came here because of a recomendation from a friend. Decided to try the Ruprecht and damn that was a good sandwhich. Some of the best and freshest pastrami I have eaten in my life. My mouth just salvates thinking about it. Only issue was the limited space to eat, but it was lunch hour and bit on the pricy side. However I would not mind eating another sandwhich from here.
author: Tony C.

description: Came here because of the great reviews. Both of the two sandwiches were incredibly small and the were just so-so at best. I should not be able to eat a $14 sandwich in 9 bites. The reason I am giving them 2 stars is because I paid $32 for two sandwiches.  I feel like an idiot for paying that much for two sandwiches.  I would have had the same experience going to subway, grinding the meat up, microwaving it, putting the meat back on, and spending $10 on two sandwiches. This place is VERY VERY over rated.
author: The S.

description: I dont think any one does it better then these guys. Simply amazing. Try there pastrami sandwich "while sitting down" because you might faint
author: Sulaiman B.

description:
Literally the BEST sandwich I have ever had in San Francisco. Or anywhere, for that matter. On my first visit, I tried one of their specials, "Humberto," which had brisket, pastrami, corned beef, jalapenos, muenster cheese, brown mustard, and their board sauce on dutch crunch. The other two times I've been there, I've ordered the Chayim, which is basically the same thing except it has kosher salami instead of pastrami and it contains cole slaw. Clearly, these aren't the type of sandwiches to eat if you're on a diet or trying to feel healthy, but they are SO DELICIOUS. Like melt-in-your-mouth, I-can-die-happy-now delicious.
Admittedly, it's steep at $11, but at least that price prevents me from eating it all the goddamn time and clogging my arteries. Also be forewarned that the wait at lunch time (even on weekends) can take up to half of your lunch break. If you haven't tried it yet, though, get this heavenly sandwich in your mouth right now and thank me later (after your food coma).
author: Ash V.

description: Amazing meaty sandwiches! I've been going here since they were a literal hole-in-the-wall. Back then, they took orders on the sidewalk and then, you just waited around awkwardly on the pavement until they got it out to you. They've moved on up to an actual restaurant (with seating!) since, jacked up the prices and added a delicious sauce to their sandwiches. Still as good as ever.
author: Abi R.

description:
A no-nonsense, east coast style deli with nice big freakin' portions.

I've only ordered delivery and I've been yet to be disappointed.   I usually order the Boca:  thinly sliced pastrami, corned beef, and brisket served on a hoagie roll with "Boca" sauce, & pickles.  My order usually arrives on time with the delivery person being very friendly with a nice sense of humor.  

As for the quality of the sandwich, it's top notch!  The bread (which many folk underrate) is perfect: crispy on the outside, soft on the inside.  The meat is seasoned perfectly, sliced paper thin and is super juicy.  I usually force myself to eat the entire sandwich because I do not want to waste it's juicy goodness!  

Yes, they have "whole pricing" meaning what is on the menu includes tax.   Just make sure you tip the delivery person nicely or they'll violate your lunch!
author: Larry A.

description:
Messy menu, grossly overpriced for a sandwich that was only OK.

Go there for the hype, not for the food. If you want a good sandwich, go to Ike's or Two Sons instead.
author: Yo D.

description:
SO RIDICULOUSLY GOOD.
I can't wait to come back for more.
The Zeke without mayo is flavor-packed and fresh-tasting.
author: Benjamin S.

description: Go here! The sandwiches are freshly made to order and tasty tasty tasty! Try the Rufus and Zeke sandwich.
author: André B.

description: Huge portion, delicious and reasonably priced. Need more of this in Canada that's for sure.
author: Ting Hin C.

description:
I really like this place.  I need to order lunches quite frequently for work, as we do a lot of meetings over lunch at my office.  Adam is always prompt to reply to my email orders and they are almost always right on time with the delivery.  Really nice service and their food is top-notch and tasty, nothing too fancy.  
I would say my only complaint, and it isn't much of one, is that they should offer a nicer chip selection - I'm not a fan of Lays, or bagel chips - but, that's just me.  
Love the egg salad sandwich and tuna especially, but seriously haven't tasted anything I didn't like from them.
author: Cami B.

description: I had the carzel sandwich. Was amazing!! One of the best sandwiches I've had in a long time. Must hit spot!!
author: DJ B.

description: Deli Board is a cute, fun place with a great sandwich selection and friendly staff. The sandwiches fell a bit short of my expectations, however. They are very generous with the ingredients but perhaps a bit too much so with the cheese. I love cheese, but there was so much that it managed to overpower meat, bread and everything else. It's nothing a bit of customization can't fix, however.
author: Brett B.

description: It's a shame that I've spent so much money on fine dining, only to discover my foodie G-spot is tickled by a sublime sub. IMHO, i think you would be hard pressed to not find a sandwich that doesn't make you happy. You have nothing to lose by going there and searching for inner sandwich bliss.
author: chinyere w.

description:
Best sandwich I ever had. I also like the fact that they give big sized pickles.
FattyMatty and LRB are my favorite here.
author: Prudhvi D.

description: This is my go-to lunch spot every time I get my hair done across the street. Friendly staff and the place is always packed! I highly recommend the Rivkah (I'm a vegetarian) - it's amazing. Go here!!
author: Stephanie H.

description:
Pretty decent sandwich place, it's more like a 3.5 star for me. It tasted pretty good, but just didn't leave me with the feeling like I'd have to come back the next day. Some places make me feel like coming back the next day and thats my 5 star cut.

But if you're a sandwich person and are into hot ones, I'd say give this place a try. Friendly staff, clean and lots to try. Also the pickles that come with it were really big and quite tasty!
author: m K.

description:
Caught wind of DB based on looking a few San Fran 'Elites' prior to coming out for vacation. 

Had some difficulty finding the place because 1.) The GPS had two addresses, and of course I picked the wrong one 2.) There was mad construction on the store front and it was tough to find the place. 

Once we arrived we were a little confused. People were standing out in front and a few nice young ladies were taking orders. We figured we would at least be able to sit down. Not sure if you can even go in normally or they were closed inside because of the construction. 

As far as food goes I'll go nuts for a solid sandwich...so once I dug into the Gold-n-Berg-n-Stein I went nuts. All the good reviews I read were instantly validated. Copious amounts of the pastrami and house-made slaw poured out. Just writing about it has made my mouth water. I would be lying if I said I hadn't though about that sandwich a few times since I returned home. My lady got a chicken sammie with a very pungent garlic pesto that was also delicious but somewhat over powering. 

The only thing keeping my review from a 5/5 was my soup order. I went with a chicken tortilla and it was pretty sub-par. It was very very bland so I had a few bites and chucked it. In any case, next time I'm in San Fran I'll be grabbin' lunch at DB.
author: Dave S.

description:
Maybe its because I'm listening to The-Dream (radio killaaaah) right now and I wish I was at some dope after party at the top of a skyscraper in Hotlanta - but its gotten me thinking that more often than not, people sacrifice quality in lieu of convenience. 

How many times has your office gobbled down Specialty's because that's what they knew and it was convenient? 

How many times have you had a dope after party at your skyscraper and only pour patron because you didn't want to break out a new bottle of Don Julio 1967? Okay you don't have to answer that one. 

While offices around SF suffer through their mayo-laden stale breaded creations - those who know opt for Deli Board. 

With meat-fillled creations like the Cow Bell or Mikey Likes It, there is hope in the pursuit of a better lunch. 

To quote The-Dream:
Now I'm all up on her like "oh, oh"
Now she all up on me like "oh, oh"

I can think of no better way to describe the feeling of taking down a well made sando..."I'ma make you fall in love again!"
author: Gabe b.

description:
I was out front of this place at 11 am sharp, ordered immediately and then waited. And waited. And waited.

11:15 rolls around and I start to think to myself, this better be the best damn sandwich I've ever had. The smell of urine is starting to get to me, but the crazy guy yelling at himself distracts me enough that I don't just leave.

At 11:20 I realize I'm going to need to catch a cab back to work in order to make an appointment and this sandwich better be worth its weight in gold.

It was. It so was.

I ordered the Lamar which was a daily special. The corned beef was fantastic. The spicy slaw they added? Awesome. And the pickles! The pickles are taste like they were seasoned with allspice or nutmeg. Truly awesome.

Still, I think I'd phone in the order next time because standing out on that particular street corner in the morning isn't super pleasant. :)
author: Jordan M.

description: Ordered twice for delivery at Deli Board. I just finished off a "hank" --corned beef, american cheese, pickled onion, pickles, board sauce, french roll --. Definitely worth it for $10. They also included something that tasted and looked like a hybrid pickle/tomato. I bought a separate root beer that went well with the sandwich. I'm satisfied.
author: Gerard Y.

description: My friend took me here for lunch and I was definitely glad he did! I ordered the JT and my friend ordered the Bradley, which are both $11. We halved our sandwiches so we could try both. I personally liked the JT better and I would order that again. The Bradley was just not my style, since I am not a big fan of jalapenos. The only thing that was unpleasant was that it was REALLY warm inside like they had the heater on and there were only 2 tables outside. Luckily right when we got our sandwiches a table opened up outside.
author: Liana D.

description:
Best corned beef in the city, hands down.

The sandwiches are killer. They're inventive and delicious, with such care and craft in every ingredient from the pastrami to the sauce to the bread you shed a single tear. Oh, and they're piled high. 

Delivery is speedy and friendly. 

Marry me Deli Board.
author: andy b.

description: The sandwiches here is so freaken amazing!!!!!!!!!!!! That is all I have to say! It is a MUST TRY!! You will love it here. They even have a sandwich that taste like a Big Mac!!!!!!!!
author: Dreamer L.

description: I've came here a few times and honestly I this will time will be the last. The sandwiches here are decent but nothing special. The sandwiches itself is pretty salty and there's nothing special about the deli meat. Everything on the menu is pretty much the same minus an ingredient here and there. The reason I'm giving it two stars is because of the price. Your not getting much for the price. There are so many better places in the city for sandwiches.
author: R S.

description: Crazy sandwich place.. Im a creature of habit but when I saw a special on the board for a sandwich on toasted hoagie roll with egg, sausage and American cheese I thought to myself... I hope this is like that burger kind snacker sanwhoch that the discontinued for breakfast.. ( I know, I know) so this thing came out and it was massive and reminded me exactly of it. It was delicious, and the guy who made it and put it on the board came put and asked how it was. Super awesome! Thanks deli board for a thought process worth exploring..
author: alex m.

description:
A little pricey, and can have a bit of a wait, but damn good sandwiches and real nice people. And my doggie likes it too!

I'm struggling between 4 & 5 stars, but gotta give 4 only because I think the portions are a little small for the price, and a couple of things I've tried were only ok(namely the tuna salad sand "Fatty Matty" and chef salad) but go for anything with Board sauce and roast beef/pastrami/brisket and you will not be disappointed. Their bread is perfect sandwich bread and always get the ratios of ingredients right. 

Mmm... tastiness!
author: trvs l.

description: Easily the BEST sandwich I have ever put in my mouth. Yes, a bold statement for sure, but I don't claim it lightly. The pastrami sando (on dutch crunch!) is AMAZING. I have never tasted pastrami done so well. It comes out hot and is finished off with the perfect amount of jalepenos and sliced pickles. The Board sauce adds just the right amount of kick and the cheese is such a great compliment as it comes in just the right amount. Love that they give you two fat hunks of pickles too, on the side. DEFINITELY a must have in SOMA.
author: Melinda L.

description: I came here after trying Ike's Place only to have my friend tell me that this is her favorite sandwich shop in the city. If you come during lunchtime during the week, you will definitely be in for a wait as nearly a dozen people milling around are waiting for their sammies. The owner, Adam Mesnick, is a cool guy who takes his sandwiches very seriously. The best thing I can say about this place is that they truly understand the concept of proportions. The width and crunch of the bread combined with the right amount of meat with a smattering of slaw for texture and just enough sauce...it all makes for a very elite sandwich, which is good cuz you are paying elite sandwich prices! (It is not a particularly large sandwich either, as I can put 2 of them down in 1 sitting on a hungry day). My favorite sandwich to date (out of 3 thus far) would be the Carzle, a combo of super thinly sliced brisket and pastrami with just enough provolone to hold it all together, with pickles in the sandwich already; my only complaint is I wish that the peppers he chose were hotter. While I might be able to buy 2 bowls of pho with the same amount of money, if you are craving an extremely dope sandwich before their early closing time, I'd say this place is your spot.
author: Gene C.

description:
This sandwich shop is fantastic!  The Boca is my new favorite sandwich.  I don't know what they put in there, but I'm hooked.  The meat, bread, cheese, and sauce dance around on your tongue, and send you into a happy coma.
I was having start, and Adam made my day  Also, try the pickles-you will love them.
Thank you Adam, and I will see you soon!
author: Annika L.

description:
Let's talk customer service for a sec, since it's blatantly obvious Deli Board makes some of the best sammiches in the city.

This is customer service:
- Friendly woman taking orders at the door asked me and my crew if this was our first time.  It was.  And she was visibly excited.
- I gave her my order.
- We continue to chat while I wait for my sammich, making the shady neighborhood seem a little brighter.
- A few minutes later, another woman comes out with a smile on her face and says "Russell?  Are you Russell?"
- I'm like... "Yes, yes I am."
- "Well, our sammich maker liked your name, so you get extra meat on the house."
- "Seriously?"
- "Seriously."
- High five.

And that Boca sammich changed my life.  Love to the Deli Board.
author: Russell W.

description:
Oh the things I do for the Deli Board...

While browsing "Hot on Yelp a few days ago, I came across the Deli Board and was somewhat fascinated. I thought to myself what could be so special about a damn sandwich. I work in downtown SF...I'm smothered in sandwiches. SMOTHERED, I tell ya! Why would I even think about going pass the safe zone to grab a sandwich? Why!?

Because these sandwiches are pretty damn good. 

Although our trek down gritty 6th and Mission resulted in extreme speed walking, this location gave Deli Board some street cred. This was no wussy sandwich. I had the RLM - packed with meat (packed!) and melty cheese in between two slices of garlic bread. This was an awesome sandwich down to the very last bite. I highly recommend it! But be sure to call in advance for your order, or else you are not getting a sandwich.
author: Lisa T.

description: I'm not a sandwich loving person but holy crap these sandwiches are amazing.  Lots of meat, flavor, and the bread isn't too thick.  They are known for their hot sandwiches. Look for the specials because they are always awesome. I once had one with a fried egg in it and it was incredible.  Truly a treasure.
author: Sarah V.

description:
In writing this review, I was incredibly torn about how to rate it.  I had my first experience with Deli Board at lunch yesterday.  My friend emphatically recommended it, so we called in an order and were told it would be half an hour.  That sounded a bit long, but it wasn't a problem with us.  

We showed up about 20 minutes later, expecting to wait a little longer for our food.  Little did we know, however, that we would be waiting there for over a half an hour.  Let me make this very clear: it took almost an HOUR for them to prepare 3 sandwiches that were called in.

What added to the absurdity of the wait time was that every single person who walked up and placed an order while we were waiting (including both those who had called in and those who were placing their order at the window) received their sandwiches first.  At least 8-12 people received sandwiches before us while we waited (trying to be patient!).

What was even more irritating was that the employees (friendly as they were) seemed to be making no effort whatsoever to make haste to get the orders completed.  There were no apologies for our 50+ minute wait, or the fact that others who came after us were served first.

That being said... once I took a bite of this heavenly sandwich, I was very pleased.  I got the Zeke, which had turkey, bacon, cream cheese, avocado and sprouts... and WOW.  Delicious.  My friend had the Ron, which was beef with cheddar, jalapenos, and avocado.  Both are HIGHLY recommended.

In other words... if you're going to get a sandwich from here, allow yourself at least an hour.  I missed my afternoon class because of that, and despite how delicious the sandwich was, I left pretty irked.  Or better yet, have it delivered, and make sure to place your order absurdly early if you hope to get your food before you starve.
author: Erin B.

description: This place is amazing.  Coming from LA it's a must stop for lunch every time.  Their pastrami sandwich (they have like five) is one of the best sandwiches I have had in all my travels  so three cheers to Deli Board!
author: Colan N.

description: I dunno why I waited so long to try this place but it's amazing! The sandwiches may be $11 but they're totally worth it. Service is no nonsense, comes wrapped up in paper with a zip-lock bag of pickles. When you unwrap the meaty delight, steam rolls out and deliciously melty cheese seals it all together. I have not tried more than 2 sandwiches on the menu but I get the impression that when you go Deli Board, you should just go all the way. This is a bad place for a diet.
author: Caitlin F.

description:
Mmmm... few things are more satisfying than coming home for Thanksgiving... and one of those things is eating a sandwich that really shows what SF has to offer in the food perspective. 

Learned about Deli Board through my cousin and it sure was a good find. Heard great things and seen all the big meaty pictures of their selections. 

I ordered the Boca and wow. It was just packed with deli thin meats with pickles, sauce, and fitted into their toasted french roll. I have to say I prefer this over my experience at Ike's. Sure, Ike's sandwiches are unique and VERY hearty, but this place is almost too simple, and simple is sometimes better. Great quality meats and it really fills you up. A bit on the expensive side, but well worth a try. 

The area that it's in isn't too bad. As long as there's daylight and people around, it should be fine. However, Deli Board is easy to miss if you don't look for it carefully. I only knew it was there because my cousin saw a building with some people outside. It looked just like a run down apartment on the outside, so the only way you can tell it's Deli Board is by the sign on the window and the line of people waiting to get their lunch. 

The people were really friendly too. The person who took the orders was nice and chatted with the people outside. I also really recommend calling in before to place your order.

I'm dying to get another sandwich from this place. Just really hits the spot, but I wouldn't go too often cause that it's gonna cause a crater in my wallet. A must try deli joint.
author: robin w.

description:
Ok...this review is LONG overdo as I have been ordering sandwiches at least three times a week from Deli Board ever since they started their non-catering menu. 

I'll premise this review by stating that I'm a vegetarian, but all the carnivores I work with have ordered with me and raved about the pastrami and everything else on the menu.  Quite literally everything I have had to eat from here, whether it be the sandwiches, soups, bagel chips with spreads, pickles, wraps, etc, have all been incredibly delicious and very reasonably priced.  

Adam and his crew seem to use the highest quality ingredients without milking your pocket.  The customer service is ALWAYS above and beyond my expectations (on a side note, my expectations for customer service are extremely high.  I have worked  in service oriented jobs for over 10 years so it's a big deal to me when someone connects with their customers).

Also, all food is delivered via bike and Deli Board uses biodegradable and recyclable containers so you can eat your take-out guilt free.  No BP oil was used to deliver this fine meal.

Hands down my favorite place to get lunch.   I wish I could give this place 10 stars!
author: Chris K.

description: The Hermini is right up there with the best sandwich I have ever had. I don't recommend splitting (as I did with my friend Luke C.) or else you may leave wanting more (as I did). The crisp pickles on the side were a nice touch.
author: Tucker M.

description:
Deli Board is a great little find and there sandwiches are damn filling.  You eat one of them and you will be filled up for sure.

I had the Veggie sandwich (don't remember the name) and it was great 5 stars.  It didn't have too much sauce, which in my opinion can ruin a sandwich, and the roasted veggies were delicious...a perfect combination.

My friend had the falafel sandwich which was only average 3 stars.  That sandwich though was gigantic must have weighed more than a pound.  

All in all four stars and I will return.
author: J. S.

description:
If you need to execute a Meat Sandwich with *extreme prejudice*, then then pop-smoke at  your office LZ and rendezvous at Deli Board. If you can find it...

Cleverly disguised as a Howard St 1BR apt, The Deli Board is slangin' meat bombs in sandwich form right out the front door like the Germans coming over the hill at Kesan. (Trust me. They were there.) 

As a manly carnivore, I - of course-   went straight for the Boca; which is a heaping mound of pastrami AND brisket shoved so far up a sandwich's ass it defies the laws of physics. At Deli Board it's all about meat-per-sq-inch its also all about getting your *street* face on - if you don't call ahead, you order on the sidewalk and wait at the curb. 

Boca order in, I had no idea that the Tri-Meated[!] Basic #2 Sandwich would be there to taunt me from the outside menu like the kid who threw me in the ditch everyday in first grade when I was waiting on the bus. "You could have had 3 MEATS!", it seemed to say to me, THREE. MEATS." Next time my fat friend, next time.
author: Francis S.

description:
The Boca lives up to all the hype.  A sandwich that doesn't beat around the arugula.

Bagel chips + whitefish spread crank it up to 11.

Suddenly I don't feel bad about working so far away from Ike's.

And fast delivery?  Really?  

My waistline will never be the same.
author: John D.

description:
Deli Board has, hands down, my favorite sandwiches in SF. The Boca - piled high with three kinds of meat, is a heart attack that you can hold, but one filled with delicious goodness. Everything I've tried at Deli Board is just as good. As a bonus, the staff is beyond friendly - when you are waiting for your sandwich, don't be surprised if one of the staff members brings you a sample of soup or something to try. 

There's not really anywhere to eat your sandwich, but if it's a nice day you can take it to the park on Folsom between 6th and 7th, which has some benches. 

I SO wish they were open on weekends, as I almost never am able to grab one of their sandos during the week. Sadness!

Probably the best sandwich shop in SF that you've never heard of. Definitely worth a trip to SOMA. 

Note: They don't really have a noticeable storefront, and their sign is unfortunately the same color as the building. I walked by Deli Board several times - and I was looking for it!
author: Joshua Z.

description:
Our lunch was delivered Early today!
My Boca rocked!
Also had half a  bowl of the Tomato soup; very very rich. Yummy but prob couldn't stomach the entire container. I'd get it again though, if i could split it with someone
*love* this sandwich delivery!
author: Jocelyn L.

description: I had the Boca.  It was pretty good, but for the price not above a 3 star experience - meaning: "A-OK" per the Yelp rating standards.  The fact is, I would definitely go back, but not very often, as doing so would be a poor financial decision.
author: Tony B.

description:
[george takei]oh my[/george takei]

it was well worth the bus ride and walk through shady neighborhoods to get the melt-in-your-mouth sandwiches that deli board offers.  i went with the Gold-n-Berg-n-stein and it rocked my world.  the gf had the LRB and who knew that chicken salad and salami would go so well together.

both sandwiches quite literally melted in your mouth.  the bread was toasted so perfectly and the meat was of such high quality, that every bite didn't yield a sandwich poop in the back, pushing out all the goods.  this is quite possibly one of the only sandwiches i've eaten where the poop didn't happen.

their menu is so diverse that it'll definitely keep me coming back for more.

a word of advice if you're not down with strolling through questionable neighborhoods with questionable characters: walk down 7th or 8th rather than 6th to get to folsom from mission.
author: Jeff N.

description:
I give them two stars because I didn't try what is likely their signature, the pastrami.  And the people there are friendly enough.

I had the Mila sandwich with tomato, greens, basil, pesto, fresh mozzarella.

A number of very real problems here:

*  The bread doesn't hold up to moisture so it's soggy by the time you sit down and eat it.  Like most rational grown-ups, I HATE soggy bread, especially on expensive sandwiches.  This isn't Subway, guys.

*  The bread by itself has no flavor at all and it's that halfway-between-Merita-and-baguette style that makes no sense for carry-out sandwiches.  A good sandwich needs a crusty bread to withstand moisture, to be easy to hold, and the interior should be buttered (or brushed with oil, or toasted, anything) to help keep moisture out.  

*  And even if it were the best bread in the world, it makes no sense whatsoever to serve mostly soft ingredients on soft bread.

*  The "fresh mozzarella" is completely bland.  No, it's not supposed to be that way.  It's unseasoned.

*  The tomatoes were at least ripe, so props for that, but the ripeness just contributes to the sogginess.  Again, unseasoned.

*  There's an uneven pesto spread that's predominantly just salty.  It's really the only seasoning on the sandwich, and it has little standalone flavor.  Because nothing else on the sandwich is seasoned, you just get a hit of pure salt, followed by an abyss of flavorless mush.

*  The thing is heavy.  I'm all for big portions if it keeps me wanting more.  Not so here.

*  The pickles are pretty good; granted, it's hard to screw up pickles.  The way they're cut makes no sense at all.  Shouldn't you be able to put the pickle on your sandwich without overwhelming its flavor?  Why cut them into such thick slabs?

The people here saying this place has the best sandwiches in the area ... wow.  It's like a parallel universe exists where flavor, texture, and quality don't matter; salt and pepper are virtually forbidden.  This place is, dare I say it, the anti-Naked Lunch; it's as if, by virtue of so many better options existing elsewhere, a REALLY bad one has to exist to balance out the yin and yang of sandwich options in the city.
author: J W.

description: One if the things I miss the most about moving out of SOMA is Deli Board. There is not one bad thing on the menu and there's no way you leave hungry. Be sure to try it and I promise you will crave to come back.
author: Ryan P.

description: I am thrilled to write these words. San Francisco finally has a good pastrami source. Of course I have been to the other places, I will not mention names. However, their meat has never risen to the level of Deli Board. The pastrami at Deli Board has it all. Great taste, correct amount of fat, served hot, thin sliced and large portions of meat in the sandwich. They even have the only correct pickle served anywhere. Its in the details, as always.
author: Norman V.

description:
Their Boca Sandwich has been haunting me for the last week, and I may have to fly back to San Francisco just to have another one!  This place is amazing and totally worth the effort.  The owners / operators are a class-act and have an amazing thing running.

Remember, though, this is a deliver or pickup only joint.

While visiting San Francisco I found the Deli Board during one of my searches for a lunch spot outside of my hotel.  It showed up as a short walk so I headed out in good weather.  I must've circled the block a few times before realizing it has no official storefront (being a delivery/pickup spot), but I ran into their deliver person (sorry, I don't recall her name), who helped me with a menu selection and took my order.  The owner came out about ten minutes later with my sandwich and we had a great chat before I brought my lunch back to my hotel.

Huge sandwich, HUGE pickels.  I regret it was my last day in SF, or I would've come back.
author: Chris D.

description:
This is the best sandwich I ever had.  The Boca sandwich was unbelievable.  Just the perfect blend of mustard sauce, pickle, cheese, and delicious.  It's not the huge, overstuffed sandwiches you get at other places.  It's a nice size sandwich that fills you up nicely but isn't big for the sake of being big.
The bread is really nice too.  A nice soft roll (on the Boca) on the inside while the outside has enough texture to be interesting.  But the outside isn't so hard that biting the sandwich causes everything to gush out.
Just the perfect sandwich.  And they deliver in SOMA.
author: John H.

description: I had the falafel sandwich and it was amazing. Really unique combination of flavor a I wouldn't expect (like pickles and cheese with falafel). It was great!!
author: Melisa P.

description:
Wow! This place is amazing! I have been craving a good authentic reuben forever! I went to Morty's, The Sentinel, Ike's, 
Miller's East Coast Deli .... This is by far the best, because the key is the pastrami, and no place has pastrami like this place!

+Delivery was super fast and they were really nice!
The bagel chips are also phenomenal!
author: Tasha R.

description: Decent for the price, but not worth going out of your way for. I've had key ingredients forgotten on my salads on more than one occasion.
author: Juli F.

description:
Disclaimer: I was of the opinion that Ike's Place was the best sandwich I had ever eaten.

That all changed with just one bite from the Boca that Deli Board served. 

THE GOOD: We are talking a house roasted symphony of meaty awesomeness! This thing has 3 kinds of tender, flavorful heaven, piled so high that I couldn't get my mouth around it. The Board Sauce and wafer-thin slices of meat blended into the most mouth-watering combo I have ever tasted. They also offer free delivery on order of $20 or more.

THE BAD: No seating, limited sides, and limited hours.
author: Robin S.

description: Great Sandwiches! Lunch rush is pretty killer so if you don't like to wait in line, just try to avoid the 12:00 hour. Skully was my sandy and it was so delicious. Great options, fun little atmosphere. Really solid sandos.
author: Mandy B.

description:
I must say....their sandwiches are pretty damn good!   

As usual, the co-workers started to wonder what's for lunch today around 11am.  We ran through our usual eateries - all of which we were getting pretty tired of having day in and day out.  I'll be unhinged if I hear "Five dollar footlong" one more time.

My co-worker then stumbled upon the reviews for this place on Yelp and all these gleaming five-star glowing reviews caught our attention.

Basically, the process of ordeing from them is pretty simple.  Go to their website, go through their menu, call in your order, and wait, and someone from Deli Board will deliver your food items.  Their menu consists of a good number of sandwiches and salads - but not so much where it becomes too overwhelming like the other famous sandwich shop we all know about....

All their prices already include tax and delivery charge - so don't be too surprised to see that their menu consist of $8-9 items.  Extras like chips are an extra $1.

I got the Boca and, yes, although it's a bit on the salty side still the mix of pastrami and corned beef was still very yummy.  Not too oily, the bread toasted to a very light crisp.  I always say the bread makes the sandwich and the bread is definitely very good.

Weill definitely try Deli Board again for a future lunch near soon.
author: Raymond G.

description:
Finally, after all the Yelp love/promo and frequency of it popping up in my searches for lunch in the area, we made the trek out to Deli Board.  While I wasn't disappointed, I have to admit I wasn't blown away either.

Got their turkey club, called the Zeke (which is probably the problem right there).  Upon reflection, I think I should've gotten a meat with a little more natural pizazz, like the pastrami, which seems to be a popular choice.  Anyhoo, got the Zeke, and as much as I'd love to say it was stellar, it was just OK.  I'm not quite sure about the obsession in this city with putting cream cheese on sandwiches - it adds nothing to the flavor, and is not an acceptable substitute for a real condiment!  This sandwich had cream cheese AND mayo.  No wonder it was a little more on the bland side than I would have liked.

The pickle, on the other hand, was fabuloso.

Now, I'm not saying there won't be a next time.  I'd love to give this shop a second go-around and confirm whether or not my first meh experience was due to my own crappy ordering, or if I'm just not a Deli Board person.  We'll see!
author: Allison B.

description: Outstanding sandwich.  Why no 5?  Because Roli Roti in SF makes the best sandwich ("The Porchetta")  The Munson was SUPER good.  Bread was amazing and the Roast Beef in this sandy was the most tender I have ever had.  The sauce was good but nothing I can really remember but they had a pepper sauce on the side and it was pretty darn good.  Def a must next time I go back to SF.
author: Ricky C.

description:
OVER- RATED

Got the bateman sandwitch at Deli Board which has:

Turkey breast, Roasted red peppers, Pepperoncini, Cream cheese, Lettuce, Tomato, Mayo, on a Toasted bun

Sounds amazing right? As I'm writing this I'm contemplating going back to buy this sandwich again because it sounds so good. 
But then I remember what happened when I ate said sandwich. 

The Bateman turned into a Meat and Mayo sandwich. 

No veggies, no cream cheese, not toasted, crappy bread. OVERRATED. 

Maybe it was just the sandwich I ordered, but look again at the ingredients. It's pretty hard to mess that sandwich up. But omitting 90% of what the sandwich is suppose to be is a great way to start Deli Board. To be honest the ingredients were in there...somewhere. But a sandwich must have balance. More fat doesn't make a sandwich taste better, just fattier. Some of us can taste the difference. 

I really wanted to give Deli Board a 1 star. My hopes were so high for this place, and it was all dashed away by a flood of meat and lard. 

But the sandwiches aren't poisonous or disgusting, just really really disappointing.
author: Alex M.

description: Deli Board has some of the best fucking sammies around.  Before I was writing this review, I was looking at their yelp profile and wondering why they don't have 5 stars.  The sandwiches are stacked, service is always fast and friendly.  Then I saw some random shitty reviews, like, "there is a ziplock bag with moist pickles I have to touch".  Get a fucking grip ya hater.  Deli board is awesome.  HUGE TASTY F'N SANDWICHES.  if you want someone else to touch your pickles  go to subway or craigslist.
author: CC C.

description:
Absolutely bomb.  The meat portions in these sandwiches are unbelievable. You might pop a boner just looking at it.  A meat stack of easily 2-2.5 inches..it's fair to say 75% of the entire sandwich is meat, you can barely see the other condiments.  The Boca is out of control - 3 cuts of meat w/ melted cheese oozing from in between.  The Gold-N-Berg-N-Stein is also tasty, similar to the Boca but more saucy.  The Zeke probably has the most enticing combo of everything - bacon, avocado, sprouts, cream cheese w/ a huge pile of turkey, all for $8.  Think it just needs some hot sauce.

Definitely call in your order and have it delivered, process was seamless.  Deli Board is probably one of the top 3 sandwich shops in SF, difficult to go wrong w/ this place.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Amazing sandwiches! I split the pastrami and chicken salad sandwiches with a friend, and both were excellent. The pastrami was perfection! And the chicken salad was a nice lighter balance, and also very good.

Everyone who works there is also great! Highly recommended all around. Even though their delivery area says SOMA, they will deliver to the financial district if you ask nicely :)
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Great sandwiches, a little pricey, but really good. No dinning room, so either get it delivered or hang out while you wait for your food. Very short operating hours - just core lunch hours.

Deli Board is not even a hole in the wall - it's a door on a side street with a sign that says "STOP! Please wait outside and someone will come help you. Thanks, Deli Board" Clearly, no table or counter service will be involved. That said, the "serving"/kitchen staff are very friendly and we did get some bagel chips while we waited outside for our sandwiches. Sandwiches took 12 minutes to come up, and were hot, wrapped in paper and bagged.

The sandwiches were good, my Cousin of Reuben was tasty, and thick with beef. Daily specials are real winners and are posted on their site or on the window. Bike Delivery "minimum" is $20, but if you're within a few blocks they'll stretch it for you.

Definitely a winner for lunch.
author: Matthew R.

description:
One of the best sandwiches I've had in San Francisco!
We stopped by this place to pick up a sandwich only to find out that it's more or less a catering place. That didn't stop them from making us some amazing sandwiches and even bringing us some free soup. Be warned that there isn't any seating, but they said they're working on at least getting a walk-up counter put in.
They do bicycle delivery in SOMA, so if you're in the area this is a great place to order lunch from.
author: Jacob F.

description:
I love a great sandwich!  It's my version of comfort food.  I can eat them every day of the week.  So, I've been on a hunt for the best sandwich in SF for a long time, and I believe I've finally found it...

The "Boca" at Deli Board.  Wow!  It's truly mouth-watering.  Stuffed with warm paper-thin rich & flavorful pastrami, corned beef, and brisket.  Melted Muenster cheese.  Tangy "Board Sauce" and Brown Mustard.  And, all wrapped in a perfectly toasted sweet french roll.  

This sandwich was made for people who love food.
author: Tony F.

description: The best sandwich place if you love meat, cheese, and bread. Definitely a frequent lunch spot. The Gold'n'Berg'n'Stein on Dutch Crunch is my go-to. Love the meat and the slaw that ties it all together. Pure yum, and totally worth the long-ish wait.
author: Danielle C.

description:
Now a days I like to really pretend that I am a busy adult, running the show, volunteering, being an over all kick ass son-of -a-bitch, and I am. But that leaves very little time dedicated to sitting down and spending the 45 min it takes to come up with something worth-while and witty to post on a yelp, all in hopes that some sexy hot stranger sends me a message reading "I like your review, lets act like two sea turtles and have wicked hot sex." Because sea turtles = wicked hot sex. 

Well I found something, no no, I was introduced to something that merits mention on the hallowed virtual halls of yelp... and by the looks of it, I am not that only person that thinks so. 

Deli board, deli board, deli board. You have re-awakened an obsessive foody beast once again. I  was given bagel chips, with fresh made veggi shmear, or something along those lines. If i wasn't in the company of others, I would have seriously violated that little container or creamy goodness. I also had the Boca sandwich, which with the first single experimental nibble I felt it necessary to remove my jacket, because I knew things were about to get serious. The Boca is this warm, delicious little layered creation or freshly made, and prepared in house, combination of pastrami, corned beef, and brisket. That alone should make your mouth water, but with the delicious drippings of that meaty trinity mingling with amazing house sauces... well... the most non-perverted and creepy way of putting it is... I savored every bite.   

Everything at Deli Board is made, cured, concocted, simmered, grilled in house. Even the pickles... which I naturally hate, unless deep fried (because I'm fat), but the pickle that was given was like no pickle I've ever had. It was fresh, light, dreamy even, providing euphoric visions of two sea turtles making wicked hot sex. 

When I finally made it home last night, I opened the fridge and let out a sigh. My house is not deli board. My fridge contains nothing worth making. I went to bed hungry last night. Hungry and yearning for some more deli board. 

Bravo Deli Board. BRAVO!
author: danny e.

description: Had the sandwich with corned beef and japalenos. It was amazing, and possibly among the best sandwiches I've ever had!
author: George W.

description:
there is no room inside for you to have the food, you have to take it out. But the girl working there is very nice and helpful. The size is quite large, I shared one sandwiches with my friend. The salad is also quite nice.
reasonable price, good to take it back home:)
author: Jing Z.

description:
My  first time today...It started out very confusing. I walked into the place expecting to see seats, a counter,  a sit down restaurant of some sort, didn't see anyone except for a few people standing in a doorway. They didn't say anything so I proceeded to walk until I almost hit the kitchen, it was then a person finally came out to greet me. Seriously they shd have like a sign that says "Please wait here" or something..

I guess we are just supposed to order at the doorway. Weird. Live and learn :) I really wanted to order the Boca, but instead ordered the Bateman. I started to regret it just a little bit when I heard that the 3 people in front of me all ordered the Boca :) Idk  brisket, corned beef, and pastrami seemed a bit much for me. (Sigh) Maybe next time :)... 

The Bateman was soooo good. I didn't really know what to expect, but I was extremely surprised.  The sandwich was moist and very flavorful. I don't know, but I think  the pepperoncini and cream cheese together gave it a good kick.   A lot of the times the healthier sandwiches just don't sound as appetizing. Delishhhhhhhhhh!!!!
author: eeerleni d.

description: Adam, the owner takes sandwich craft very seriously. The fare is consistently excellent. I always feel taken care of by the staff. High marks all round.
author: Chris R.

description: every other sandwich you've ever had is like a trip to the dentist. sandwich board's Mina is like oral sex, and if anyone complains about paying $15 for oral sex in a town where a 1-bedroom apartment costs $500k/month, they don't know what they're talking about.
author: Avery S.

description: I think it had all been said by now but definitely check this place out if your in the neighborhood ... or go out of your way to go here its well worth a trip.
author: William B.

description:
If you're looking for an epic sandwich (within some sense of reasonable sanity) then this is your place.

They offer a wide variety of specialty sandwiches and the menu usually changes which is great.

I recommend going halfseys with a friend so that you get to try 2 ridiculous sandwiches instead of just one.

The only downside is that it's pretty salty but what isn't anymore?
author: Nick E.

description: Wow, what a great effing sammich.  The Carzle was as billed -- hearty, a little sassy, and extra tasty.  Bring a napkin, but you may not need it if you like to lick your fingers.
author: Keith M.

description: Solid sandwich joint, but it was uncomfortably warm inside. Definitely be back though.
author: David S.

description:
Thank goodness for Yelp! I would have never found this place without it. Open only four days a week AND only for THREE hours! Walking by, you would never suspect delicious sandwiches were created in this secluded location. The deli sign is printed on a small 8-1/2" x 11" paper, hidden behind a dirty glass window. 

Based on other reviews, I went with the masses and tried the Boca. The bread was nice and soft. I think I would prefer toasted but it was good nonetheless. The variety of meats were fresh and surprisingly not fatty. The mustard sauce is a great complement to all meats.

I read a review that this place rivals Ike's. While I disagree (Ike's is still my favorite), this place can still hold its head up high. Fantastic food. I recommend calling beforehand to avoid the wait. Another reason why I love this city!

4 stars
author: Jonathan L.

description:
This place is unreal. Sandwhiches are my thing and this place is top 3 in SF.

Will go back!
author: Matt Z.

description:
I just bit in to an RLM and I - J.I.M.P.

(http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VLnWf1sQkjY&ob=av3n)
author: T C.

description: They finally moved into a building with a door, windows, even tables & chairs.  Plus its about 100yds from my apt.   The sammies are still the bomb.  Only reason i'm not given 5 is because you can't call ahead to place an order for pickup.  They still cater of course but if I'm just ordering for myself I have to go there place the order and wait.  Not such a bad thing in the grand scheme of things but neither is getting 4 out of 5 stars.
author: Eric V.

description: The Teddy O pastrami sandwich was unbelievable.  Having had pastrami sandwiches in NYC, LA and Chicago, this was right up there with the best I've had.  Definitely the best in the Bay Area!
author: Tommy T.

description:
My sister (who lives in SF) recommended this place to me when I was in town for a conference and it did not disappoint. I had the Ron which was amazing and my friend got the special which he said was great (some kind of breakfast sandwich).   

If you don't pay attention, you could easily walk right by this place without even seeing it. There's no place to eat inside (or stand for that matter) but there's a nice little park nearby where you can sit down and eat.
author: Jeff A.

description: Good God this place is delicious! Just go here!!! Eat it!!!!! Eat the sandwiches!!!!
author: Meg W.

description: Deli Board serves the best sandwiches in SF, hands down.  They are loaded with delicious, high quality meat, plenty of sauce, and great condiments.  Good bread, too.  My only complaint is that the hours are limited and I like to put sandwiches in my belly at all hours of the day.
author: Chris P.

description:
Holy crap this place is good! Got a flyer on our door about a deli delivery and figured we'd give it a try. We've ordered from here at least twice a week for the last three weeks. Cheap, delicious, fast delivery and extremely friendly people to deal with.  

I personally have had the brisket, Mikey Likes It and the Shanghai Chicken salad and was stoked on all of them. Healthy portions, hot and everything tastes so fresh. On our most recent delivery, Adam (the owner) personally came by to drop off our order to introduce himself and make sure we were satisfied with his place - Who does that anymore?
