I shall now slip into my lunchtime Mike Likes It food coma and enjoy the extra delicious pickles that come with every order. Thanks Deli Board!
author: German L.

description: Absolutely the best sandwich in the city, no matter which one you choose.  I pretty much get something different every time I am in here and it's awesome. The owner is usually in there when we go on Saturdays and he is super friendly and makes you feel welcome.  I have not been able to make it when they have Italian Beef, but rumor has it that it's the real deal Vienna Beef from Chicago which makes me love this place even more.  Don't be turned off if there is a line, it will take you that long to decide which sandwich you want and you will not be disappointed.  I usually go on the weekend and it's not as crowded as it is during the week.
author: Amelia C.

description:
Almost a year has passed since my Deli Board experience. Because it was a fly by night trip to SF (and I didn't check in on the Yelp app... *handslap* bad Jon Bon Jovial, bad!), I didn't remember to write this until I recently I got the meat sweats and it took me back straight to that sensational meat session. 

Note: this review may be vaseline-lensed, or have a Saved By The Bell pink-hue boarder, to give it some nostalgia. 

Like most days, coffee takes precedence over protein. When I realized I should eat, I had 30 minutes before a pretty important meeting. I was on foot back to The Mosser (later, you'll find out why the Deli Board justified this hotel stay). I didn't even have time to check the Yelp app for anything nearby. I turn the corner to see a fistful of folks standing around with an Angel from Reubenia handing greasy brown bags with the waft of pastrami to them. I notice her order paper pad, and I dart. Without looking at the menu, "Reuben?" She jots, then darts into a dark room. I looked around and no one other than her & her fellow angel-winged Reubenian were the only two going in & out. I couldn't make out what was happening in there, but I knew what was coming out of it. 

I hoof it to the hotel. In 18 minutes I need to iron a shirt and scarf this reuben. The reuben clearly takes top priority over de-wrinkling. I can only get halfway through the reuben before I have to leave. No fridge in the room (proves to be a good thing). I don't fret over it as the meeting should just be an hour. I start to get the meat sweats about half-way through the 1st half of the sandwich. I consider showering. Bah! Roll with it. Those meat sweats will allure all in my path. I leave the 2nd half of the sandwich in the room. I get back from the meeting and I can smell that reuben down the hall. The only way The Mosser can justify those tiny rooms is to leave a Deli Board sandwich in there for about an hour and it becomes a nouveau sauna from Reubenia. Pastrami instead of cedar. Kraut instead of towels. I just lied down to let it all go osmosis into me, then took down the 2nd half. 

The experience proved that even if you only have 20 minutes to order, scarf & sweat -- even without looking at the menu -- it's worth it. But... on second sight... look at the menu. Your complex meat sweats will allure all those you loathe & love.
author: Jon A.

description:
As the old adage says, "you get what you pay for" and in this case it is definitely true!

Yes, the bill is an average of 10 dollars for a sandwich or a salad. But, it is the best salad or sandwich you have ever had, time and time again. Bonus, they deliver everything by bike! 

The spinach dip is something I will always get even if I am not in the mood or that hungry! The soups are always a treat! Shanghai salad is my favorite and sandwiches are always great. The only thing for me is the sandwiches are a bit heavy and some of them I would like cold instead of hot such as the chicken salad.

Always check out the specials for the day before ordering!
author: Deseray T.

description:
Ordered from here for lunch at work. Had the "Boca"...it was amazing. Came here fast (on bike even) and was super delicious. In all, we ordered 9 sandwiches, and not one person thought it was anything less than spectacular.

Will definitely be ordering again.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Let me start by saying Wow.
My friends put me up on this place. Got the Boca sandwich (pastrami)- aka heart attack special (in the Best way possible).
Think three different meats sliced super thin, cheese, delicious toasted bread, and some kind of secret sauce....the flavor was truly incredible. Most people take their food to go, but I couldn't wait. My friends and I just popped a squat right there and devoured the whole thing (a truly difficult task). 
Btw, the pickles hit the spot with this sandwich.

The best part is one of the owners came out, really friendly guy. Gave us all a free shirt, and chopped it up with us. 5 stars, I will be going there frequently.
author: james m.

description:
love this place. sandwiches are awesome. Salads are just as great and they are super fast. i love that they deliver on bikes. i wish i could get a part time job here just to be able to ride my bike at work. 
have had almost all the sandwiches but my favorites are between the Very Veggie and the Reuben's Cousin. i know apples and oranges but i love them both.
author: Dennis K.

description:
My background: I'm in San Francisco working for 7 weeks, living out of a hotel room. Meaning: mediocre room service food, limited hotel restaurant menus. So, needless to say, I've been craving comfort food. Simple food...like sandwiches. I found this place on yelp, and was immediately excited to check out. 

Yes, it is hard to find, but there are plenty of resources available now that getting lost is hardly ever an excuse to not go anywhere! You will be glad you used your resources when you take your first bite. 

My first experience here was on "National Pastrami Day". (I did not know this until I saw the sign on the menu board). So of course, I ordered pastrami. They offered me a cup of cheesy broccoli soup while I waited for my sandwich. The lady taking orders was amazing, calling me by name (always a high light for me), making small talk about the area, and who I am, helping make the time fly by. 

The food: A-MAZ-ING. The soup was fresh. Real broccoli! Not that can nonsense. The sandwich, holy moley. One bite into, I couldn't stop, and knew I found a favorite sandwich joint in the city. The homemade pickles that come in the brown paper carry out bag are super as well. 

Enough of the WOW's. Check it out for yourself. You can review their daily menu on their website, or just be pleasantly surprised when you stroll up to the window and see the cleaver make shift menu for the day!  ENJOY!
author: Abby S.

description: Ike who? Ditch the inefficient kitchens, the long lines that border on criminal loitering, the angry Haight hippy clientele, horrible parking scenarios, ridiculous menus selections and overall miserable sandwich ordering experience for everything you would expect... come to the Deli Board. Superior customer service, a clean and welcoming sit down area, innovative, straightforward and ever changing menu of a handful of mouthwatering options await you. A kitchen that comes out to meet you and ask you how everything is, a short wait, soups that are creative and the sandwiches surpass any I have tasted in SF. I am happy happy when I am able to grab one of these. No lines and the people make the experience even better. Skip the hype and controversies of you know who and come for a great sandwich experience.
author: C K.

description:
I walked by this place every week for 3 yrs. Never walked in -- all those hipsters waiting forever, for what, a sandwich? C'mon.
Today I tried the BG, the basic brisket sandwich. Very good!!
Service staff was chipper and friendly, too.
author: eDub W.

description: Best sandwich in town! Great combo of old school deli meats and new style sandwiches.
author: Chris H.

description: might be the best matzo ball soup in the city.  Millers Deli vs Deli Board?  Guess it depends which is closer to your neighborhood
author: Gracie L.

description:
this hidden gem of a meat-a-licious sammich shoppe is amazerful! 

(translation: meaty sandwhiches, non-descript location, chill vibe, cool people). 
a boca & a chili (with cinnamon in it - soooo delish) are my go-to's.
author: Marie S.

description:
I have not had a better sandwich in my life.  The real secret are the specials that Adam posts on his twitter account.  Total win, every time.  

Mo is my favorite, but rest of the staff are pretty awesome too.  I have never (in the 40+ times I have been there) waited for more than 10 minutes for a sandwich.  

Lastly, to the rest of you folks who hate on this place for being in SOMA, I hope you step in a hobo turd on the way back to your South Bay suburbanite mansions.
author: Matthew G.

description: This is not hyped up.  It's truly 5 star sandwich material.  Somehow, I didn't know about it till the Chronicle food section had a story with the sandwich pictured like food porn.  Took a group outing from work via muni here and all were happy.  I had the Boca.  The 3 meats complimented each other nicely.  Really high quality and goes down easy.  The multicolored meats also look beautiful together and chopped up small it's a masterpiece to behold.  Great soft roll.  Brown mustard from Cleveland good.  I was scared the Muenster would be too smelly/aged, but it's mild and works well.  Totally worth the high price and enough for no need to pay for a drink or side.  Definitely worth making the effort to get there.  Not a bad walk from Market (take 7th, not 6th, of course).  Seating limited so get there early if with a group and you want to sit.  No toothpicks was my only complaint, since had a little pastrami in my teeth, though compared to most pastramis, the gristle is low so it wasn't a lot.  I also love how they don't even have a sign for the place.
author: Marc S.

description: $11, Kinda high for a sandwich.  I had the saracevic-corned beef, house brisket, kosher salami, muenster cheese, yellow american cheese, house slaw, pepperoncini blend, brown mustard, board sauce, french roll.  it was really good, nice and hot.  It's got a spicy bite at the end.
author: Peter L.

description: Delicious hot sandwiches and super friendly staff, one of my new SF favorites.
author: Jerry W.

description: I'd recommend the Boca. Great combination of pastrami, brisket, and corned beef. I suggest you try it with their house mustard.
author: Daniel K.

description:
I'm in love.

His name is Ronnie.

Melty in your mouth Brisket, creamy perfectly balanced Cream Cheese, chewy tuggy *White* American Cheese, spicy zingy Pepperocini complemented by sweet and silky Roasted Red Peppers.



Adam even cared enough to run Ronnie over himself so he'd still be warm and crunchy. And melty.

Thank you Adam.


Ronnie, {{{silly hand gesture}}}, call me!
author: Yasi S.

description:
Sorry to rain on the parade.
If your wallet is tight this is good value.
If you are looking for good locally baked bread, local pickles or local raised meats this is not your spot.
Our experience: you stand on the sidewalk and place your order in the doorway of an apartment building. No peeking into the kitchen allowed. No watching your sandwich being made. Could this just be a ground floor apartment kitchen and not a commercial kitchen/deli at all!?

We ordered a Boca (pastrami and corned beef) and a Corned Beef Spicy Slaw special. we were told it would be 20 minutes but only two other people were in line? That seemed strange. The sandwiches were ready in about 12 minutes. While we were waiting the door 'guard' brought out a complimentary taste of savory cheesy bread pudding.
Nice touch makes one forget they are standing outside on the sidewalk! These folks are clearly excited and proud of what they are doing.

Both sandwiches came on an industrial bakery Dutch Crunch roll so its big, airy but with no character. The meat is machine sliced so about 3 or 4 ounces of meat makes the sandwich look big. I prefer hand sliced meats but I know some people prefer machine sliced.
The meat, we were told was from Chicago - looked smelled and tasted like industrial CAFO meat - which seemed right for the price. A Pickle was sliced into 4 wedges and it tasted pretty commercial too.The sandwiches were well wrapped and nicely presented.
I wish Deli Board luck and would encourage them to go local especially with the bread. They have only been open a few months.I will try them again in a few months.
author: p l.

description:
Huge, delicious sandwiches served by a staff that's passionate and fun. When i went, they brought me a free buffalo wing as a sort of amuse bouche. 

It's hard to believe Ike's gets so much hype when there are places like Deli Board around.
author: Kendall D.

description:
Let me try and put it to you as plainly as possible.  This is the only sandwich place I've ever been to where immediately after completely ingesting one of their huge delicious sandwiches everyone in my party stared up at the menu to decide what sandwich they would order the next time.  

Stellar mix of friendly service and high quality.  This place is a SF gem.  

Shout out to Moe!!
author: marc d.

description:
I work at the Westfield Mall on Market Street so Deli Board was a great escape from the mundane mall food.  
The sandwich was huge stacked full of meat and other toppings.  The prices are great too!
The delivery guy, Justin, was fast and friendly.  
I would definitely recommend Deli Board to anyone who works in the SOMA area who is hungry for a great tasting sandwich.
author: Claire B.

description: Ordered porky. So Salty I couldn't finish. But the staffs are really nice and gave me a bottle of water with no extra change and that changed this 2 stars review to 4 stars
author: Paul W.

description:
They just started a lunch delivery so my office just had our lunch meeting catered by carbon neutral bike delivery service. Delicious and beautifully packaged, the sandwiches were ordered, paid for and devoured within the hour. 

Yum!
author: Rebecca G.

description: This is a MEAT sandwich shop for MEAT eaters. If you want a veggie experience....go to Subway. The MEAT sandwiches rock!  The servers are fun and helpful. The menu is always morphing .... as picky SoMa eaters tastes change like the weather. This is a MUST DO sandwich shop!
author: Darrin D.

description:
Much like a cigarette is a vehicle for nicotine, so is the Boca a vehicle for Adam's amazing pastrami.  While both could be perceived as a public health nuisance, the Boca Sando tastes much better than a cigarette...much better.

Choice is yours....choose wisely!

-Gonzo
author: Eric G.

description: Not worth the price of admission!  Roxys near Balboa Park or Ikes Place is the place for sandwiches!  This place is near my job, not worth the hype----I hate AK Subs because of the nasty cooks---but I'll pray and wing one of their sandwiches or Brainwash for way smaller price and quality!
author: Ty A.

description:
hype hype hype hype.  I got the gold-n-stein-n-berg.  it was 'ight except for the salami.  it tasted like oscar myers.  i called it in, and the woman got my name and told me to start coming down now because they don't want the sandwich sitting around.  I was surprised that they care!  I *hate* soggy sandwiches, so that was a huge plus.

I like this place fine, but I just don't think it's mind blowing.
author: H. L.

description: What a cool place and for anyone who gave this place anything less than 5 stars....please write me RIGHT NOW and tell me where you've had a better sandwich because I'll make the trip there tomorrow!
author: Clint M.

description: Amazing sandwichs here ! Come before 11:30 and you won't have to wait .. got the skully and the saracevie .. the saracevie won in my book .. so much going on in every bite loved it .. everything is so fresh .. go A's
author: Robert T.

description: Solid consistent sandwiches! The salads are really fresh and delicious as well, but if it's your first time, definitely get a sandwich! The service is always friendly and the music is rad...they have a record player, so they know whats up!
author: Stephanie L.

description: OUTRAGEOUS. OUTRAGEOUS. OUTRAGEOUSLY GOOD. The most meat packed, cheese packed, mouth watering hand cut brisket sandwich i've ever seen. It's called the "Anne", they only have it once and awhile, but it is seriously to die for. Their other sandwiches are phenomenal too, but man oh man the anne rocks my world
author: Kevin L.

description:
I have ordered platters for corporate lunches and Deli Board is always a hit!  Adam is very helpful and very flexible with the menu.  He was also patient with payment (I had to wait for accounting to process his check).  I will definitely order from them again.  

I got rave reviews from the everyone on my team.  They all loved the sandwiches!  The pickles and peppers that come on the side are really good too!  Salads are great as well.  YUM!
author: Tani N.

description: THAT, is what a pastrami or brisket sandwich is supposed to be like.  Nuff said.
author: Rick R.

description: Pretty mean line during lunch hrs but it moves fairly quickly. Tables r tough to snatch unless u beat the rush. Got the Gold N Berg that contained corned beef, pastrami, salami and cheese. Great sammi with I believe good quality ingredients. I prefer to have some veggies like lettuce and tomatoes. Like I said great sammi but $11 was kinda steep. Staff was super friendly and even brought the food out to the sidewalk for us.
author: T L.

description: It's too bad they don't have anywhere for you to sit and enjoy your paper-thin meat, but I guess that's what makes it 'hip'. You probably won't find a better deli sandwich in SF. It's meat magic.
author: Aaron J.

description: At first I was a little surprised by the price of the sandwiches here. But, after eating one I have to say, it's worth every penny. This is not just a sandwich, it's a sandwich experience. The meat is hand cut into thin and perfect slices. The bread is toasted and crispy. The cole slaw is crunchy and the cheese is melty and delicate. It all comes together into absolute awesomeness. I had the Fay, which was heaven. My husband had the Vat, which is absolute insanity when it comes to flavor. My daughter had the plain chicken salad and even all by itself it held up as an outstanding sandwich. Add on an amazingly friendly staff and this place is a must try. I highly recommend it :)
author: Sandra S.

description:
Enough good stuff can be said about the Deli Board. The sandwiches all rock. Hands down. I've ordered from this place countless times.

Today, in particular, was my best experience yet. I placed my order during their super busy opening rush. I was told my delivery would take up to an hour and a half.

Now, being that my office is downtown, I was totally okay with that - plus I had a large order.

Not only did the Deli Board crew come through for me but they arrived 30 minutes before they said they would and our order was perfect, as usual.

You guys know how to make a repeat customer keep coming back beyond the food. Props to Victoria who rocks my world. Thank you in particular for putting our order through today.
author: Chad B.

description: Go hungry... get the deli board sauce. Save room for the pickles!
author: Seema M.

description:
Amazing sandwich.  I got the Boca, with no alterations to it, following the direction of other Yelpers.  

I'm now sitting here, slightly uncomfortable because of how full I am, but still in complete bliss over the sheer brilliance of three different types of meat (pastrami, corned beef, and brisket), all cooked and sliced to perfection, stacked onto great bread, then topped with cheese and some surprisingly good sauce.

FYI... the 4 vs. 5 stars was solely because I actually didn't like the pickles... 5 stars for the sandwich.
author: Michael W.

description: yum.  No bread and I still loved it.  Will be back for Gluten free goodness.
author: Joe L.

description: CornBeef on French!  Why does it taste sooooooo goooood!  Meat was tender and the bread was perfect!
author: Mike L.

description: Yummmm.. this place makes a mean sandwich. Crispy and toasted on the outside, warm and delicious on the inside. The workers are super nice. I'm not a pickle fan so I can't comment on their pickles. But, they did give us cookies once cause they were out of pickles (score!) and those delish.
author: Sabrina T.

description:
i stumbled across this place with a friend last week.. andddd i've been dying to go back ever since. 

this place is tiny. so tiny, that you can't go inside! someone comes outside with a clipboard and takes your order. 

if you were walking down howard street, you might pass this place by without even noticing... that's if the line rounding the block doesn't catch your attention.

and there's a reason for that line. the menu is unique, each sandwich has it's own feel.. the first time i went, it took me 15 mins to narrow down my selection to 2 sandwiches: RLM and something else that i can't remember the name of because the RLM was sosososoo good. 

the RLM was a sandwich made of garlic bread. not enough for you? after taking the first bite, i actually smiled:  if you like meat, you'll like this place, the quality of the meat was UNbelievable-- they just don't serve that kinda stuff everywhere. 

i'm going back tomorrow and probably soon after that.

for you vegetarians or halal/zabiha eaters, i saw a falafel sandwich on the menu,, i didn't try it, but judging by the quality of the other sandwiches, i'd say it's good. if i can resist eating more of their delicious pastrami and brisket (which is beef not pork), i'll update this post letting you know how it is
author: Muzna N.

description:
Get The Amol. It's amazing. 

And I know the guy it was named after.
author: Melissa L.

description: I'm going to make this short and sweet. Deli Board makes a tasty sandwich, but it doesn't fill me up. After a nice morning surf at OB, I headed to Deli Board with high hopes of a sandwich that would put me under. The sandwich was delicious, but I could have eaten two (especially for the $12+ price tag).
author: Jason C.

description: A.MUST.TRY. I don't know what it is about this place, but OH.MY.GAWD. The owner is super nice and very helpful when I was indecisive about the menu items.
author: Mabel N.

description: Boca sandwich was good but overpriced and not that big...Don't believe the hype
author: Trev C.

description: My favorite deli ever! I request Deli Board as my last meal. I go to school across  the street 5 days a week and you will usually catch me in here. I am super picky about fresh ingredients as well as high quality ingredients, and deli board hasn't failed me yet. The sandwiches are spectacular, my favorite is the Mila (fresh basil, mozzarella, sliced tomatoes, pesto on their perfect sweet French roll) talk about amazing! And Adam's soups are to die for, can't get enough of them. Even if their food was amazing as it is, I would go in just to visit with the friendliest staff I've ever met at a deli! Yum now I'm craving the deli...
author: Juliana O.

description: Best sandwiches ever. On par with East Coast delis, which are usually no where to be found in SF. Run by a really nice guy too.
author: E S.

description: Get the Saracevic. Staff is awesome. We were given some soup to try while we waited for our food.
author: Christian A.

description: Damn this place for being so delicious.  Time to embrace heart disease and obesity.  At least I'll be fat, dead, and happy with my boca sando.  Seriously...who puts brisket, corned beef, and pastrami in the same sandwich...these guys!!!
author: Sam T.

description:
So I heard about this new secret item not on their menu called a "Fatty Alex", which is basically their Fatty Matty but with chicken instead of tuna. And Oh. My. God. is it delicious. Probably better than anything on their menu, I don't understand why its not there. 

Trust me, get one.
author: Charlie M.

description:
awesome. gigantic. meat overload. HiC and Gold n' berg n' stein or something like that. soooo good. 

i don't get it. are they operating out of an apt or something? you're not allowed to take a step in the door at all. just wait outside and your food magically appears out of thin air. 

just be careful about parking. i parked for no more than 10 minutes and got a parking ticket. those meter maids are sneaky little bastards. but i wasn't that upset because the sandwich was so good. if it were a sub par sandwich then i would be cursing right now.
author: Regina C.

description: Great Sandwiches, no that is an understatement.  Some of the Best Sandwiches I have had in my life. The only downside is they are pricey. 5 stars for a great sandwich and a great staff, they are always super nice and willing give you conversation.  So glad I only live a block away. I just which there was an App that would update me when my favorite Board sandwiches are available.
author: Rey L.

description:
First time customer - I ordered the artichoke soup today. Got it delivered to our office along with other orders. My tongue is still burning from the piping hot soup. It's really my fault, it was too delicious to let cool down. I kept gulping and slurping away ignoring the pain yet enjoying the taste. The soup came with chunks of bread floating atop (which I thoroughly enjoyed) but be sure to request for no bread if bread doesn't sit well with you. 

Looking forward to more orders from here. The sandos look fab and I definitely want to try "Zoe's 1st" ;)
author: Joanne N.

description:
I grew up not enjoying sandwiches.  Well, grilled cheese, maybe.  But anything with eight different ingredients was sure to contain something I was too picky to eat.  Plus there was a 15 year stretch of vegetarianism to deal with.

And then I met Deli Board. Now all I want is a huge sandwich with whatever they think tastes great.  Fresh meats, crisp veggies, awesome breads, tasty sauces... I've probably had a dozen different sandwiches there (they change their menu pretty often, and their daily specials are great) and every one has been excellent. They're the only takeout place where I've been driven to call them back (and wait a while to get through their busy line) just to tell them how awesome the food was.

And now that you can even go inside and sit down, it's even better.  (And somehow I ended up in one of the big pictures on the wall! Couldn't choose to be semi-associated with a better restaurant.)
author: David G.

description:
It was absolutely delicious, but where is the rye bread?
I'm originally from Cleveland and have been searching for good corned beef, pastrami, etc. and this definitely fit the bill.   Adding west coast traditions is fine, however, minus 1 star not even having rye bread as an option.
author: J W.

description: This place has the best sandwiches ever! Never skip on quality and always served (even after delivery) warm. The soups are FANTASTIC and I am in LOVE with the chicken ceasar salad (which you can ask to pre-toss with the dressing for you). Did I mention that they cater? Who doesn't LOVE this place? The board sauce kicks ass!  :)
author: Antoinette S.

description: I know deli's pretty well and This place is great... Walked 1.1 miles to get there... it was hot... I'n sweating... you order outside, waited too long for my sammich as there were only 2 people ahead of me... got the sammich and ther's no place to eat, so I found a park... hot and bothered by this point. But then I opened the sammich and all was forgotten. Wow wow wubzy! Deeeeelish. Got the Italian... bursting with flavor, good size... best.
author: Tom M.

description:
Things I hate about most pastramis: Chewy, Greasy, Fatty, Soaking in a steam tray, gristly. Nothing like that at Deli Board, was the best pastrami i've had, tender, moist, had a nice peppery smoke. The addition of board sauce, house made pickles, and brown mustard, perfected this sandwich. The soft roll was fresh, very soft and slightly sweet.

The only problem was how fast I devoured this sandwich, I could eat a second one if I wanted to hurt myself. I can't wait to order from here again.

The time it took between ordering, eating and writing this review was about 30 minutes, that's insanely fast. The person who showed up at our door was really chill, had he not been on the clock I'd have invited him to stay and have a beer.
author: Shawn S.

description: Epic Sando! Got the corned beef with fried egg -- amazing! Great service, personable staff, everything made to order. Best sandwich in SF. Skip Ike's and come here instead, thank.me later. Really helpful staff! RIGHT ON guys!!
author: Philipp S.

description: I went here during Santa-con and at the time didn't know the area very well so I just yelped a lunch place and found this sandwich shop.  We had the emeline and the mila.. both of which were good.  I haven't had the chance to go back, but I remember the sandwiches being rather filling and rather tasty.
author: Rachana S.

description: Thanks yelp for the rec.  This place is awesome.  The bf was madly in love with the sandwiches and made love to my leftover sandwich and his. The bread is nicely toasted and not too much dough which is good bc they load the thing with so much meat!  Best pastrami hands down.  Why does sf have all the best delis.  Open some in San Jose!
author: sherry t.

description:
Definitely one of the best sandwiches places I've been to. My cousin brought me here since he lived close by. We managed to avoid the long wait during the lunch hour rush on a Saturday (no idea how that happened) and I ordered the Zeke.

It was a good sandwich but I felt like that it could have used a bit more avocado and slightly less turkey. The piled-on turkey was just a bit overwhelming and couldn't taste anything but that after a while (some may like that though). Over all, it was very good and I'll be interested in trying their other sandwiches. My cousin recommended their pastrami/brisket/corn beef to me but I'm not a big fan of them and decided to try their turkey first but I think I'll take him up on his recommendation next time just to see what everyone is talking about.
author: Richard C.

description:
I've only been once, but man oh man this place was awesome.  I had the Boca, which was an absolute gut-buster, and I mean that in a good way.  My wife and I, who can both chow down, couldn't even finish our whole sandwiches. 

The Boca - Corned Beef, Pastrami, and Beef Brisket all perfectly seasoned and cut paper thin.

Even though their hours are M-F 11-2, I would gladly skip work to go there.
author: Shane C.

description: Good God, they make a great sandwich. Thankfully my office is only 2 blocks away from Deli Board, which, in my opinion, serves the best sandwiches in the city.  I always go for the specials (the vito is my favorite so far), but there menu is loaded with top of the line sandos. They are big on brisket, pastrami, and corn beef. I'm drooling just thinking about this place. On top of that, Dinay, who works the cash register, is an absolute rock star. Super professional, friendly, and proficient. She can turn a stressful and long line into a walk in the park. Very sweet person. On top of that, she remembers everyone's name! It's not like there are 30 regulars here. This place is packed! All the time! Awesome place, serving up the best sandos in the city. No question.
author: Nick H.

description: This is my all time favorite sandwich place in the city!  There's a lot of close competition but Deli Board is the shit! Flat out!  I'm happy they're doing well but look out for some serious traffic during lunch time.  I crave their sando's so hard!  Never had a bad sandwich, never had a bad experience here.  They make great salads as well.  The service is really good...good peeps
author: Ramon L.

description:
This place only caters. Beginning this Thursday they will do delivery service. But do not show up at their location because this is not a deli. There is no counter to approach and place your lunch order

Regardless, I had a delicious meatloaf sandwich and the owner Adam is incredibly nice. When my coworker and I accidentally showed up for lunch (thanks Yelp, thanks a lot. #sarcasm) he was nice enough to offer to make us 2 individual sandwiches despite the fact that they do not usually do this.
author: Charles M.

description:
Small shop in SOMA but great sandwiches. They load up on the meat so you'll be satisfied and the owner is extremely nice. If you go when they open at 11, there's no wait. A coworker and I walked over for lunch, arrived shortly after 11 and we got our sandwiches quickly. 

To top it off, they have hot sauce made with Trinidad Moruga Scorpion peppers, the hottest pepper out there now!

Definitely going to return in the future.
author: Jen S.

description:
A delightful deli and  brilliant addition to SOMA.
The staff seems to love their job and will go out of their way making recommendations. The sandwiches,meats, fillings and sauces are memorable and will me you crave this food all the time!
author: Sara K.

description: Delicious hot sandwiches.  Tasty bread piled with meats, cheeses, and sauces.  Make sure to show up early,  it gets crowded fast.
author: Greg C.

description: LOVE the sandwiches and pickles.  I went for lunch.  The sandwiches (I had the Mezman/pastrami and tried the Saracevic/corned beef and brisket) are pretty filling so I saved half for dinner.  I'm actually eating it right now!
author: Jane N.

description: Why, cruel universe, do you close deli board at 4?  So good!  I wish I could get a sammy here after 6 when I get off, but alas.  Pickles!!!
author: Christina W.

description: Want a great sandwich?  Come here!  Had a pastrami sandwich and it was the bomb!  The bread is so soft and fresh. The meat was very flavorful.  Customer service was good. Over all had a great experience, will come back the next time I'm in town. :-)
author: Ann B.

description:
I've been to their old location, and new location on Folsom. New location definitely is an improvement, as it is now an actual deli with chairs and seating.  Overall it is a good sandwich shop.  I've tried a few specials of the day, and the make your own including a Turkey and a Pastrami.

Sandwiches by themselves, would rate 4.5 stars.  Overall, they are tasty, good sized, and well put together.  Board pickles are a nice plus.

Minus 1/2 a star for their prices.  $9-11 for a sandwich, in SOMA?  That is fairly expensive.  AK Subs beats them on price hands down and they make a decent sandwich too.

Minus 1 STAR - Recently, I called in to place an Order.  No ANSWER, so I gave up that day.  Another day, called in before the Noon rush.  This time I reached the Owner, his response... "I am in the kitchen, just come on down and place your order."  If I wanted to come in, place an Order for take out, then wait another 15 minutes for it to be made, then I guess I would follow your advice.  Helloooo...  Don't know if these folks have ever worked in another take out restaurant before, maybe they just don't know better?!?  People are calling to place an Order, and you are driving away business.
author: Bentley L.

description: First time I went there and the sandwhiches were kinda pricy but they are really good.  But the thing that got me is that the clam chowda soup I had was the worst ever.  It was so watered down that it makes campbells soup taste like gourmet.  if you ever go here do not order the clam chowder soup.  This clam chowder soup is the worst I ever had.  I can't believe they can serve this kinda crap.  But the sandwhiches are freakin good.
author: Raymund D.

description: I went to order the only veg option on the menu and asked what was not vegan on the falafel sandwich.  The woman taking the order had NO IDEA what vegan was.  Really.  She couldn't tell me what was or wasn't vegan on the sandwich, so I just had to guess.  I know, I know, this place is definitely more carnivorous, but it's in SAN FRANCISCO!!!!  People working at food establishments should know what vegan means.  Anyway, the sandwich was ok, not really that good, because there was no sauce on it.  She couldn't tell me what was in it, so I opted for the cautious side.  Would I go back?  If someone met me in that area and there wasn't much else to eat, but probably not.
author: Suzie R.

description: As good as a sandwich gets. I've had the Boca, TeddyO, and Munsoned, all made with high quality ingredients and a perfect combination of flavors that make your mouth light up. Deli Board is everything that Ike's Place purports to be...where Ike's falls short, Deli Board fulfills your every sandwich fantasy.
author: Larry B.

description: Deli Board is what's up. This place definitely gives Ike's a run for its money. I definitely prefer it to Ike's, although I'm not what you would call an Ike's fanatic. I had both the Boca and the Munsoned. They were both meaty, flavorful and delish but I definitely preferred the Boca b/c the Munsoned is a bit spicy and I'm a wuss when it comes to that. I'm glad that I've found an old skool NYC deli in San Fran that can make a serious, phat sandwich complete with authentic pickles on the side.
author: Hanan H.

description: OMG The Menzen with the deviled eggs and pastrami, plus the hotties who work there ... gotta love this place
author: Z S.

description: I've lived nearby for a while but just finally stumbled across this place - and oh man am I glad I did.  Ordered the mish - corned beef with bacon.  Simply delicious.
author: Matt B.

description:
To Carolina S, for someone in the entertainment industry, you sure know how to write a yawner of an email.  Classic SF whining.  It's almost as if a different sandwich shop hired you to smear Deli Board. 

Anyway, my wife and I ordered two sandwiches: the Sha Sha and the Zeke. Both sandwiches, if you can call them sandwiches, were excellent. It's like Deli Board has reinvented the sandwich. My wife has never been so quiet during a meal. The sandwiches basically consumed US. As I told my wife with a full mouth, this isn't a sandwich...it's an event. 

Great service. Great events!
author: Lamario D.

description: Had the "mara" it was great :) perfectly toasted and loaded with meat. The creamcheese and jalapeno did it for me. Definitely would reccomend this place for a great sandwich.
author: Michael W.

description: solid sandwiches, but i need more greens in my food. the only green you have here is the pickle, which is good, but not enough.
author: Michelle V.

description: It was tasty and clean.  14 dollars for a sandwich and a dollar for extra sauce? Really?  I saw the prices before going here and I knew what to expect.  I've routinely spent that much for sandwiches in sit-down deli's in LA and NY so I'm not unimpressed merely because of the price, I just don't think I was given a 15 dollar sandwich.  It wasn't a bad sandwich , just not really that great.
author: sasha a.

description:
Very tasty. Would recommend Stephanie. And always try just a splash of whatever hot concoction the chef has made for the day!

Over priced for sure. 

Get there before noon and you don't have to wait in line.
author: Gracie S.

description: I was only passing through town, and I came across this place. Based on the other reviews I had read, I chose the skinny Reuben. So delicious. But the reason I am giving this review is because Adam and Mo made me feel like I was home. Once they found out I was traveling alone, they gave tips on what to see and where to go. They answered all my questions while I was munching on my delicious sandwich. Thanks for taking the time to make this stranger feel welcome :) I'll be back!
author: Susan M.

description: I have been here a few times and I really enjoy this place every sandwich is so yummy. I also love that you get a giant pickle with your sandwich!!!!!  Down fall is that around lunch time the wait isn't amazing, but they do their best to get the food to you asap.
author: T S.

description: Definitely the best sandwiches I've had in San Francisco. Whenever I'm in the area and need lunch, I go here every time.
author: B. B.

description:
since i was in the city during the weekday, i thought i should try a place for lunch that i don't have the chance to try on the wknd.  deli board is around the corner from our place, so i called in my order and picked it up half an hour later.  we got the spicy split pea soup, the veg special sandwich of the day w/ falafel, pickled onions, sprouts, habanero sauce, and an egg salad sandwich on wheat roll.  

the sandwiches are huge, so i could only eat half and saved the other half for later.  the soup comes in either pint or quart size, so the pint size was more than enuf for 2 of us.  

sandwiches come w/ great thick cut dill pickles on the side.
author: Helen T.

description: Love this place.  Bread is perfect. Ingredients are fresh.  I love The Ron minus the japs. Wish the hours were longer. I would come in more often
author: J D.

description: Stumbled upon this weekend.  Ordered a $9 sandwich that was pretty, um, unsavory.  Nice staff, large sandwich just not good.  I might give the another try- just don't order the most expensive gross tuna sandwich.  Two stars for now.
author: tracy J.

description:
In the past 2 weeks, our team at work has batch-ordered sandwiches from this place maybe 5 times for lunch, each time with more people clamoring to hop on the deliboard train. let's get to it:

i've tried two diff. sandos here so far: the boca and the mila.

the boca: "pastrami corned beef and brisket muenster cheese   
Board sauce brown mustard pickles sweet french"

If the description from the website isn't enough to get you going, allow me to embellish. the sweet french roll used for the sando is toasted such that the outer flaky crunch gives way to the warm softness inside as you sink your teeth in. But as soon as you've begun to appreciate the perfection that is the sweet french, the flavor of the meats and cheese melded together draws no less than a visceral utterance of satisfaction. It's a good amount of meat and the price point is great given that it's delivered to your door. AMAZING!

If you're not a vegetarian or a vegan, I would recommend sticking with the meat-based sandos. However, the mila was also a solid choice, with the melted (but not too melted) mozzarella filling the sandwich generously and the pesto gracing the entire project tastefully.

I've heard that the mish has some kick and is delish and another favorite is the bg.

But seriously - the real kicker is the fact that the sandwich is $9 for a standard sandwich + tip for the delivery guy, delivered TO YOUR DOOR. They've nailed our order each time we've ordered 

Final word - best hot sandwich I've had in the city yet, and super convenient.

From the current buzz in the office, I think we're doing this for lunch again today. That makes 3 consecutive days this week. Time to get on the deliboard train!
author: Brian L.

description: Since this place has moved to a shop of Folsom.....getting sandwiches is much easier.....And I've changed feelings about them......and raise them from 3 stars to 5!  Try it!  They are awesome!
author: Bryan M.

description:
They make a pretty good sandwich--the Rubens are a choice select! The loss of delivery to our locals (catering not included) makes it a bit harder to consider this place when we have such great selections in SF.

Now here is what killed it for me from returning, They don't take phone orders for pick up...and ordering there took a while. Good if you want to make it a lunch destination, but not if you want to pick up and go.
author: marco c.

description: Best sandwich I've had in San Francisco!!! Love the golden bergenstein...... wow
author: Christopher L.

description: This is a seriously good deli. So far I've only tried the Boca sandwich with pastrami, corned beef, brisket, and munster cheese. The perfectly baked roll was stuffed full of meat. The flavor was savory and delicious, but after a few mouthfuls I found it a bit too salty. I'm glad they give you extra pickles on the side to help balance it out. If I worked in SF, I would be here 3 times a week.
author: Jermaine R.

description: Ordered for lunch for my team of 11. Amazing sandwiches, and they arrived warm, and came with a variety of pickles packed separately. We had the corned beef, hot pastrami, and turkey sandwiches. Service was amazing, including the delivery guy, and they delivered on time. One of the top 2 sandwiches I have had in my life. Would definitely recommend and order from this place again hands down!
author: Genghis Q.

description: YUM! I'd heard all of the rave reviews about this place and had to try it.  It was phenominal.  From the friendliness of the ladies at the register, to the nicely toasted bread, to the thinly carved meat, my experience was superb.  Definitely will be coming back often!
author: Bryte N.

description: Vegetarian Falafel review: Pretty good, but not awesome. It was a bit dry. I wish they had more options. Next time I'll try the egg salad.
author: San D.

description: absolutely the best place in sf to get hot sandwiches.. better than Ike's by far. super friendly staff and the food is made super quickly. Loveee this place!
author: Tea F.

description:
Wow, one of the best sandwiches I had in 4 years (I got the Fatty Matty with Tuna). On top of this, there is the whole experience of going there and getting greeted by nice people on the street which is somewhat unique, yet they make it a nice and leave a lasting impression. Try it: The cardboard sign saying "wait here" indicates the adventure you'll about to experience.

Update (stepping one star down to 3):
I had two other sandwiches that while good didn't match up to my first sandwich in terms of how perfect it was balanced. 
I most recently had a Greek salad that had two minor flaws: 1) The balsamic dressing was so thick that it didn't mix with the salad but stayed on top, 2) The salad wasn't mixed and it would have been hard to do that in the to-go box in came with, I had to eat through a bed of cheese to get to the salad.
author: Mpunkt H.

description: This place is terrible, I have no idea why people are rating it so high. I got the pastrami sandwich and a turkey-avocado and both were horrible. The meat was dry, the sandwich was messy (greasy but not flavorful). I think they tried to build an ike's style sandwich and failed miserably.
author: Andrew H.

description: First off, I recommend you don't try to walk into the place like I did! The menu is posted outside the building and someone will come out and take your order on the sidewalk. The Boca Sandwich was the perfect blend of meaty excess married perfectly with just the right bread both texturally and volume. The balance of meat and bread is always locked in a sort of cosmic battle in my mind but this sandwich really put the two in harmony. Sounds weird, but that's what did it for me to elevate this to five stars.
author: Procter F.

description:
A business that cannot deliver a product can only be worth one star. 

Have you tried calling them normal business hours? Good luck.
author: Kyle B.

description: This place is a gem. All sandwiches I've tried are down right delicious. Especially the Boca. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. And if you're a fan of pickles, the sandwiches also come with some of the best pickles I've ever had. No joke. Not too sweet and just right on the tangy-ness. Must try! Must return! Must... stay.... away....
author: Andy T.

description:
Went back to Deli Board for a second try - it was delicious, as expected.  However, what bumped it to 5 stars was the fact that I ended up in a long deli debate with the owner, Adam.  We argued over pumpernickel bread and bagels (i.e. how hard good ones are to find in SF).  

Adam was kind enough to offer to bake me a few fresh ones.  He flies the dough in fresh from NYC and bakes it on premises.  Amazing!  

Thank you!
author: Adam S.

description: Love their new location! It beats having to wait in the glaring heat out on the sidewalk. Plenty of seating inside and just across the street from the park to grub on some seriously good sandwiches while enjoying the sun.
author: Danny K.

description: Some of the best sandwiches I've ever had! Ike's better watch out cause the guy that owns the join is a master at making delicious sandwiches! just writing this review is making me think about the delicious sandwiches! Go get one.. or two.. you will not regret it.
author: Frank G.

description: Disappointed at how small the sandwhich was. fun crowd though, owner came out to say hi.  zeke, very heavy
author: Tiff W.

description:
Whether you want a refreshing chicken salad sandwich or a super savory smoked brisket or pastrami .....this place is the only call you
should make....simply the best lunch possible , and its delivered!
Dont get me started on the awesome soups.... i suggest chicken chowder ...it rocked.
We had 100 wings catered to our workplace for the monthly potluck ,
and to be honest the teriyaki  wings are probably the best i have ever eaten, so do yourself a solid and order today!!!!
author: myron w.

description:
4 stars for the yum-o sandwiches.  4 stars for awesome bike delivery service up our hill. 5 stars for quality ingredients. 4 stars for super friendly folks making lunch easy, honest, delicious and affordable.  thats 17 stars so far... so, minus 12 because yelp will only let me give 5.

you really can't go wrong here... I've had the RLM, Fatty Matty, Boca and Marvin and I've never been disappointed!
author: Sha N.

description:
I was looking around yelp for yet another good sandwich spot and decided to try this place out because of the rave reviews. Took muni to civic center, walked through a couple sketchy street corners, and arrived at Deli Board. The surprising part is that you aren't allowed inside, so you'll know you're at the right place when you see a group of people standing outside on a street where there are no other people. They have windows where you'd be able to see into this little hole in the wall place... except they have paper over them so you can't see through, kind of sketch. 

What this means though is that you stand outside while a girl comes and takes your sandwich order and your money... and then you continue standing outside until she brings your sandwich out to you in about 20 minutes. Note to self for next time (although there probably won't be a next time so just a note to you readers out there): call ahead. So yea that's the arriving/ordering/paying//waiting experience. The eating experience... come hungry! I got the "jay sandwich", and there was a lot of turkey on there. I agree with someone else's comment that the bread is pretty good - nice and soft/chewy. It wasn't bad, but eh, out of the way and weird set-up. There are better places
author: Caitlin B.

description: great sandwiches+pretty ladies taking your order=Win.
author: C S.

description: Huge sandwiches. So yummy! And the staff are super nice. Neighborhood gem.
author: Lauren K.

description: best sandos in San Francisco and always great customer service to go with the  amazing quality of food!
author: Rico A.

description: I eat here almost weekly.  Their sandwiches are absolutely amazing.  Fresh bread, great ingredients and very unique combos.  I normally get my staff to order from here so we can take advantage of the $20 or more get free delivery deal.  I like the Boca and the Zeke.  The only reason I'm not giving them the 5 stars is sometimes it takes hours to get a delivery.  I understand growing pains as a business and I'm sure they'll get there soon enough.  Stopped by the actual location today and was surprised to have cute girls come out to the sidewalk to take your order.
author: Greg G.

description: Sandwiches are SO good. Fresh ingredients, fun combinations, and perfectly toasted bread. Service? Not so much. Overall I'd totally go back, as the food makes it all worth it.
author: Kathryn M.

description: I have never had a better sandwich in my life.  The first time I went there I was wondering why my friend brought me there because there was a long line.  Now I know why!  And the pickles are amazing too.  If you want a great sandwich in San Francisco then this is where you go!  Although parking is challenging here, it is SF and so it is an issue really anywhere in the City.
author: David P.

description: Great sandwiches! Tender meat with all the fixings. If your a meat lover you most definitely are not in for a disappoint because they are not stingy when piling it on.
author: Toiney B.

description:
Yup, still amazing.  I ordered sandwiches for an office meeting.  Everything was great; while they do not do timed orders for delivery (maybe for catering orders though--this wasn't over 10 people, so it was regular deliver), it worked out okay because it took about an hour which was perfect for when our meeting was happening. The delivery person (by bike) has a portable credit card machine that you can use. 

One person ordered a salad, which was quite large.  I had the the "Munsoned" ($9 - brisket white american cheese pepperoncini blend 1000 island brown mustard sweet french); it was delicious and spicy.
author: Jason S.

description: These are REAL sandwiches.  Just look at their photos.  End of story.
author: Matt L.

description: Holy Moley! My bf makes great sandwiches and we often make our own before shelling out $9 for someone else's, but this place makes quite possibly the best, most well-composed, meaty, tasty sandwiches that even my bf admits might be better than his. Best part of all, the BREAD is phenomenal.  No tugging at thick chewy rolls like a mad dog here, just pleasant bites into perfectly pillowy, crispy, crusty, rolls. YAY! After 11 years, this East-coaster finally found the best heroes in SF!!
author: N. L.

description: Quick, no-nonsense deli food.  Order at the door and receive a great sandwich. Staffers have a great attitude and it was a great way to end a sanfran/stanford/portland trip :D
author: Bobby K.

description:
OMG. Drool. 

1 star for: 
The #1 Best sandwiches in the downtown area, if not the whole city (sorry Ike's, I like you too, but you're so hard to get--and I'm not into hard to get, at least when it comes to sandwiches)

2 stars for:  
Two Huge sandwich halves! One half for lunch, mmm!  And one half to save to prep me for the impending Friday afternoon happy hour that is going to dominate my liver. Perfect!

3 stars for: 
Three means Free! Free Lunch Delivery. Cute bike messengers deliver your lunch. For free.

4 stars for: 
Four Veggie sandwich options! Not just peppers and cheese on bread, ohhh no. Tastiness abounds. 

5 stars because: 
After 5 long work days, this place is my new Friday lunch addiction.  

Lucky for all the people that work with me who now get DeliBoard sandos to start their weekend off right.
author: Ms. M.

description: My coworkers and I at the Mini Cooper Dealer are addicted! We order so often that the owner "Adam" and I are on a first name basis. I've tried all but two of their sandwiches and they have all been delicious. I especially like the "Boca" and the "Bateman". The delivery guy is quick and very friendly too. If your tired of your same old lunch spot I highly recommend calling up Deli Board! One bite, game over...
author: Gilbert R.

description: First time to Deli Board. I got the falafel sandwich, really impressed. Great flavor and ingredients, ranks right up there with Ike's.
author: Saket V.

description: I had the Boca and definitely one of the best sandwiches I've tried. Will come back whenever I am in the area to try others.
author: Anthony C.

description:
had the rueben's cousin sub pastrami, and enjoyed every bite of it.  i like the fact that the sandwich was simple, and the flavors were amazing.  they don't overload their sandwiches with ridiculous amounts of sauce, or gigantic portions of meat.  everything is laid out evenly, where one is well able to manage eating it, without fear of a serious mess.

i look forward to trying out their other creations.
author: Sheri N.

description:
had a great first experience here last saturday and am excited to return (we didn't realize they serve creme brulee until AFTER we got our sandwiches--so we obviously must go back).  i had the pastrami (solid) and my bf had a grilled veggie sando (he loved it and can't wait to return).  here are my initial thoughts:

pros
- good sized portions (not too big, but not too small)
- each order comes with delicious home made pickles
- great to have another good, local, affordable lunch place in soma

cons
- we went at 2:30pm and had to wait 20 mins for food...in part, because it was busy (can't imagine what a weekday lunch line would look like!) and in part, because they are a bit slow (not super efficient service)
- few places to sit
- they were out of corned beef--this seems like a staple and it was a bit disappointing...seems like something odd to run out of
- might be hard to find parking at times (we parked by sightglass and walked over)
author: Lynn G.

description:
It's nice to see a more traditional East Coast deli like this pop up to add a little variety to the everything-but-the-kitchen-sink specialty sandwiches that have been more popular lately. I came here with some friends for a weekday in early December. It was one of those freak days of winter sunshine, and the sun was streaming through the storefront windows and the crowd of people in the pick up line (that spilled out to the deli entrance, which I'd guess is common here) were keeping it cozy and warm.

We were lucky enough to grab a table while we waited. The wait for food was a little long, but it was the lunch rush. We split the Gold'n'Berg'n'Stein and a daily special, and both were massive constructions and packed with juicy, expertly smoked, salted, cured and corned meats - and I love, love, love it when I get an added pickle bonus. The price (for both your finances and your health) is a little steep for too frequent visits, but I'd happy go back on another sunny day.
author: Brittany B.

description:
SFChronicle article brought me here from the Peninsula.  Article does not do justice to the taste and creativity. BEST corned beef sandwich (Boca) I have ever had -just soo many good flavors. Make that the best tasting sandwich period. Corned beef, pastrami to perfection!
Warm bread, several flavors, meaty and juicy. Will definitely drive back here JUST for the eats.
author: Mike B.

description: i know i should have gotten a sando but still a salad should not lack so much flavor , it was really blend , with few pieces of white fish that tasted like tofu , 3 stars just to blame myself for not getting a sandwich otherwise it would have been 2
author: NAEL K.

description: I tried deli board for the first time today. To be honest I wasn't blown away or anything, but perhaps my expectations were just a little high, after hearing so much about this place and seeing the great yelp reviews and the crowds lined up to eat there. I did enjoy my meal, though. It was definitely worth going and I would definitely go back if for no other reason than to try one or two more of the many concoctions on their extensive sandwich menu. The service was very friendly and the sandwich came out pretty quickly, considering how crowded the place was. All of the interesting combinations of cured meats and other unique ingredients on the sandwiches are what I guess what sets this place apart and makes it so popular. I got the "Cohen" sandwich, which has corned beef, brisket, white american cheese, cherry peppers, and coleslaw. Like I said, it was good, and worth checking out, but don't expect to have a sandwich epiphany or anything. I guess I just thought the unique combo of ingredients would make the flavors pop more than they did. On the plus side the sandwich came out nice and hot with nicely melted cheese and the french roll was very good (not enough sandwich places go the extra mile to use high quality breads like this!). My only small complaints were that the corned beef and brisket were put on opposite sides of the sandwich (this was done on purpose but personally I would've preferred to try the combination of the meats together) and they used spicy cherry peppers. Usually when you see cherry peppers on a sandwich (they are popular on authentic cheese steaks, for example) they are of the sweet variety, which makes a better contrast of flavors with the salty meats. Also I could see coleslaw on the sandwich but couldn't really taste it, it didn't really add anything to the sandwich. Overall very small complaints, and my only reason for not rating deli board higher than 3 stars is because I thought it was good and satisfying, but not great and not anything I haven't had before. Perhaps my rating will go up after I try one or two more of their creations.
author: Benny A.

description:
I'll start off with a disclaimer, I'm a sandwich nazi, otherwise this review would be 5 stars. There are very few I can compare to this sandwich. Deli Board has quality ingredients: fresh meats and vegi's, fresh bread, extra fixins including cherry peppers. The meats are generously packed into the sanny, definitely solid on the "traditional" sandwich category.

The pastrami was on point, no fatty chunks that leave a meaty string hanging from your mouth...just quality bites. A toasted version of this would be killer, and possibly trump my favorite pastrami spot on west portal.

Turkey and ham was nice blend of meats, although I wouldn't mind sacrificing a few slices in exchange for more vegi, and I'm not sure if the dijon mustard was a good choice...unless there was another sauce to counterbalance the strong mustardy taste. A toasted version here would have also made an impact.

This is a great place to grab catering for a large office! Fresh sides, huge cookies, soups, and bagel chips! No co-worker will leave hungry.
author: wes w.

description: Awesome sandwiches loaded with quality meats and toppings. They offer some of the best tasting sandwich combinations that work in great harmony. The meat is abundant but not disproportionate. Probably the best and most perfectly constructed sandwiches in FiDi. There's no reason to eat Subway when you have Deli Board.
author: Ed L.

description: If you're a carnivore this has got to be the place to chow down on some great sandwiches. Mounds and mounds of meat atop some bread, cheese, and the occasional greens. I only wish that sometimes there's more board sauce because it can get lost in the pile of meat.
author: Eric L.

description:
yes. yes and yes. we are busy hairdressers. we dont like making lunch and we dont like leftovers. deli board came along, and now it feels like we have our own personal chefs.

these guys are good. excellent customer service. excellent food.
i like the simple menu, cause i dont like too many choices. its just enough. ive tried a few things on the menu, and its all amaZING!

today i got the falafel salad.
secret peta chips a plus....i like being in the know.

five plus stars.
author: coffeecake j.

description: Consistently great sandwiches and fun specials. I try to come here twice a month or so and they always remember my name. Try to come early if you can, they get very busy for lunch. Acoustics aren't great but I'm not going to take any stars for that.
author: yoon p.

description: I ordered sandwiches for 25 to be delivered through the catering menu. Justin was very responsive, answered my questions, and offered me a few flexible variations to accomodate my group's food preferences. The food was delivered punctually, he explained everything, and was friendly and efficient. And my, oh, my, scrumptious! It was a tad more expensive than a basic deli, but the quality was much higher. My group all spoke highly of the sammiches. I loved the Mila mozzarella tomato pesto sandwich in particular.
author: Jennifer C.

description: I had the Boca.  It was amazing.  Honestly, this was one of the best sandwiches I've ever had in my life.  Go eat here.  Now!
author: Juan R.

description:
they just updated their menu. as if i didn't already love them enough. this place just keeps getting the better. i had tried every sandwich until now i get to try all their new ones as well as some great salads. 
oh and by the way, the cookies you were trying out. keep them coming. they were insanely good.
author: Jorge E.

description: Food good, soup thick and nice, roast beef cut thick and tender enough to eat in a sandwich. Delivery was quick (1:40 pm) as should be. The delivery person was great too gaining access, petting my dogs and smiling the whole time. Great work! Only downer was no spoof provided for the soup. All else quality all the way. Found them and tried them based on Yelp reviews..the best!
author: Sam P.

description:
Sammich Heaven!  I was recently in SF and had the pleasure of sampling the menu at Deli Board, SF's new home for fantastic east coast deli-style grub.  My hands down favorite is the Mikey Likes It - piled high with THE BEST pastrami this side of NYC.  The special sauce made what was already the best pastrami sandwich i ever had 10 times better.  WOW.  Also of note was the Kosher club - real deal kosher salami!  Oy vey!

I have to agree with everyone else about the wings.  Baked (not fried) to crispy, juicy perfection.  I highly recommend getting yourself some - perfect for game day.

Perhaps the most surprising thing on the menu is the daily selection of savory bread pudding.  Imagine a ruben sandwich that you can eat like a piece of cake...you get the idea. 

And the best part?  You don't even have to get off your ass to go get it.  They will bring it to you!  If only there was a place like this in Seattle.
author: M A.

description: The boca is happiness wrapped up in love sealed with a hug plus a pound of meat. You know I'm in for trouble now. Quick delivery and amazing sandwiches means life is good once again.
author: Sophia C.

description:
Deli Board combines the satisfaction of eating the perfect sandwich with the thrill of a sidewalk drug deal.  Those of you who pick up will know what I'm talking about.  Regardless, this place is amazing.

Adam is a Sandwich making genius, and he never fails to deliver.  Check the board for his most recent creation, or order a classic off the menu.
author: Idin K.

description: Does take some time but most definitely worth the wait. Had the Ron and it was premium. Going again.....hours suck tho
author: Chris A.

description: Only gave this place a few stars on my first review because a few months or so ago my firm did catering and it wasn't the best (tho we skimped a bit and ordered the cheapest sandwiches)... That being said, I've now been to this place twice in the past few days because the pastrami sandwich is one of a kind.  Takes a little bit of time to get there from the financial district but its worth the walk.  Deli Board definitely trumps Ike's and Miller's so if you're in SF and looking for a good sandwich then this is the place to go.
author: Walter M.

description: I tried the Mish, Boca, and GoldnBergnStein, but I'd have to say the Mish was the best among the three. The smoked bacon really paired well with the corned beef. Super friendly staff- when we asked for something to munch on while waiting for our sandwiches, they brought out a cup of what seemed to be shrimp ceviche/salsa. Delicious. and it was free! Definitely try this place out if you're ever in the area!
author: Patrick P.

description: Nothing beats the "Fatty Alex".  It's a Fatty Matty with Chicken Salad instead of Tuna Salad.  It Rocks!
author: Alex M.

description: I love this place !  $11.00 FOR A SANDWICH ?!  Yes, but it's a FABulous sandwich, and it's a HUGE sandwich (enough for two lunches), and you get great big chunks of delectable dill pickles, on the side.  AND, the employees ALWAYS give you a beautiful, welcoming smile !
author: Eddie W.

description:
I ordered sandwiches for 12 for a work meeting. Adam was great to work with. I contacted him the day before, so I can't comment on how fast they could do a same-day work meeting thing. 
Only small hitch was that they forgot the sandwich I ordered for myself BUT they made another very fast trip to deliver it. Delivery guy was super nice.
All of the sandwiches looked really, really good and were large. Mine was fantastic, and I heard no complaints from anyone in the meeting--and no leftovers! 
Great value for casual work lunch.  I thought the dutch crunch bread was delicious. 
Will definitely keep them on our company list.
author: Anne E.

description: I am raving about this place, a new favorite Sandwhich spot in SF. Its a toss up betweent his and Ikes, but for me... Deli board wins!.
author: Lindsay G.

description: This is it- sandwich heaven! Go...enjoy! We had the ADM- awesome! Great service too- went back twice in the same day. Owner was super cool and talked with us. We'd go back next time we're in San Fran.
author: Julie H.

description: Deli Board's sandwiches are not to believed.  If I thought I could survive it, I'd eat them five days a week.
author: James B.

description: HOLY CRAP THIS PLACE IS GOOD! Some co-workers and I were feeling lazy because it was raining, so we ordered a few sandwiches on a whim (well, somebody suggested it). And let me just say that Maeday (grilled eggplant, "aubergine" to our European friends) was fricking TASTY [Spicoli accent]. I'm giving these guys a two-thumbs up and five-stars for a job well done!
author: Chris G.

description: OMG... did i just hit food heaven. This is the best turkey, bacon, avocado, spout sandwich ever... I got the Zeke and im still eating it... just had to review how amazing it is.
author: David C.

description: By far, the best Corned Beef and Pastrami in the City. I drop by often for take out and that staff amazingly remembers my name. It is either due to my drop dead good looks, my cute dog or perhaps my massive contributions to the tip jar.
author: michael l.

description: Ever have your co-workers hugging you en masse? That's what I get when I order food from Deli Board. The beef brisket and pastrami sandwiches are particularly popular. Buffalo wings also a big big hit. Next up - gonna try the soups. The only ding I give them is that the brownie/cookie platter for $60 lacks quantity.
author: EE C.

description: I love this place!!  Such great sandwiches and such friendly staff.  Makes my mouth water just thinking about it.  Call early as they get busy quick!
author: Reg H.

description: The best sandwiches in San Francisco.  I highly recommend the BG!!!
author: Eric F.

description:
Best sandwich place in the Bay. Had four different sandwiches now and can write really nice descriptive words about the meats, breads and mere size of these babies. 

But the bottom line is that the Deli Board is amazing. Wait a year and watch it become a SF tourist attraction.

keep up the good work, Deli Board. Thanks for numerous amazing meals!!!!
author: Ilan F.

description: It's true. This is the best sandwich shop in the city. The Dutch Crunch is just as crunch as it should be, the corned beef is incredible, they slather this amazing mayo on it, and it's just pure sandwich perfection. Once you try these guys, you'll never go back to Ike's. Unless it's sometime not between 11-2 on a Tuesday thru Friday. Stupid lame hours.
author: Mark A.

description:
great sandwiches! not boring run-of-the-mill deli sandwiches either
the meat is seasoned well, and the bread is soft and delicious.
reason for the 1-star dock - 30 minute wait
reason for not 2-star dock - friendly staff
will definitely return, but next time i'll call ahead
author: Deka M.

description: Seriously the most delicious and decadent sandwiches in SOMA. Super juicy without getting soggy (if you eat them in a reasonable amount of time.),each of the three sandwiches I've tried has been primo. Call ahead and order to reduce wait time when you're going in for a pickup.
author: Carla C.

description: The Boca is the best meat sandwich in the City.  Ask for cold slaw instead of the pickle they typically use...it's a freaky good upgrade. Ask for extra meat and you won't need dinner that night. Be sure to order your sando over the phone and pick up at the window on Howard. It's the easiest way, since there is no retail store front to sit down, which is fine with me with me since I don't have much time at lunch anyway. 5 stars, this place knows what they are doing.
author: Dan F.

description: The sandwiches are super tasty, albeit a tad pricey. I say ditch the pickles and add some other fancy side.
author: Mark C.

description: Finally hit this place up after some good word of mouth.  I am blessed to have such a good spot within my work's block radius.  This part of SOMA really needed another decent lunch option and this is it.
author: Casey H.

description: Yummy! had the sha sha (turkey with bacon on Dutch crunch).  The meat is sliced super thin so it melts in your mouth, not to mention its piled so high you just stare in awe once you split it into two halves.  The Dutch crunch is soft all the way through except for the top that has just the right amount of crunch, but not so much to cut your gums up. The bacon is meaty, crunchy, and thick adding just enough salt for me.  Adam the owner is so nice.  You can feel he cares!  He brought us some chili to try that was so good, I thought about getting some to go; but my sandwich was so stuffed with meat I couldn't eat the other half and had to take that to go.
author: Tabitha S.

description: I'm so glad I found this place!  Deli Board has become my go-to spot when I need to have work lunches catered.  The food is consistently tasty and it pleases a crowd (people rave!).  Plus their delivery is reliable and prompt.  Whenever I've requested delivery by a specific time they are there. On top of that with staff that has always been friendly and helpful.  First rate!
author: miko r.

description:
This place is okay. I read the fantastic Yelp reviews and it's close my work, so I had to try it. I was pretty disappointed by it. 

When you get there, you wait outside and somebody will come outside to take your order. It was really disorganized and they took orders from people who was waiting shorter than others. I didn't like this at all. I didn't like this place is like in a garage or something...way awkward.

The sandwich I had was just okay. I have definitely have had better sandwiches in San Francisco, like Ice's Place or AK Subs. I feel it's pretty overpriced for what you're getting.

I can't say I won't be going back, but I may go back.
author: Kimberly N.

description: 5 stars! Soma is coming up. I love Ike's but Deliboard steps it up with their handcrafted sandwiches stacked high with amazing meat. My only complaint is they're not open on Sundays.
author: B Y.

description: I needed something last-minute to bring to a football party at a friends house, so called them up and they had 2 dozen hot wings ready for me when I got to their kitchen on Howard Street in SOMA. The sauce was absolutely the best. Great taste and just the right amount of spice. Very reasonably priced.
author: Jeff L.

description: Just ordered the Boca and my wife had the Sha Sha. Both sandwiches were piping hot and chock full of tasty tasty meat. I'm lucky to have them right down the street. Please eat here early and often.
author: Aaron S.

description: Best Chicken Salad sandwiches! Little place with no official storefront. I called ahead to order four sandwiches to take to a business meeting. Staff was way friendly and enthusiastic about the business, which is always a good sign. Every one of the sandwiches got rave reviews!
author: Dennis H.

description: DELISH!  great sandos.  the french roll is amazing.
author: Melanie C.

description:
Lordamercy! This place is off the changelist!!! 

I rolled in there and had a Bocca - meat esplosion foyaface!!!! After that I had x-ray vision, and all the women around me ran. But on the serious tip, thisp place has super amazing sandwiches, and everyone is really friendly. I recommend you order out for your next lunch meeting or bbq throwdown sitch. Deli Board definitely tests positive for freshness...
author: chris m.

description: Great sandwich choices. The sandwiches were packed with ingredients including plenty of meat and served warm. Friendly staff, quick service.
author: Sara K.

description:
Deli Board where have you been all my life?  I've worked in downtown SF in the corporate world for the past 12 years.  Today I've found you...Deli Board is the tastiest catered lunch I've had.  Do yourself a favor and get 8-10 co-workers together, call deli board, and get an assortment of sandwiches delivered.  Be a lunchtime super hero.  Do it.  Tell me if I'm wrong...

Oh, make sure to get some spinach dip and bagel chips.  The scary thing is that deli board is known for their SOUPS.  Next time.
author: chad t.

description: i think it OK.  theres nothing special about the sandwich.  i give it 4 stars for hella-meat that they put on it!
author: Nathan J.

description: Some of the best sandwiches in the Bay Area. They have both a fixed menu and daily specials that will draw you in. Wonderful place to grab lunch. And with an actual store now opening in SOMA, it's a good draw to an up and coming area.
author: Scott S.

description:
if you are looking for a good deli, you got to try this place!
the bald cook with the goatee has the best corn beef in town.  hands down.
if you have a hungry crew lookin for some good take out, this is the place.  they change the menu every week; and each time i eat there, its better than the time before.  
you need to try the spicy wings; i thought kezar pub had the best wings in town until i went to the deli board and ate these delicious and spicy wings for NFL Sunday!  
The Deli Board is the PERFECT place to call up on a Sunday and order football food for your entire crew!
Best JEW food in town.
They are constantly changing their menu every week and delivery service is not only speedy, its well worth the wait.
author: Jon K.

description: Good for meat eaters, bleh for vegetarians. I've ordered 3 sandwiches from deli board and unfortunately haven't been happy with any of them. Deli Board is all about big, meaty cheesy sandwiches. I've found all the ones I've had are wayyyyyy to greasy, heavy and smothered in cheese. They've all come warm, which is bizarre for their veggie options. I riskily did the mr adams chef special a couple months ago and it was a greasy super cheese concoction with hot cucumbers, sprouts, cheese and sauce. I don't know about you but hot sprouts n cucumbers is kinda nasty between tons of cheese. My sandwich today was also covered in cheese and cream cheese, and had way too much squash and 'grilled' veggies, they were just slippery and mushy with all the cheese. I guess I would prefer the veg sandwiches to not be hot and not have so much cheese, something fresher would be amazing. If you eat meat this is your place!
author: Cori W.

description: I'm a BIG fan of Corned Beef, and Pastrami sandwiches on Rye bread, today I had my 1st Pastrami sandwich on a Dutch Crunch Roll. It was awesome, the pickles were awesome ! Tough to find a good Deli sandwich in S.F.. For 23 years I worked about 100 yards west of this place, good thing they weren't open then or I'd be a perfect circle. This was a top notch experience.
author: Mario C.
