description: I had to write a short update, to once again, sing the Deli Board's praises. I had to cater breakfast and lunch for an entire week while our office was aflutter with activity. Adam tweaked his menu to keep things creative each day and made a large group of hungry and tired guys extremely happy. The Deli Board satisfies even the pickiest palates.
author: Nicole G.

description:
Ordered  the Boca and the Kosher Club. Both are great choices.

Their ingredients are a testament of people who love to eat. The sandwiches are nicely balanced and leave you thinking about the next bite.

I've been to a lot of SF sandwhich shops and this is definitely in my top spots.
author: Eric H.

description: These guys make a mean hot wing! I had them cater a party recently and the food was stellar. We had flaming hot wings, creamy mac and cheese (made with good cheese!), spinach dip in a fresh baked giant bread bowl and pasta salad. They also brought a variety of dips and sauces and appetizers. Prices were very reasonable.
author: Alex S.

description: it was my first time eating here and it was a great experience. they had The Roots playing on the speakers and lady taking our order was a chill-ass person. it was hyped up to me that "the boca" was gona be added to my list of favorite sandwiches and it definitely was. the owner came out to greet me and my friend during our meal and actually took a snap of us enjoying our sandwiches with his new polaroid camera. it was awesome! thumbs up
author: anthony f.

description:
so the first thing you can say that this is my first yelp review so it doesnt count, but that being said i signed up on yelp JUST TO REVIEW DELI BOARD!
not only is it good to help the new guy, and help the small guy (for now) but if you are tired of the specialties junk at lunch, go for a FAT sando here
i recommend the BOCA, flown in east coast high quality meat and stacked high (always xtra pickles for me, which are made in house)
also, the thai chicken soup is a meal in itself....
if i was closer to downtown i would get every week, but i still get as much as i can! quality and nice big sandos..what else could you want?!
author: chris p.

description: oh man... the salami sandwich is ridiculous. I work with this guy's girlfriend and she had some delicious stuff left over. It brought a tear to my eye--classic style and indulgent tastes... I. WANT. MORE.
author: tim h.

description: I found Deli Board through a write-up on SFGate.  I'm normally skeptical of these new sandwich places like Ike's which always have lines which far exceed the quality of their food.  Deli Board is very good, however.  There is no corned beef or pastrami quite like New York corned beef and pastrami, and Katz's in NYC is the best of this type.  Deli Board has very thin cut corned beef and pastrami, not the sort of thing you would see in NY, but the flavor is excellent and the sandwiches are huge.  I think the meat-to-bread ratio is maybe a bit high, but overall the sandwiches are worth a bit of a wait, although I go early and never have had to wait.
author: Jeff M.

description: love this place.  the best sandwich!  so fresh....pickles, their 'board sauce' mmmm.  glad it's in my hood.
author: Amanda J.

description: Veggie sub was terrific! Buffalo mozz and avacado galore... and they have cherry peppers, which I love.
author: Johnny E.

description: If you like pastrami and corned beef sandwiches and have been feeling SF to be lacking in this department, this will make you feel much better.
author: jeremy m.

description: I really am dazzled by the meats at this little unassuming sandwich place.  I think maybe they should change the name....The "Corned Beef Castle", or "The Pastrami Palace" would work well, but of course then they would be ignoring the fabulous brisket, the Cleveland Stadium mustard, and all the other wonderful yummy things they have here.  The guy who runs the show is a meat magician and he cures and roasts all the meat himself.  He also puts a lot of love in what he makes and you can taste it.
author: Mara K.

description:
I am on a council that puts together small fundraising events for a local nonprofit called The Family House. We most recently did an event at Thieves Tavern. I swung by the night before to drop of flyers and put up posters and ran into the owner of Deli board, Adam. We began talking about the event and he asked if we had any food set up. At that point we did not, so Adam offered to cater the event for us at the last minute.

The night of the event, he showed up... just as everyone was starting to get hungry... and set up a wonderful spread of food! It was perfect, and people couldn't eat fast enough! Thieves Tavern smelled of amazing buffalo wings, and there was an assortment of pasta salad, sandwiches, delicious homemade bagel chips, and soup that was to die for! Adam's wonderful food and generosity helped make our event a success!

I can't thank you enough!!

Amy
author: Amy L.

description: I have been a couple of times and the few things I have tried have distinctly been way too salty. Personally, I also think it is a distinct failure and the result of total arogance that they don't have Rye as an option for corned beef and pastrami sandwiches. If they fixed these two things, I would up this rating to 4 stars instead of 2.
author: John S.

description: I ordered the Cousin Randy and the pastrami was delicious but I would not describe barely an inch of meat as "Piled High".   To still be hungry after a $11 sandwich makes it a luxury sandwich for me, I wont be back.
author: Joe A.

description: I am officially naming my first born after Adam of Deli Board. They are amazing, I order from them as much as possible, and now they have Alana's Buffalo Sauce. Buy 2! It's insane and going on everything I eat until it's gone :)
author: Alana W.

description: Holy mecca of huge crusty warm meaty paradise.  My previous favorite sandwiches were found in NYC or the streets of Saigon.  Thanks to Deli Board for bringing world class sandwiches to SOMA.  Come hungry, bring friends!
author: Jon A.

description:
I had a comparatively small business lunch (~8-10 people) that I needed to provide for a presentation.  Adam whipped up some extremely tasty sandwiches, pasta salad, and all the fixins and even delivered them to the downtown office where we were meeting.  Everything was gourmet and the presentation went great.  I would definitely order from this place again.  

Thanks Deli Board!
author: Xavier G.

description: holy hell this is a good sandwich.  like whoa!  only thing is that when you call in an order it takes about double the time they tell you it's going to.  for pregnant ladies like myself this is a little bit of an issue.  just make sure you order before you're actually hungry.
author: Samantha A.

description: Amazing sandwiches. A varied and regularly-changing menu. Friendly delivery people. Reasonably priced. Just be prepared to order early, might take up to an hour to get your order. But easily worth the wait.
author: Daniel M.

description: quite possibly the best sandwich in the city....great bread, amazing meat....fast delivery...very very very good...worth a try and ull love
author: Tyler L.

description: Had the Gold-n-Berg-n-Stein the other day.  It was totally delicious.  The bread was warm and crispy, the meat salty soft goodness and the sauce creamy zingy, yum.  Pickles were also excellent.  The staff were all super nice and the space feels comfy.  Great addition to the many wonderful new sandwich shops popping up around town!
author: Preeti M.

description:
I've never posted anything on Yelp before, but I feel the word needs to get out on this place.  

Adam has perfected the art of making a mouth watering sandwich-don't forget  the special sauce!!!   This combined with his all American wings is perfect for a lazy Sunday watching the games or for clients that you might be trying to impress.

Have to fear when you order from Deli Board, you are in good hands, and will be coming back for more.
author: Collin M.

description: This place makes you realize you have no self control. The husband and I had the day off, so we decided to get food somewhere we can't normally go during regular business hours. Thanks to Yelp, we checked out the Deli Board. We were a little confused by the nondescript entrance and the fact that they took our order on the sidewalk, but the guys there were super nice and helpful. I ordered the "bg" (brisket, with cheddar cheese, peppers, house slaw, tomato, pickles, red onion, and board sauce on a sweet french roll). He got the "Mal" (corned beef and pastrami with muentser cheese, house slaw, brown mustard, and board sauce on sourdough). Holy crap, these things were ridiculicious. My brisket was piled high and so tender it barely required chewing. The bread deserves equal praise--soft and soaked in the brisket juices, but burly enough to handle all that meat (that's what she said). Based on the size of the sandwich and that I haven't worked out all week, I had thought that I would only eat half, but I couldn't help myself and the next thing I knew, I was polishing off the last bite of the entire freaking sandwich, which was the size of a small dog. My husband said I'd regret it, and even though I am still painfully full 6 hours later, I'd do it all over again...
author: Angie Y.

description: I can now identify the best sandwich I've ever eaten.  I ate it today.  I'm still recovering.  It was the Boca.  It was delivered to my front door with surprising haste, and it was cheaper than most of the lunch places around here.  This will now be a weekly staple for me.  In order to maintain the price and the speed of delivery, I must ask you to refrain from ordering food from this establishment.  Thank you.
author: Dan M.

description: Don't mistake the shifty 2 point process of buying sandwiches here. These guys are for real. Amazing and huge sandwiches. The people out front are always really nice and masters at managing the crowd. Things have leveled out some since they opened. Now you can actually walk up, order and get your food with little wait.
author: Mark R.

description: Ike's used to be my favorite sandwich shop in the city. Not only is this place as tasty as Ike's, its a fraction of the cost. Don't go here expecting to sit though, they make these sandwiches out of what seems like an apartment. The person who took our order was very friendly and so were the other two people that we encountered who were also part of the staff. I wish this place was open all the time and did delivery!
author: Brandon E.

description:
We went there 2 days ago, just before they closed, right before 2pm... saw them on yelp the day before and since we were in the neighborhood (and hungry) decided to go check it out... We knew it was a delivery/pick-up place only and wanted to see what it was about...
Not sure if the guy out front was "Adam", but he was very friendly... my gf wanted to go there, but I told her "they might not be happy to have people going there right before they close..." and she said "not everyone is like that (gets annoyed when customers go in just before closing)..." She was right... The girl who came out to "take our order" was very friendly as well... We ordered the Zeke and Zoe... another guy had brought out the sandwiches and he was really friendly, too...
We took our 13-year old dog and sandwiches to the park... The three of us enjoyed the sandwiches... yes, including our dog... (btw, we don't feed junk food to him...) This was our first visit and it won't be our last... My gf says Deli Board is better than the Sandwich Shop and is different than Ike's in that DB's is fresh and simple... and the bread is better than Ike's... After seeing that review about DB's pastrami being the best, my gf definitely wants to try that... she's on a quest to find the best pastrami sandwich in SF...
author: joseph f.

description: Best sandwiches in San Francisco and a great value for what you get. Also has some awesome soups. Friendly service and they'll remember your name after one visit. Can't wait to get back to San Francisco so I can have another.
author: Tom M.

description: i love this place - if you eat an entire sandwich you will want a nap but they are so good its worth it. delivery is a bonus but standing outside with everyone else waiting to get your sandwich is fun as well.
author: Teri H.

description: Awesome sandwich spot.  I just ate a pastrami sandwich and really loved it.  The delivery is a convenient way to enjoy it if you work downtown.
author: Raman R.

description: A taste of new york here in the city!  Great meats!  Very well prepared and tender.  Every bite of every sandwich I tried here has been phenomenal.  The BG is my current favorite.  My only complaint is the wait...these guys are really busy so it's understandable.  I hope they expand soon and open up a place that can pumped these great sandwiches out quicker.  I won't knock them for being awesome or busy though, some things are worth the wait.  Good job DB!  Highly recommended
author: jacob s.

description: Ok, so I had a Dr. Appointment in FiDi on Saturday and was thinking about checking out Denis Leary's new spot, Golden West over on Trinity place, but it was closed, - punkass! On a whim, I decided to give Adam and crew a call to see if I could somehow convince them to make me a sandwich on Saturday since as far as I knew they only slanged sammies Mon-Fri. To my me and my wife's delight Adam tells us, "come on in, it's the first Saturday we are doing sammies, they will be waiting for you when you get here"....I ordered two "Amol's", how could I not? They were epic, so delicious, I can't describe how happy those moments of eating that sandwich made me. Adam even hooked me up with the usual "extra mustard" and offered to sell me a big gallon tub because I am hopelessly addicted to that stuff. The rest of the day was awesome, and I have to thank Adam and The Deli Board for helping me getting it started! I heart Deli Board!
author: Amol S.

description: All their sandwiches are amazing!!! Big, meaty and tasty.  Immediate addition to my weekly lunch rotation.
author: Camilo S.

description: Not much to say here.  Every sandwich lover within 50 miles needs to try this place.  Yes there is a weird "spy" like vibe when you walk up to a random apartment door and look at a faded menu in the window.  Yes there is a nice girl that comes out with a small notepad and takes your order and money while you question whether or not she's going to bail with it this time, and yes the sandwich will weigh more than your Shitszu.  But OMG, this sandwich is good.  It's what you would make if you had all day and your choice of the finest meats, marinated to perfection and sliced razor thin on a soft roll.  Did you know that Adam (the owner) is actually a soup master?  Next time you go, try the soup.  God knows I haven't been able to deviate from the sandwiches yet myself, but the soup is legit.  Too legit.
author: Danny K.

description: It's about time I give Deli Board the public review it deserves. I didn't get much sleep Sunday night, something having to do with a pair of lost keys... Anyway.. After renting a Zipcar and running some errands, I drove to Deli Board on Folsom to fill up my personal gas tank. I parked illegally outside and walked in. The queue had about 8 people, with 15 others waiting around for their orders. In my experience, this is the typical crowd size for "early" lunch. Problem- I only had 20 min left on my Zipcar reservation. Even if I got my food instantly I would have been delayed on the return. (As other Zipsters know, late returns carry a hefty penalty.) So that was my dilemma, sandwich or Zipcar. I chose the sandwich! This food is that good. I extended my Zipcar reservation over the phone (a monetary burden no doubt), got in the Deli Board queue, ordered the BK and sat down. In 10 minutes my fare was delivered to my table. The BK is a massive sando with the sole purpose of providing an all encompassing eating experience. Sausage, bacon and fried eggs, dressed with American cheese and that amazing homemade board sauce. Did someone say Dutch Crunch bread? I wasn't the only one excited to eat. There were many smiles in that building today. I'll be back soon.
author: Nicholas E.

description: One of the few places I have visited for the first time (on recommendation of a friend) whose sandwiches I like particularly great meaty sandwiches besides the turkey sandwiches.  Boca sandwich is great. I will certainly try other delicacies in future.
author: Noor s.

description: Ingenious.  Why didn't I think of this?  The only place in the city where slow, terrible service is excused.  Its that good.
author: Sina A.

description: Found myself in SF for St. Patty's and, coming from Cleveland, was disappointed to find a lack of festivities.  Ended up in a bar where I serendipitously found a native Clevelander [Adam], who had his corned beef sent from Cleveland to make my sandwich.  Not that Cleveland has a lot to brag about, but it was nice to see someone serious about his sandwich.
author: Beth K.

description: Thank you SO much.  Everyone was super impressed and excited by the warm cookies!  Everyone here is tired of Specialties, so DeliBoard was a welcomed change.  Your food spoke for itself in my last order and your consistency has made me a faithful friend.  Thanks for feeding us well.
author: Julie J.

description: I am proud to be a patron of the most professional, delicious and attentive catering companies in town! Deli Board consistantly delivers quality. We have used Deli Board for large groups and small groups. My people ask for the hummus! Not only is Deli Board a local business but they are also a pleasure to work with!
author: Melissa l.

description: I'm sold!  The place to go for lunch in the Mission is the Deli Board on Fulton Street.  This is a deli with a Cleveland flair and it doesn't disappoint.  My wife and I arrived about 11:30 am. and were glad we did, because the line gets long--out the door by noon.  But, even if you are in line, the service is very fast--Adam Mesnick, the owner, sees to that.  He has put together a wonderful menu of homemade soups and sandwiches that are spectacular.  We split the Boca and the Gold-n-Berg-n-stein (best sandwich ever!!!) sandwiches along with unique cream of spinach soup this week.  The sandwiches are piled high with flown-in corned beef and pastrami and settle in with a special sauce.  Served with a delicious pickle, they are flavorful, mouth watering and extremely satisfying.  The soup, one of Adam's specialties, was also not to be missed.  The ambiance is plain but funky.  Old lps on the record player are a nice touch.  Adam likes to join the customers (great touch) and the service is quick and friendly.  Now, if they add a cookie.
author: Richard L.

description: The ONLY reason I am summoning up the energy to write another "review" as a reluctant Yelper is because this place (Deli Board) is not just another singular example of how moronic Yelpers are. Nope - this one is TWICE the fun. Now these Yelper bozo's have created a Yelper "war" between the TWO most mediocre sandwich joints in town - Ike's and the Deli Board. I gotta say - it is just about as funny and idiotic as anything on Yelp to date. Instead of the usual hype and rant over some completely average (or less than average) single store front location in the bay area - we now have Yelper commentary on which is cooler - the limited hours of Deli Board or the tiny out-of-the-way location of Ike's. When you add in all the blathering about Ike's recent eviction woes - it is priceless Yelper over the top hype "please please think I am cool too" nonsense! I just can't take it anymore - I have tears in my eyes I am laughing so hard. The same thing happens to me when I drive by Ike's and see 20 idiots standing in line to buy a $10.00 sandwich that you could get across the street at Safeway for about half the price - and no waiting. OK - forgive me - Ike's is better than Safeway - but not much better - really it isn't - same for Deli Board. The sandwiches are good - not great - not even really good - they are good. Keep it up Yelpers - honestly - this has got my interest in you clowns peaked again. Just when I think you can't get any more mindbogglingly stupid - you do. Congrats!
author: stephanie d.

description: best corned beef and pastrami in SF sandwich in SF, no contest.
author: Jonathan H.
